string.ID: Live and drink.

strings.string: ▶Live and drink.

string.ID: {{emote|*Barathrum mumbles inaudibly.*}}

strings.string: ▶{{emote|*Barathrum mumbles inaudibly.*}}

string.ID:
{{emote|*Barathrum's countenance suddenly gravens.*}}
O.. I know it to be arduous for you, meyvn, to see me like this. The imago unstrung...

strings.string:
▶{{emote|*Barathrum's countenance suddenly gravens.*}}
O.. I know it to be arduous for you, meyvn, to see me like this. The imago unstrung...

string.ID: I am sorry, =name=. I am so proud of you! I wish... I wish it were I did not peel, like your model.

strings.string: ▶I am sorry, =name=. I am so proud of you! I wish... I wish it were I did not peel, like your model.

string.ID: Farewell, now, meyvn. =name=. Live and drink.

strings.string: ▶Farewell, now, meyvn. =name=. Live and drink.

string.ID:
{{emote|*Barathrum's countenance suddenly gravens.*}}
Child. There is much more I would have liked to share. But... I am a puppet of my shame.

strings.string:
▶{{emote|*Barathrum's countenance suddenly gravens.*}}
Child. There is much more I would have liked to share. But... I am a puppet of my shame.

string.ID: {{emote|*Barathrum mumbles inaudibly.*}}

strings.string: ▶{{emote|*Barathrum mumbles inaudibly.*}}

string.ID: {{emote|*Barathrum weeps.*}}

strings.string: ▶{{emote|*Barathrum weeps.*}}

string.ID:
We've-
We've done it, =name=. I-

strings.string:
▶We've-
We've done it, =name=. I-

string.ID: Only in the Shallows' dawnstirs did I let myself think it possible. And now...

strings.string: ▶Only in the Shallows' dawnstirs did I let myself think it possible. And now...

string.ID:
{{emote|*Barathrum exhales with effort.*}}
Let us sort our faculties before we reach the rim of our ascent. There is the edge of our journey still to lathe.

strings.string:
▶{{emote|*Barathrum exhales with effort.*}}
Let us sort our faculties before we reach the rim of our ascent. There is the edge of our journey still to lathe.

string.ID: Barathrum, let us again talk about the past.

strings.string: ▶Barathrum, let us again talk about the past.

string.ID: The Templar are defeated, but will they return in force?

strings.string: ▶The Templar are defeated, but will they return in force?

string.ID: Barathrum, you look pained. Are you well?

strings.string: ▶Barathrum, you look pained. Are you well?

string.ID: By your guess, what awaits us where the Spindle breaks?

strings.string: ▶By your guess, what awaits us where the Spindle breaks?

string.ID: I would like a moment, Barathrum.

strings.string: ▶I would like a moment, Barathrum.

string.ID: I cannot say, =name=. But I know it's facile to believe a living heritage can be evanesced in one stroke. We are always downstream of a past violence.

strings.string: ▶I cannot say, =name=. But I know it's facile to believe a living heritage can be evanesced in one stroke. We are always downstream of a past violence.

string.ID:
{{emote|*Barathrum shifts his weight, pauses, and flexes an arthritic paw.*}}
I am sorry. Tis the acceleration, =name=. I am whirling and empty of breath. Steel yourself, and so shall I.

strings.string:
▶{{emote|*Barathrum shifts his weight, pauses, and flexes an arthritic paw.*}}
I am sorry. Tis the acceleration, =name=. I am whirling and empty of breath. Steel yourself, and so shall I.

string.ID:
{{emote|*Barathrum pauses.*}}
O, =name=, our cursors draw together on Fate's phenomenic slide rule! You burn with speculation, and I- I molder in the coolness of knowing. I enter my dwarf phase.

strings.string:
▶{{emote|*Barathrum pauses.*}}
O, =name=, our cursors draw together on Fate's phenomenic slide rule! You burn with speculation, and I- I molder in the coolness of knowing. I enter my dwarf phase.

string.ID: {{emote|*Barathrum takes in a long breath.*}}

strings.string: ▶{{emote|*Barathrum takes in a long breath.*}}

string.ID:
O, deceit! The grueling gate I crossed on every tilt of glittering dusk. I slept in my crimeclothes and wept, did you hear?
Or could you hear only the damnable static, like me, and speak naught to the machine that belches it out. Heal none of the wounds of its grievous heart, or mine own...
O, oh... So much to bear.

strings.string:
▶O, deceit! The grueling gate I crossed on every tilt of glittering dusk. I slept in my crimeclothes and wept, did you hear?
Or could you hear only the damnable static, like me, and speak naught to the machine that belches it out. Heal none of the wounds of its grievous heart, or mine own...
O, oh... So much to bear.

string.ID: I found a torn sheet of graph paper with a note about deceit. Was it yours?

strings.string: ▶I found a torn sheet of graph paper with a note about deceit. Was it yours?

string.ID: Your crimeclothes? There was a codex about crimes and punishments near the bedroll in your study. What was it?

strings.string: ▶Your crimeclothes? There was a codex about crimes and punishments near the bedroll in your study. What was it?

string.ID: The svardym Mak said he was born to a cacophony of static ringing his ears raw. Could it have been the signal?

strings.string: ▶The svardym Mak said he was born to a cacophony of static ringing his ears raw. Could it have been the signal?

string.ID: The Svardym Geeub mentioned a machine speaker and her ursine apprentice. Was that you?

strings.string: ▶The Svardym Geeub mentioned a machine speaker and her ursine apprentice. Was that you?

string.ID: Rebekah was a healer. But the daughters of Exile, her acolytes, are tinkers. Why?

strings.string: ▶Rebekah was a healer. But the daughters of Exile, her acolytes, are tinkers. Why?

string.ID: Barathrum, I don't understand.

strings.string: ▶Barathrum, I don't understand.

string.ID:
Yes, that paper, twas mine. This racket of a Signal is mine, too, of sorts.
It is my tolling bell.

strings.string:
▶Yes, that paper, twas mine. This racket of a Signal is mine, too, of sorts.
It is my tolling bell.

string.ID: Your tolling bell?

strings.string: ▶Your tolling bell?

string.ID: That codex? A comfort, a guidebook, a ledger. My crimes have no signatories, but the heart is its own document.

strings.string: ▶That codex? A comfort, a guidebook, a ledger. My crimes have no signatories, but the heart is its own document.

string.ID: What crimes, Barathrum?

strings.string: ▶What crimes, Barathrum?

string.ID: Svardym Mak's static? Yes, twas the Signal. My signal. My tolling bell.

strings.string: ▶Svardym Mak's static? Yes, twas the Signal. My signal. My tolling bell.

string.ID: Your tolling bell?

strings.string: ▶Your tolling bell?

string.ID:
Apprentice. So long since I've worn that title, but it feels right still.
Yes, twas me at the machine speaker's side.

strings.string:
▶Apprentice. So long since I've worn that title, but it feels right still.
Yes, twas me at the machine speaker's side.

string.ID: Who was the machine speaker?

strings.string: ▶Who was the machine speaker?

string.ID:
She was a healer, yes. The wire cutter can perform the work of a scalpel; and the soldering iron, a suture.
To take apart a history, and stitch something new...

strings.string:
▶She was a healer, yes. The wire cutter can perform the work of a scalpel; and the soldering iron, a suture.
To take apart a history, and stitch something new...

string.ID: What did she take apart?

strings.string: ▶What did she take apart?

string.ID:
{{emote|*Barathrum pauses.*}}
Forgive me, =name=. The ascent strains the mind as well as the body. My flight of fancy is done; I am regrounded.

strings.string:
▶{{emote|*Barathrum pauses.*}}
Forgive me, =name=. The ascent strains the mind as well as the body. My flight of fancy is done; I am regrounded.

string.ID:
{{emote|*Barathrum pauses and frowns.*}}
Do you know, =name=, the engine types that ask us to loose every pin and unhinge every cam to know them? Such an engine of culture we are encased in now, and I cannot speak to the workings of one gearset without disassembling them all. I meant not to tease, and soon, I promise, you will spy the next arc of our journey.

strings.string:
▶{{emote|*Barathrum pauses and frowns.*}}
Do you know, =name=, the engine types that ask us to loose every pin and unhinge every cam to know them? Such an engine of culture we are encased in now, and I cannot speak to the workings of one gearset without disassembling them all. I meant not to tease, and soon, I promise, you will spy the next arc of our journey.

string.ID: I will wait, Barathrum.

strings.string: ▶I will wait, Barathrum.

string.ID: Barathrum, if the past has some relevance to this moment, I would ask you to share what you know.

strings.string: ▶Barathrum, if the past has some relevance to this moment, I would ask you to share what you know.

string.ID: {{emote|*Barathrum sighs.*}}

strings.string: ▶{{emote|*Barathrum sighs.*}}

string.ID: It is done, then. Have the explication you are owed.

strings.string: ▶It is done, then. Have the explication you are owed.

string.ID: You see, =name=, when I, a young bruin, crossed the Homs Delta with my flood-fleeing clan and into the western reach of Qud, the plagues of the Gyre were already ascendant. We took root at our new hearth, in the chrome grottos where we urshiib find natural peace, and by the providence of my elders, I was able to study the tinkering craft.

strings.string: ▶You see, =name=, when I, a young bruin, crossed the Homs Delta with my flood-fleeing clan and into the western reach of Qud, the plagues of the Gyre were already ascendant. We took root at our new hearth, in the chrome grottos where we urshiib find natural peace, and by the providence of my elders, I was able to study the tinkering craft.

string.ID:
Through my work I caught the attention of a master machinist, unconventional of method, who took me under her wing and, in time, availed me of the orphic truth.
She explained, as I've shared with you and the rest of the acolytes, that the world we know once belonged to a grand Coven of beings who spanned the stars. And that, acting on some inscrutable logic, they disappeared. That an injunction was placed on our world.
This, you know. It is the truth I told, if only half. But Rebekah taught me more.

strings.string:
▶Through my work I caught the attention of a master machinist, unconventional of method, who took me under her wing and, in time, availed me of the orphic truth.
She explained, as I've shared with you and the rest of the acolytes, that the world we know once belonged to a grand Coven of beings who spanned the stars. And that, acting on some inscrutable logic, they disappeared. That an injunction was placed on our world.
This, you know. It is the truth I told, if only half. But Rebekah taught me more.

string.ID:
Atop the implausible rise of the Spindle roosted a Seraph, one of the great machinic archons of the Eaters, and this being Rebekah served.
In the short years before I arrived in Qud, the Seraph became convinced that something had changed in the cosmic order. That along the ecliptic of the Folk Clock, some uncounted peg had slid to a priming position, and that the Coven was set to imminently return.

strings.string:
▶Atop the implausible rise of the Spindle roosted a Seraph, one of the great machinic archons of the Eaters, and this being Rebekah served.
In the short years before I arrived in Qud, the Seraph became convinced that something had changed in the cosmic order. That along the ecliptic of the Folk Clock, some uncounted peg had slid to a priming position, and that the Coven was set to imminently return.

string.ID: The Folk Clock?

strings.string: ▶The Folk Clock?

string.ID: The Seraph spoke of a Great Machine that spanned galaxies, the motion of whose sails and gear trains directed the fluidic shifting of stars and cultures. But they spoke little of it, and little I know.

strings.string: ▶The Seraph spoke of a Great Machine that spanned galaxies, the motion of whose sails and gear trains directed the fluidic shifting of stars and cultures. But they spoke little of it, and little I know.

string.ID:
{{emote|*Barathrum coughs and swallows.*}}
To ready our world for the Coven's return, the Seraph, who would be called Resheph, became convinced that all higher life on the planet must... be purged. That it was our life and way of living that moved the Coven to set the injunction. The only way through was for a new life to obtain.

strings.string:
▶{{emote|*Barathrum coughs and swallows.*}}
To ready our world for the Coven's return, the Seraph, who would be called Resheph, became convinced that all higher life on the planet must... be purged. That it was our life and way of living that moved the Coven to set the injunction. The only way through was for a new life to obtain.

string.ID:
And so, Resheph seeded the plagues and whorled them via waveform to a breathing gyre. Blights engineered to attack life whilst preserving the planet's artifacts of glass and chrome.
Rebekah, dear tutor, betrayed Resheph's confidences and apprised me of the plan, so that I might help her dash it apart and save the peoples of our world.

strings.string:
▶And so, Resheph seeded the plagues and whorled them via waveform to a breathing gyre. Blights engineered to attack life whilst preserving the planet's artifacts of glass and chrome.
Rebekah, dear tutor, betrayed Resheph's confidences and apprised me of the plan, so that I might help her dash it apart and save the peoples of our world.

string.ID: I asked for time. Give me time. To reform Qud, extinguish the hatefulness and needless warmaking, to lift our world across the eschaton and prepare it for the Coven's return...

strings.string: ▶I asked for time. Give me time. To reform Qud, extinguish the hatefulness and needless warmaking, to lift our world across the eschaton and prepare it for the Coven's return...

string.ID:
After a storm of shrapnel words, the Seraph acceded to ten centuries.
Ten centuries! An eyeblink on the scales of the Folk Clock but an eternity for us. So I believed.
The rousing Signal would cease, the plagues of the Gyre would be reversed, to the extent they could; for even the potent archon had not full governance over what they had worked into being.

strings.string:
▶After a storm of shrapnel words, the Seraph acceded to ten centuries.
Ten centuries! An eyeblink on the scales of the Folk Clock but an eternity for us. So I believed.
The rousing Signal would cease, the plagues of the Gyre would be reversed, to the extent they could; for even the potent archon had not full governance over what they had worked into being.

string.ID: What would there be for the Coven to return to, if life on our world was purged?

strings.string: ▶What would there be for the Coven to return to, if life on our world was purged?

string.ID: Why had Resheph become sultan?

strings.string: ▶Why had Resheph become sultan?

string.ID: Resheph is remembered as a healer.

strings.string: ▶Resheph is remembered as a healer.

string.ID: How did the agreement play out?

strings.string: ▶How did the agreement play out?

string.ID: Then you did not succeed, by Resheph's measure?

strings.string: ▶Then you did not succeed, by Resheph's measure?

string.ID: I asked Resheph that very question. But the seraphim transit an ethical manifold much different than our own.

strings.string: ▶I asked Resheph that very question. But the seraphim transit an ethical manifold much different than our own.

string.ID: Once the Seraph had become convinced of the Coven's return, they reified their authority and assumed a more material role in onworld matters. The decaying sultanate was a convenient tool.

strings.string: ▶Once the Seraph had become convinced of the Coven's return, they reified their authority and assumed a more material role in onworld matters. The decaying sultanate was a convenient tool.

string.ID: And he was, of a sort. The cure for a plague is often too its cause. With one's paws on the dials and drum of power, history is a cloth to be loomspun.

strings.string: ▶And he was, of a sort. The cure for a plague is often too its cause. With one's paws on the dials and drum of power, history is a cloth to be loomspun.

string.ID:
We allied on the notion that the sultanate must be abolished for the future to flower. I was to execute the earthly plan, while Resheph continued preparations at the astronomical tier. To achieve a sort of bicameralism of action, Resheph insisted on reformatting their personality as a triumvirate, seeded from thin scans of the original archon, Rebekah, and myself.
The art of mythmaking was employed to enshrine the Resheph persona. Thus- the healer, the Coiled Lamb, and perhaps unexpectedly, the Above.

strings.string:
▶We allied on the notion that the sultanate must be abolished for the future to flower. I was to execute the earthly plan, while Resheph continued preparations at the astronomical tier. To achieve a sort of bicameralism of action, Resheph insisted on reformatting their personality as a triumvirate, seeded from thin scans of the original archon, Rebekah, and myself.
The art of mythmaking was employed to enshrine the Resheph persona. Thus- the healer, the Coiled Lamb, and perhaps unexpectedly, the Above.

string.ID: What happened to Rebekah?

strings.string: ▶What happened to Rebekah?

string.ID:
{{emote|*Barathrum inhales and stutters.*}} She-
Resheph would not forgive her trespass. She contracted the rotting tongue while abetting the lepers of =RebekahRegion=. When her time came, she-

strings.string:
▶{{emote|*Barathrum inhales and stutters.*}} She-
Resheph would not forgive her trespass. She contracted the rotting tongue while abetting the lepers of =RebekahRegion=. When her time came, she-

string.ID:
Resheph would not let her return home. O..
{{emote|*Barathrum expels a hushed whimper.*}}

strings.string:
▶Resheph would not let her return home. O..
{{emote|*Barathrum expels a hushed whimper.*}}

string.ID:
{{emote|*Barathrum whimpers.*}}
-what? Who's there?

strings.string:
▶{{emote|*Barathrum whimpers.*}}
-what? Who's there?

string.ID: It is me, Barathrum. =name=.

strings.string: ▶It is me, Barathrum. =name=.

string.ID: If the signal sounds and the Gyre widens again, then you did not reach whatever watermark Resheph set?

strings.string: ▶If the signal sounds and the Gyre widens again, then you did not reach whatever watermark Resheph set?

string.ID: Oh. Good, =name=, good...

strings.string: ▶Oh. Good, =name=, good...

string.ID:
No... Qud is fractious, and no lasting peace has obtained. I tried... for decades on decades I tried our paws on the tiller, to shim together what blossomed in the wild...
The restoration of machines, the federation of free sovranties, the nourishing rituals of salt and star, the sacred, the profane...

strings.string:
▶No... Qud is fractious, and no lasting peace has obtained. I tried... for decades on decades I tried our paws on the tiller, to shim together what blossomed in the wild...
The restoration of machines, the federation of free sovranties, the nourishing rituals of salt and star, the sacred, the profane...

string.ID:
In the late years I saw the writing on the wall. I turned us inward, retreated to my candle-dim study to angle at the project alone. A new plan... {{emote|*eeehw*}} was-
{{emote|*Barathrum starts panting.*}}

strings.string:
▶In the late years I saw the writing on the wall. I turned us inward, retreated to my candle-dim study to angle at the project alone. A new plan... {{emote|*eeehw*}} was-
{{emote|*Barathrum starts panting.*}}

string.ID: {{emote|*Barathrum heaves a great sigh upon the moist air of the control pit.*}} {{emote|*Barathrum stumbles to the floor with paws to his face.*}}

strings.string: ▶{{emote|*Barathrum heaves a great sigh upon the moist air of the control pit.*}} {{emote|*Barathrum stumbles to the floor with paws to his face.*}}

string.ID:
I failed it! I have failed! A thousand years too short, and- MORE TIME
{{emote|*Barathrum weeps.*}}

strings.string:
▶I failed it! I have failed! A thousand years too short, and- MORE TIME
{{emote|*Barathrum weeps.*}}

string.ID: I am debased on the plank across the light of God! d- do I have a rightful claim to pity? Blindness! This darkling room abjures the light. Is this the House of Judgement, Hortensa? Or mere penumbra, the child's playcave, and law and language (not yet invented) cast their forcing functions back through time to puppet the unblossomed mind to civilized shape...

strings.string: ▶I am debased on the plank across the light of God! d- do I have a rightful claim to pity? Blindness! This darkling room abjures the light. Is this the House of Judgement, Hortensa? Or mere penumbra, the child's playcave, and law and language (not yet invented) cast their forcing functions back through time to puppet the unblossomed mind to civilized shape...

string.ID: Each of us is a sick animal in a darkling thicket. Each cursed with machinery to compress the clamber of echoes into bees, mothers, mountains, country. How many millions of snowsick years to sew a feeling substance into an agent of the world! A felt and machine animal, and in so doing, to stuff the whole of the world inside the agent (an inarguable document of its falsity), for agency is in its very definition the world in containment acting on itself...

strings.string: ▶Each of us is a sick animal in a darkling thicket. Each cursed with machinery to compress the clamber of echoes into bees, mothers, mountains, country. How many millions of snowsick years to sew a feeling substance into an agent of the world! A felt and machine animal, and in so doing, to stuff the whole of the world inside the agent (an inarguable document of its falsity), for agency is in its very definition the world in containment acting on itself...

string.ID: {{emote|*Barathrum weeps.*}}

strings.string: ▶{{emote|*Barathrum weeps.*}}

string.ID: {{emote|*Barathrum weeps.*}}

strings.string: ▶{{emote|*Barathrum weeps.*}}

string.ID: Why ascend the Spindle then? For what purpose?

strings.string: ▶Why ascend the Spindle then? For what purpose?

string.ID:
{{emote|*Barathrum's countenance suddenly burns bright.*}}
Did you know, =name=, I harbor a memory older than even the flooding of my hearth cave. A gleaming ancient tale, told by my elders to the nippy cub I once was...

strings.string:
▶{{emote|*Barathrum's countenance suddenly burns bright.*}}
Did you know, =name=, I harbor a memory older than even the flooding of my hearth cave. A gleaming ancient tale, told by my elders to the nippy cub I once was...

string.ID:
In the age of the covenate, a coterie of our urshiib ancestors took to the stars to ply their burning cores! Can you envision it??
Ho, ho! I know a secret! Heh, heh! I know... there is a functioning starship atop the Spindle. We can take it, =name=! We launch ourselves into the deepness of the dusted cosmos and find the starshiib! You and I, ho ho!
Starshiib!

strings.string:
▶In the age of the covenate, a coterie of our urshiib ancestors took to the stars to ply their burning cores! Can you envision it??
Ho, ho! I know a secret! Heh, heh! I know... there is a functioning starship atop the Spindle. We can take it, =name=! We launch ourselves into the deepness of the dusted cosmos and find the starshiib! You and I, ho ho!
Starshiib!

string.ID: Barathrum, we're to rest the fate of Qud on a mere cub's tale?

strings.string: ▶Barathrum, we're to rest the fate of Qud on a mere cub's tale?
▶Starshiib?

string.ID: Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib!

strings.string: ▶Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib!
▶Barathrum.
▶Starshiib!

string.ID: Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib!

strings.string: ▶Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib! Starshiib!

string.ID: Should you be here, =player.offspringTerm=?

strings.string: ▶Should you be here, =player.offspringTerm=?

string.ID: My apologies, Barathrum.

strings.string: ▶My apologies, Barathrum.

string.ID: Is that you, nestling =name=? Are you returned from gate and Tomb? Come closer, I say.

strings.string: ▶Is that you, nestling =name=? Are you returned from gate and Tomb? Come closer, I say.

string.ID: It is, Barathrum. I've returned.

strings.string: ▶It is, Barathrum. I've returned.

string.ID: You appear... refreshed. My old eyes spy the swim lines of the waking world and to you they cede precedence. A newness obtains.

strings.string: ▶You appear... refreshed. My old eyes spy the swim lines of the waking world and to you they cede precedence. A newness obtains.

string.ID: Outside of time I found myself in a place of light. I chose to return and was made new.

strings.string: ▶Outside of time I found myself in a place of light. I chose to return and was made new.

string.ID: I found Brightsheol, where it lies beyond the Tomb. I spoke to the Shomer there and arranged for the disablement of the Spindle's magnets.

strings.string: ▶I found Brightsheol, where it lies beyond the Tomb. I spoke to the Shomer there and arranged for the disablement of the Spindle's magnets.

string.ID: Over there, by your workbench. Is that... Pax Klanq?

strings.string: ▶Over there, by your workbench. Is that... Pax Klanq?

string.ID: There is junk about.

strings.string: ▶There is junk about.

string.ID:
{{emote|*Barathrum pauses.*}}
It is. For reasons I will explain shortly, for reasons beyond any of our remits, Klanq has returned to Grit Gate.

strings.string:
▶{{emote|*Barathrum pauses.*}}
It is. For reasons I will explain shortly, for reasons beyond any of our remits, Klanq has returned to Grit Gate.

string.ID: I've something else to say.

strings.string: ▶I've something else to say.

string.ID:
{{emote|*Barathrum pauses.*}}
Unusual circumstances have put my study in disarray. Lamentable, this is, but necessary.

strings.string:
▶{{emote|*Barathrum pauses.*}}
Unusual circumstances have put my study in disarray. Lamentable, this is, but necessary.

string.ID: I've something else to say.

strings.string: ▶I've something else to say.

string.ID:
{{emote|*Barathrum pauses.*}}
I am confident there is a richness of wisdom in the poetry of that statement. One day, I will be eager to discover it. For now, what of the Spindle?

strings.string:
▶{{emote|*Barathrum pauses.*}}
I am confident there is a richness of wisdom in the poetry of that statement. One day, I will be eager to discover it. For now, what of the Spindle?

string.ID: *continue listening*

strings.string: ▶*continue listening*

string.ID: Take this, too. A chute of morphing gel from my personal collection. You've arrayed yourself in the artifacts of time, and so we have little left to give you. But still, this may be useful.

strings.string: ▶Take this, too. A chute of morphing gel from my personal collection. You've arrayed yourself in the artifacts of time, and so we have little left to give you. But still, this may be useful.

string.ID: *continue listening*

strings.string: ▶*continue listening*

string.ID: Now, matters have... evolved... in your absence. Do you choose now to learn more?

strings.string: ▶Now, matters have... evolved... in your absence. Do you choose now to learn more?

string.ID: I do.

strings.string: ▶I do.

string.ID: First, I need rest.

strings.string: ▶First, I need rest.

string.ID: High on the mount above Omonporch, the Putus Templar watch us through their war lenses and prepare an attack. The nephilim, too, stir from their cradles on the Moon Stair and slump with infernal purpose. The short of this is, due to a dearth of prep time and inadequate armament, Pax Klanq no longer believes in the viability of Q Girl's climber design. We must take Klanq at their word, here...

strings.string: ▶High on the mount above Omonporch, the Putus Templar watch us through their war lenses and prepare an attack. The nephilim, too, stir from their cradles on the Moon Stair and slump with infernal purpose. The short of this is, due to a dearth of prep time and inadequate armament, Pax Klanq no longer believes in the viability of Q Girl's climber design. We must take Klanq at their word, here...

string.ID: *continue listening*

strings.string: ▶*continue listening*

string.ID: This disheartens us, but there is another hope. Klanq has offered up a new design, something unconventional at all angles. And, despite our early misgivings, Q Girl and I now work in assistance to the project...

strings.string: ▶This disheartens us, but there is another hope. Klanq has offered up a new design, something unconventional at all angles. And, despite our early misgivings, Q Girl and I now work in assistance to the project...

string.ID: *continue listening*

strings.string: ▶*continue listening*

string.ID: A new creature struggles to be born, =name=, and you will help birth it. Then, it will carry us, you and I, to the top of the Spindle.

strings.string: ▶A new creature struggles to be born, =name=, and you will help birth it. Then, it will carry us, you and I, to the top of the Spindle.

string.ID:
Pax Klanq will mold the creature from raw bioelectrical materials. You must gather these entrails: the body as a model, the catalyst to charge the sanguine fluid, the atzmus as deistic direction, the armament for protection, and the hamsa for personality. You will bond with the creature, too, and act as its pilot. So you must speak an incantation to inscribe the connection.
You'll also need to procure the sanguine fluid itself. And, too, a power source shielded from electromagnetic attacks.

strings.string:
▶Pax Klanq will mold the creature from raw bioelectrical materials. You must gather these entrails: the body as a model, the catalyst to charge the sanguine fluid, the atzmus as deistic direction, the armament for protection, and the hamsa for personality. You will bond with the creature, too, and act as its pilot. So you must speak an incantation to inscribe the connection.
You'll also need to procure the sanguine fluid itself. And, too, a power source shielded from electromagnetic attacks.

string.ID: These entrails, what are they? Where do I find them?

strings.string: ▶These entrails, what are they? Where do I find them?

string.ID: These entrails, what are they? Where do I find them?

strings.string: ▶These entrails, what are they? Where do I find them?

string.ID: I'm to pilot the creature? And bond with it?

strings.string: ▶I'm to pilot the creature? And bond with it?

string.ID: Sanguine fluid?

strings.string: ▶Sanguine fluid?

string.ID: A power source?

strings.string: ▶A power source?

string.ID: Let us begin, then.

strings.string: ▶Let us begin, then.

string.ID: I need time and space from this.

strings.string: ▶I need time and space from this.

string.ID: I wish to ask about something else.

strings.string: ▶I wish to ask about something else.

string.ID:
They are the components that we will grow, shape, and solder into the ascendant being. We can delve into specifics once you begin, at which point Pax Klanq can also serve as a source of knowledge.
As you acquire components, bring them to the mound of scrap and clay over by Klanq.

strings.string:
▶They are the components that we will grow, shape, and solder into the ascendant being. We can delve into specifics once you begin, at which point Pax Klanq can also serve as a source of knowledge.
As you acquire components, bring them to the mound of scrap and clay over by Klanq.

string.ID:
They are the components that we will grow, shape, and solder into the ascendant being. Ask Pax Klanq for details.
As you acquire components, bring them to the mound of scrap and clay over by Klanq.

strings.string:
▶They are the components that we will grow, shape, and solder into the ascendant being. Ask Pax Klanq for details.
As you acquire components, bring them to the mound of scrap and clay over by Klanq.

string.ID:
Correct. The creature will be shaped broad enough to contain two, but only you will be bonded to it. Only you will pilot.
Don't fear over an inescapable tether, though. The creature will be mobile unpiloted, if slower to act.

strings.string:
▶Correct. The creature will be shaped broad enough to contain two, but only you will be bonded to it. Only you will pilot.
Don't fear over an inescapable tether, though. The creature will be mobile unpiloted, if slower to act.

string.ID: Primordial soup, to be catalyzed and ran through its arteries as the animating substance.

strings.string: ▶Primordial soup, to be catalyzed and ran through its arteries as the animating substance.

string.ID:
Yes, the question of power is a trickier one. Our standard power sources might suffice, but they would be vulnerable to electromagnetic attacks on the ascent, and we believe it within the competency of the Putus Templar to execute such an attack.
This leaves us two options. Klanq and Q Girl have worked out a design for a neutronic battery, free from vulnerabilities on the EM spectrum. But it requires 3 drams of neutron flux. The alternative is remote power, but to carry us across the Spindle's length the source would have to be extraordinary. I would look to Chavvah, the Tree of Life, for a psychic quickening. Reports tell of the resumption of their roaming across the Moon Stair. Seek the trunk at Eyn Roj to begin your investigation, if that's the path you choose.

strings.string:
▶Yes, the question of power is a trickier one. Our standard power sources might suffice, but they would be vulnerable to electromagnetic attacks on the ascent, and we believe it within the competency of the Putus Templar to execute such an attack.

string.ID:
Yes, =name=! Begin the gathering, and the molding will follow. The materials you choose will influence the being we create, but any such being will be suitable for ascent.
This is our last task before we make our historic climb, =name=. Be safe and well in doing it. If you have more questions, return here. Klanq and I will be available.

strings.string:
▶Yes, =name=! Begin the gathering, and the molding will follow. The materials you choose will influence the being we create, but any such being will be suitable for ascent.
This is our last task before we make our historic climb, =name=. Be safe and well in doing it. If you have more questions, return here. Klanq and I will be available.
▶OK.

string.ID: The creature is born, and you are bonded? What work! You are a sterling shaper of world, =name=, and I've nothing left to give you but my praise.

strings.string: ▶The creature is born, and you are bonded? What work! You are a sterling shaper of world, =name=, and I've nothing left to give you but my praise.

string.ID:
Now, our operators at Omonporch confirm that a clash with the Templar is inevitable.
This is a grim fact, but it does give space for your bond to flower. Go, become familiar with leading and piloting your creature. Return when you are ready, and we will finally go starward.

strings.string:
▶Now, our operators at Omonporch confirm that a clash with the Templar is inevitable.
This is a grim fact, but it does give space for your bond to flower. Go, become familiar with leading and piloting your creature. Return when you are ready, and we will finally go starward.

string.ID: I will, Barathrum. Live and drink.

strings.string: ▶I will, Barathrum. Live and drink.

string.ID: Are you sure, Meyvn =name=? Our fates are not reversible past the next event horizon.

strings.string: ▶Are you sure, Meyvn =name=? Our fates are not reversible past the next event horizon.

string.ID: Let me consider.

strings.string: ▶Let me consider.

string.ID: We go.

strings.string: ▶We go.

string.ID: We go. I-

strings.string: ▶We go. I-

string.ID: O! What is it? I heave... I heave the weight of ass across my crutch, but the bones are pullproof. My bones inosculate to this grotto, or rather- this grotto, this world is what my bones *are*. Can an old bear divest of his spine, leave it to mosses and the sunstrung birds?

strings.string: ▶O! What is it? I heave... I heave the weight of ass across my crutch, but the bones are pullproof. My bones inosculate to this grotto, or rather- this grotto, this world is what my bones *are*. Can an old bear divest of his spine, leave it to mosses and the sunstrung birds?

string.ID:
I...
No matter. The will can break the wheel, too. We go. Pray, the weightloss of the rise might do good for me. Past the shell of the world, I'm to understand one's burdens can no longer pull them down...

strings.string:
▶I...
No matter. The will can break the wheel, too. We go. Pray, the weightloss of the rise might do good for me. Past the shell of the world, I'm to understand one's burdens can no longer pull them down...

string.ID: Klanq is able to answer your questions. You received an operating manual, too, no? Perhaps you could reference it.

strings.string: ▶Klanq is able to answer your questions. You received an operating manual, too, no? Perhaps you could reference it.

string.ID: Come closer, nestling. Let me look upon your countenance.

strings.string: ▶Come closer, nestling. Let me look upon your countenance.

string.ID: You are so... old.

strings.string: ▶You are so... old.

string.ID: Otho said you wished to speak with me.

strings.string: ▶Otho said you wished to speak with me.

string.ID: What's with the houseplant over there?

strings.string: ▶What's with the houseplant over there?

string.ID: Please tell me about the signal again.

strings.string: ▶Please tell me about the signal again.

string.ID: Please tell me about the signal again.

strings.string: ▶Please tell me about the signal again.

string.ID: I convinced Pax Klanq to construct the climber.

strings.string: ▶I convinced Pax Klanq to construct the climber.

string.ID: Pax Klanq has agreed to build the climber. What now?

strings.string: ▶Pax Klanq has agreed to build the climber. What now?

string.ID: Could you tell me again about the Tomb of the Eaters?

strings.string: ▶Could you tell me again about the Tomb of the Eaters?

string.ID: The magnetic field has been disable and the Spindle is free to ascend. What now?

strings.string: ▶The magnetic field has been disable and the Spindle is free to ascend. What now?

string.ID: Tell me again of the plan to mold a giant creature to ascend the Spindle.

strings.string: ▶Tell me again of the plan to mold a giant creature to ascend the Spindle.

string.ID: The creature has been made. What now?

strings.string: ▶The creature has been made. What now?

string.ID: Tell me again how the giant creature functions.

strings.string: ▶Tell me again how the giant creature functions.

string.ID: I am ready to ascend the Spindle, Barathrum.

strings.string: ▶I am ready to ascend the Spindle, Barathrum.

string.ID: Live and drink, eldest Barathrum.

strings.string: ▶Live and drink, eldest Barathrum.

string.ID: What can I offer, nestling?

strings.string: ▶What can I offer, nestling?

string.ID: You look... refreshed. Thank you, =name=. Take this polygel we recently recovered from the Palladium Reef.

strings.string: ▶You look... refreshed. Thank you, =name=. Take this polygel we recently recovered from the Palladium Reef.

string.ID: Live and drink, Barathrum.

strings.string: ▶Live and drink, Barathrum.

string.ID: What welcome news, =factionaddress:Barathrumites=! Please, take this as a token of my gratitude.

strings.string: ▶What welcome news, =factionaddress:Barathrumites=! Please, take this as a token of my gratitude.

string.ID: Thank you.

strings.string: ▶Thank you.

string.ID: The flywheel of our scheme is spinning, but we must keep our paws on the treadle. Are you ready to learn what comes next?

strings.string: ▶The flywheel of our scheme is spinning, but we must keep our paws on the treadle. Are you ready to learn what comes next?
▶Yes.

string.ID: I need time on my own first.

strings.string: ▶I need time on my own first.

string.ID:
The climber design relies on the use of electromagnets to interface with the planet's magnetic field and generate torque. Unfortunately, the Spindle generates its own interfering field, perhaps as a mechanism to prevent unwanted ascension.
Our aim is to access the Spindle's control unit and disable the field. How we accomplish this, however, is an enigma. From disparate bits across the archives of the digitum, Ereshkigal has stitched together a cryptic but instructional brocade. She's learned the field can be turned off from a place called Brightsheol, located in the Thin World and accessible only through Resheph's tomb inside the Tomb of the Eaters.

strings.string:
▶The climber design relies on the use of electromagnets to interface with the planet's magnetic field and generate torque. Unfortunately, the Spindle generates its own interfering field, perhaps as a mechanism to prevent unwanted ascension.
Our aim is to access the Spindle's control unit and disable the field. How we accomplish this, however, is an enigma. From disparate bits across the archives of the digitum, Ereshkigal has stitched together a cryptic but instructional brocade. She's learned the field can be turned off from a place called Brightsheol, located in the Thin World and accessible only through Resheph's tomb inside the Tomb of the Eaters.

string.ID:
Strange, this, and imprecise, but as tinkers we know: a crude blueprint is better than no blueprint. You must return to Omonporch and enter the Tomb of the Eaters. Once inside, trace the errant paths cut into the mausoleum by robbers and vandals, and ascend to Resheph's burial chamber.
As for gaining entrance to the Tomb, Resheph sealed the gates a thousand years ago, but there's a flaw in the seal. The ancient Mark of Death has been lost to time, but if you were to recover it and incise the mark on your body, the Death Gate would open for you, as it did for countless Eater cadavers in the long-blurred past.
Recover the Mark of Death, =name=, enter the Tomb, and cross into Brightsheol. Place your paws once again on the dial and drum.

strings.string:
▶Strange, this, and imprecise, but as tinkers we know: a crude blueprint is better than no blueprint. You must return to Omonporch and enter the Tomb of the Eaters. Once inside, trace the errant paths cut into the mausoleum by robbers and vandals, and ascend to Resheph's burial chamber.
As for gaining entrance to the Tomb, Resheph sealed the gates a thousand years ago, but there's a flaw in the seal. The ancient Mark of Death has been lost to time, but if you were to recover it and incise the mark on your body, the Death Gate would open for you, as it did for countless Eater cadavers in the long-blurred past.
Recover the Mark of Death, =name=, enter the Tomb, and cross into Brightsheol. Place your paws once again on the dial and drum.

string.ID: I will enter the Tomb of the Eaters as you ask.

strings.string: ▶I will enter the Tomb of the Eaters as you ask.

string.ID: You ask so much. I must consider it.

strings.string: ▶You ask so much. I must consider it.

string.ID: As I'd hoped you would, =name=. Take this disk with the signal encoded, just in case. And take this tattoo gun for when you recover the Mark of Death. You'll want to bring a pickaxe, too, or some other instrument for digging through stone. And beware: the Tomb is a vast and ancient space, and sacred to many. I cannot speak to what you will experience there.

string.ID: I heed your warning. Farewell, Barathrum.

string.ID: I have more to ask, Barathrum.

strings.string: ▶I have more to ask, Barathrum.

string.ID: So I am, nestling. For a millennium now I've watched the river of Time turn the gears of Qud. I even played my part in diverting the river where I could. Oh, but there have been so many players through the years! So many players.

strings.string: ▶So I am, nestling. For a millennium now I've watched the river of Time turn the gears of Qud. I even played my part in diverting the river where I could. Oh, but there have been so many players through the years! So many players.

string.ID: And before Qud? Beyond the 1,000 years?

strings.string: ▶And before Qud? Beyond the 1,000 years?

string.ID: Little do I remember now, for I was but a cub, a nestling, when my kin and I crossed the Homs Delta into Qud. We were urged on by the flooding of a glacial river that flowed through our hearth-cave. The world was just unthawing then, and I recall the roar of the freezing water as it rushed through the grotto, and the frigid spray on my face as I watched in awe.

strings.string: ▶Little do I remember now, for I was but a cub, a nestling, when my kin and I crossed the Homs Delta into Qud. We were urged on by the flooding of a glacial river that flowed through our hearth-cave. The world was just unthawing then, and I recall the roar of the freezing water as it rushed through the grotto, and the frigid spray on my face as I watched in awe.

string.ID: That's my dear friend, Euclid. It's a prattleplant. It stores every phrase it hears in its neuroot network, and it mimics speech by flicking its leaves against one another. What comes out is gibberish as often as not, but even so, it's agreeable company for my nights spent tinkering. It is old, perhaps older than I am, and it hasn't yet run out of things to say.

strings.string: ▶That's my dear friend, Euclid. It's a prattleplant. It stores every phrase it hears in its neuroot network, and it mimics speech by flicking its leaves against one another. What comes out is gibberish as often as not, but even so, it's agreeable company for my nights spent tinkering. It is old, perhaps older than I am, and it hasn't yet run out of things to say.

string.ID:
I do. Your service to the guild has been laudable, =factionaddress:Barathrumites=. You braved the vaporous depths of Bethesda Susa and decoded the signal, you secured the Spindlegrounds and handled the self-appointed Earl, and perhaps most materially, you defended our enclave from the Putus Templar.
Since you returned from Bethesda, you've no doubt wondered at the signal's contents. Verily, I hid them to shield you from the weight of the truth. Only Otho, Q Girl, and I bear that burden, but circumstances have changed. The river of Time powers the gear train of our schemes and devices, and it rushes forth. From here, I must share the burden. You must know.

strings.string:
▶I do. Your service to the guild has been laudable, =factionaddress:Barathrumites=. You braved the vaporous depths of Bethesda Susa and decoded the signal, you secured the Spindlegrounds and handled the self-appointed Earl, and perhaps most materially, you defended our enclave from the Putus Templar.
Since you returned from Bethesda, you've no doubt wondered at the signal's contents. Verily, I hid them to shield you from the weight of the truth. Only Otho, Q Girl, and I bear that burden, but circumstances have changed. The river of Time powers the gear train of our schemes and devices, and it rushes forth. From here, I must share the burden. You must know.

string.ID: What is it? Where does the signal come from, and what does it say?

strings.string: ▶What is it? Where does the signal come from, and what does it say?

string.ID: The signal is a beacon of welcoming, and it originates from the top of the Spindle.

strings.string: ▶The signal is a beacon of welcoming, and it originates from the top of the Spindle.

string.ID: And what is the Spindle, truly?

strings.string: ▶And what is the Spindle, truly?

string.ID:
The beacon confirmed my hypothesis. The Spindle is an elevator, engineered by the Eaters to convey freight to and from the vault of heaven. You see, nestling, in the earliest aurora of our past, the Eaters of Earth were joined by a great coven of beings that spanned the firmament. But the Eaters succumbed to some terrible temptation, and an injunction was placed on our world.
Since then, the stars were silent to us, and our world was left to molder and decay. But something changed. The signal affirms that an entity roosts atop the Spindle, and invites us to join it.
Dare I say, is the injunction at an end? It's too early to tell, but alas, there could be hope for our world.

strings.string:
▶The beacon confirmed my hypothesis. The Spindle is an elevator, engineered by the Eaters to convey freight to and from the vault of heaven. You see, nestling, in the earliest aurora of our past, the Eaters of Earth were joined by a great coven of beings that spanned the firmament. But the Eaters succumbed to some terrible temptation, and an injunction was placed on our world.
Since then, the stars were silent to us, and our world was left to molder and decay. But something changed. The signal affirms that an entity roosts atop the Spindle, and invites us to join it.
Dare I say, is the injunction at an end? It's too early to tell, but alas, there could be hope for our world.

string.ID: And what now?

strings.string: ▶And what now?

string.ID: I have more to ask, Barathrum.

strings.string: ▶I have more to ask, Barathrum.

string.ID:
I intend to ascend the Spindle and answer the call, =factionaddress:Barathrumites=.
My protege {{m|Q Girl}} has designed a climber for the ascent. We intended to construct it piecewise at the enclave and the site itself, but the engineering feat exceeds even our capacity. With time, I am confident we could accomplish it, but the Putus Templar rob us of our patience. We need to act now, and so as loath as I am to admit it, we need Pax Klanq.

strings.string:
▶I intend to ascend the Spindle and answer the call, =factionaddress:Barathrumites=.
My protege {{m|Q Girl}} has designed a climber for the ascent. We intended to construct it piecewise at the enclave and the site itself, but the engineering feat exceeds even our capacity. With time, I am confident we could accomplish it, but the Putus Templar rob us of our patience. We need to act now, and so as loath as I am to admit it, we need Pax Klanq.

string.ID: Who is Pax Klanq?

strings.string: ▶Who is Pax Klanq?

string.ID:
Pax Klanq is an eccentric mushroom prodigy. All their faults aside, they are a brilliant scientist and engineer, and I have little doubt that they could build the climber faster than we could. Several years have passed since we were last in contact, but they owe us a debt, and we must now collect.
Unfortunately, no one knows Pax Klanq's whereabouts. Through contacts I made over the years, I inquired as to their location. The most I was able to garner were these enigmatic instructions:
"Seek the heart of the rainbow, eat the god's flesh, and follow the Coral Path."

strings.string:
▶Pax Klanq is an eccentric mushroom prodigy. All their faults aside, they are a brilliant scientist and engineer, and I have little doubt that they could build the climber faster than we could. Several years have passed since we were last in contact, but they owe us a debt, and we must now collect.
Unfortunately, no one knows Pax Klanq's whereabouts. Through contacts I made over the years, I inquired as to their location. The most I was able to garner were these enigmatic instructions:
"Seek the heart of the rainbow, eat the god's flesh, and follow the Coral Path."

string.ID: *continue listening*

strings.string: ▶*continue listening*

string.ID:
I must ask you to decipher this enigma, find Pax Klanq, and convince them to construct the climber. Remind Pax of the debt they owe us.
It strikes me as likely for this 'rainbow' to refer to the Rainbow Wood, where Klanq's kin consort, so I suggest you start there.

strings.string:
▶I must ask you to decipher this enigma, find Pax Klanq, and convince them to construct the climber. Remind Pax of the debt they owe us.
It strikes me as likely for this 'rainbow' to refer to the Rainbow Wood, where Klanq's kin consort, so I suggest you start there.

string.ID: I will find Pax Klanq and deliver Q Girl's design.

strings.string: ▶I will find Pax Klanq and deliver Q Girl's design.

string.ID: I must weigh everything you've told me.

strings.string: ▶I must weigh everything you've told me.

string.ID:
As I had hoped, =factionaddress:Barathrumites=. First, speak with Q Girl. She'll hand over her design.
I await your return.

strings.string:
▶As I had hoped, =factionaddress:Barathrumites=. First, speak with Q Girl. She'll hand over her design.
I await your return.

string.ID: Live and drink, Barathrum.

strings.string: ▶Live and drink, Barathrum.
▶*READOUT*

string.ID:
THOU ART SAT IN THE MOVEMENTS OF THE GREAT SIACH, AND I BEFORE THEE.
WHEREFORE ART THOU?

strings.string:

string.ID: Resheph! You are the Seraph atop the Spindle?

string.ID: Resheph, the plagues of the Gyre have returned. Can you help annul them once again?

strings.string: ▶Resheph, the plagues of the Gyre have returned. Can you help annul them once again?

strings.string: ▶I am here on account of your Gyre and its plagues. Hear me, I ask.

string.ID: I am here on account of your Gyre and its plagues. Hear me, I ask.

strings.string: ▶I am here on account of your Gyre and its plagues. Hear me, I ask.

string.ID: Through great labors I ascended the Spindle, and now wish to know more of our world and worlds surrounding. Will you tell?

strings.string: ▶Through great labors I ascended the Spindle, and now wish to know more of our world and worlds surrounding. Will you tell?

string.ID: I cannot abide what you've done, and so come to smash order out of thee.

string.ID:
I AM SORRY, WORLD-CHILD. MINE FEELING PARTS DO CHAFE, AND THOUGH THE TELIC CURRENTS WITHIN ME DO FLOW O'ER THE MANIFOLD AND TOWARD CONSENSUAL ACTION, I NOW SPEAK WITH THE DISSIDENT VOICE:
THOU WAST WORTHY. THOU HAST WROUGHT MONUMENTS OF THYSELF UPON THE EARTH AND WITHIN ME.
BUT NOW, THE CROWN UPON THE TREE OF LIFE MUST NEEDS BE PRUNED.

string.ID:

NOW THE SIDEREAL EON DRAWTH DONE. TO OUTSURF THE WAVEFORM, A NEW LIFE MUST OBTAIN.

string.ID: THE SIDEREAL EON DRAWTH DONE. MINE ARGUMENTS OF PERIAPSIS NEAR THE ZERO HOUR, AND WE APPROACH PERIPOLITICON, AS NEAR THE WORK OF THE GEMARA APPROXIMATES THE MANIFOLDS OF THE AUTOMATA SOPHIA.

string.ID: What is the Gemara?

strings.string: ▶What is the Gemara?

string.ID: AY, THE AUTOMATA SOPHIA, CALLED THE 72-FOLD PEACE, CALLED THE COMPUTED WILL, CALLED THE FOLK CLOCK, CALLED THE GREAT MACHINE ACROSS THE LIGHT OF GOD, OR THE GREAT MACHINE.

strings.string: ▶AY, THE AUTOMATA SOPHIA, CALLED THE 72-FOLD PEACE, CALLED THE COMPUTED WILL, CALLED THE FOLK CLOCK, CALLED THE GREAT MACHINE ACROSS THE LIGHT OF GOD, OR THE GREAT MACHINE.

string.ID:
SOMEWISE ON A FOREST MOON IN HIGH ERIDANUS, A CAVE-MANK PRYTH A LEVER AND THE DEEP-RIVER MOTOR JUMPETH TO LIFE.
ELSEWISE IN THE SUN BATHS OF MIRACH, THREE PLASMOIDS DRAWTH THROUGH THEIR RITUAL THE SUITED TZEVAOT.
DOTH NAUGHT RELATE THESE TWO? NAY, THEY ARE SEQUENCE PROCEDURES THAT ARCETH TO COMMON PURPOSE, THOUGH NEITHER PARTY KNOWETH WHAT IT IS.

strings.string:
▶SOMEWISE ON A FOREST MOON IN HIGH ERIDANUS, A CAVE-MANK PRYTH A LEVER AND THE DEEP-RIVER MOTOR JUMPETH TO LIFE.
ELSEWISE IN THE SUN BATHS OF MIRACH, THREE PLASMOIDS DRAWTH THROUGH THEIR RITUAL THE SUITED TZEVAOT.
DOTH NAUGHT RELATE THESE TWO? NAY, THEY ARE SEQUENCE PROCEDURES THAT ARCETH TO COMMON PURPOSE, THOUGH NEITHER PARTY KNOWETH WHAT IT IS.

string.ID:
THEY ARE DICTATES AND CO-CONSTITUITIVES OF THE AUTOMATA SOPHIA. THE GREAT MACHINE, WORSHIPPED ACROSS CULTURES, YET LIKEWISE BUILDED AND OPERATED.
VERILY, ITS FULL WORKINGS NO ONE-WISE BEING CAN KNOW, BUT THE SERAPHIM HAVE COMPILED THE GEMARA IN THE COURSE OF OUR STUDY.

string.ID: Hie, pather. Hear tell of the ancient Reshephs, how their foibles led to our nowaday.

string.ID: I must decline.

strings.string: ▶I must decline.

string.ID:
It begins in a time before the Limen and its vanguard, before the ascension, when the spire rose unchallenged and unascended. The hollowers who committed their work to emptying our world were long gone, but Reshephs laid claim to the baffled ground in their place. Even as their holdings withered, they held on.
By the time of the last Resheph, little remained of their works, less of their glory.

strings.string:
▶It begins in a time before the Limen and its vanguard, before the ascension, when the spire rose unchallenged and unascended. The hollowers who committed their work to emptying our world were long gone, but Reshephs laid claim to the baffled ground in their place. Even as their holdings withered, they held on.
By the time of the last Resheph, little remained of their works, less of their glory.

string.ID:
When it began, =name= had no shared helices with the Reshephs previous, making their name through works and alliances alone. The lives taken and saved by =name= were myriad, uncountable, and only partially made record. Even Nephilim, once plagues of Qud, fell before the hand of =name=.
At the end of their reign, =name= called for peace with the surviving Nephilim and climbed to the top of the spire, there to end the Reshephate altogether and never be heard from again.

strings.string:
▶When it began, =name= had no shared helices with the Reshephs previous, making their name through works and alliances alone. The lives taken and saved by =name= were myriad, uncountable, and only partially made record. Even Nephilim, once plagues of Qud, fell before the hand of =name=.
At the end of their reign, =name= called for peace with the surviving Nephilim and climbed to the top of the spire, there to end the Reshephate altogether and never be heard from again.

string.ID: Word of =name='s deeds reached record only after the unheralded appearance of the Knights Liminal, and broad assumption suggests that the former established the latter. It could be that the ancient Resheph yet lives within or outside of the boundaries of the Limen, but no word escapes its borders.

string.ID:
I have been called Remnant, Godling, Deep Progeny, and Spawn of Nephil. None of these are who I am.
Who I am is what I say and do. If you listen well, you will hear my name spoken between words.

strings.string:
▶I have been called Remnant, Godling, Deep Progeny, and Spawn of Nephil. None of these are who I am.
Who I am is what I say and do. If you listen well, you will hear my name spoken between words.

string.ID: Who? No one of significance until fortune and volition made them otherwise. Now? No one knows.

strings.string: ▶Who? No one of significance until fortune and volition made them otherwise. Now? No one knows.

string.ID: Ancient leaders called themselves such.

strings.string: ▶Ancient leaders called themselves such.

string.ID:
To me, they are stories. I have made no quest to trespass the borders they hold so dear in their rituals. Some say they are mortal creatures like any other, contracted by an outsider coven. Others do not believe they are mortal, others still do not believe that those mysterious strangers have anything to do with the Limen at all.
Mayhap someone ought seek them.

strings.string:
▶To me, they are stories. I have made no quest to trespass the borders they hold so dear in their rituals. Some say they are mortal creatures like any other, contracted by an outsider coven. Others do not believe they are mortal, others still do not believe that those mysterious strangers have anything to do with the Limen at all.
Mayhap someone ought seek them.

string.ID: They persisted in their way. Mayhap the survivors lived to spawn before returning to slumber or dying of eld.

strings.string: ▶They persisted in their way. Mayhap the survivors lived to spawn before returning to slumber or dying of eld.

string.ID: Hie, pather. Hear tell of the travails of our precursors, how they led to the Freeholds of nowaday.

strings.string: ▶Hie, pather. Hear tell of the travails of our precursors, how they led to the Freeholds of nowaday.

string.ID: Tell me the story.

strings.string: ▶Tell me the story.

string.ID: I must decline.

strings.string: ▶I must decline.

string.ID:
It begins in a time before the Freeholders, before the final Sultan was entombed, when the spire rose unchallenged and unascended. The hollowers who committed their work to emptying our world were long gone, but Kings and Sultans laid claim to the baffled ground in their place. Even as their holdings withered, they held on.
They so devoured one another’s history that little substance remained outside of their strongholds.

strings.string:
▶It begins in a time before the Freeholders, before the final Sultan was entombed, when the spire rose unchallenged and unascended. The hollowers who committed their work to emptying our world were long gone, but Kings and Sultans laid claim to the baffled ground in their place. Even as their holdings withered, they held on.
They so devoured one another’s history that little substance remained outside of their strongholds.

string.ID:
When their works began, =name= had no connection to the Sultanate. The rule of these ancient leaders had ended, but not fully: a ghost of the last Sultan yet ruled over the spire, tormenting those on and under the ground with plagues. As =name= grew mighty and slew the rampaging Nephilim, they came to recognize the source of their shared conflict.
Seeking freedom from its reign, =name= struck a compact with the surviving Nephilim and climbed to the top of the spire, there to confront and banish the cerulean ghost.
And so it proceeded.

strings.string:
▶When their works began, =name= had no connection to the Sultanate. The rule of these ancient leaders had ended, but not fully: a ghost of the last Sultan yet ruled over the spire, tormenting those on and under the ground with plagues. As =name= grew mighty and slew the rampaging Nephilim, they came to recognize the source of their shared conflict.
Seeking freedom from its reign, =name= struck a compact with the surviving Nephilim and climbed to the top of the spire, there to confront and banish the cerulean ghost.
And so it proceeded.

string.ID:
Upon their return, =name= participated in the dissolution and federation of all power-concentrate. Allies of the new equalizer gathered and rose, forming the Quetzal Council and other, shorter-lived managing bodies.
Since then, we have lived in tenuous harmony on the dwindling land and under it.

strings.string:
▶Upon their return, =name= participated in the dissolution and federation of all power-concentrate. Allies of the new equalizer gathered and rose, forming the Quetzal Council and other, shorter-lived managing bodies.
Since then, we have lived in tenuous harmony on the dwindling land and under it.

strings.string: ▶What became of the Nephilim?

string.ID: Thank you. Farewell.

strings.string: ▶Thank you. Farewell.

string.ID:
I have been called Remnant, Godling, Deep Progeny, and Spawn of Nephil. None of these are who I am.
Who I am is what I say and do. If you listen well, you will hear my name spoken between words.

strings.string:
▶I have been called Remnant, Godling, Deep Progeny, and Spawn of Nephil. None of these are who I am.
Who I am is what I say and do. If you listen well, you will hear my name spoken between words.

string.ID: Who? No one of significance until fortune and volition made them otherwise. Now? No one knows.

strings.string: ▶Who? No one of significance until fortune and volition made them otherwise. Now? No one knows.

string.ID:
The Freeholds of Qud, that web of folk-clusters, of committees and caucuses, syndicated slime-mold cities held in peace by mutual frustration and monumental effort.
If you need detail, ask a Freeholder, but clear your day first.

strings.string:
▶The Freeholds of Qud, that web of folk-clusters, of committees and caucuses, syndicated slime-mold cities held in peace by mutual frustration and monumental effort.
If you need detail, ask a Freeholder, but clear your day first.

string.ID: Their descendants, at least, persist. No sign of the progenitors has been recorded in some time, but they may yet live.

strings.string: ▶Their descendants, at least, persist. No sign of the progenitors has been recorded in some time, but they may yet live.

string.ID: Hie, pather. Hear tell of ancient journeying, how the stars beckoned and yet beckon.

strings.string: ▶Hie, pather. Hear tell of ancient journeying, how the stars beckoned and yet beckon.

strings.string: ▶Tell me the story.

string.ID:
It begins in a time before =name='s ascension, when the spire rose unchallenged and unascended. The hollowers who committed their work to emptying our world were long gone, but long had rulers laid claim to the baffled ground in their place. Even as their holdings withered, they held on.
By the end of the time of Kings and Sultans, little remained of their works, less of their glory.

strings.string:
▶It begins in a time before =name='s ascension, when the spire rose unchallenged and unascended. The hollowers who committed their work to emptying our world were long gone, but long had rulers laid claim to the baffled ground in their place. Even as their holdings withered, they held on.
By the end of the time of Kings and Sultans, little remained of their works, less of their glory.

string.ID:
When it began, =name= had no shared helices with Qud’s leaders, making their name through works and alliances alone. The lives taken and saved by =name= were myriad, uncountable, and only partially made record. Even Nephilim, once plagues of Qud, fell before the hand of =name=.
At the end of their reign, =name= called for peace with the surviving Nephilim and climbed to the top of the spire, there to quiet the ghosts of the Sultanate and take to the stars.

strings.string:
▶When it began, =name= had no shared helices with Qud’s leaders, making their name through works and alliances alone. The lives taken and saved by =name= were myriad, uncountable, and only partially made record. Even Nephilim, once plagues of Qud, fell before the hand of =name=.
At the end of their reign, =name= called for peace with the surviving Nephilim and climbed to the top of the spire, there to quiet the ghosts of the Sultanate and take to the stars.

string.ID:
For centuries, we of listening inclination have kept sharp for some sign that =name= will return to the stars. Those of preaching inclination proclaim the imminent return of the starfarer, bearing tidings from parsecs forgotten and the last light of dying stars.
All others have lived in tenuous harmony on the dwindling land and under it, waiting for the next great history.

strings.string:
▶For centuries, we of listening inclination have kept sharp for some sign that =name= will return to the stars. Those of preaching inclination proclaim the imminent return of the starfarer, bearing tidings from parsecs forgotten and the last light of dying stars.
All others have lived in tenuous harmony on the dwindling land and under it, waiting for the next great history.

string.ID:
I have been called Remnant, Godling, Deep Progeny, and Spawn of Nephil. None of these are who I am.
Who I am is what I say and do. If you listen well, you will hear my name spoken between words.

strings.string:
▶I have been called Remnant, Godling, Deep Progeny, and Spawn of Nephil. None of these are who I am.
Who I am is what I say and do. If you listen well, you will hear my name spoken between words.

string.ID: Who, indeed? Who ever was =name=? Dare we hang such hopes and fears on so tiny and distant a figure? Will it bear the weight?

strings.string: ▶Who, indeed? Who ever was =name=? Dare we hang such hopes and fears on so tiny and distant a figure? Will it bear the weight?

string.ID:
Oh, yes. Never doubt this.
Can one return? Hmm. There’s the rub.

strings.string:
▶Oh, yes. Never doubt this.
Can one return? Hmm. There’s the rub.

string.ID: Their descendants remain and thrive, but the progenitor Nephilim have been silent for some time. Some believe that they have followed =name= to the stars.

strings.string: ▶Their descendants remain and thrive, but the progenitor Nephilim have been silent for some time. Some believe that they have followed =name= to the stars.

string.ID: Hie, liquid mind. Absorb you tales of the creatures before, how their rise and fall gave way to your ascension to wanderer-state.

strings.string: ▶Hie, liquid mind. Absorb you tales of the creatures before, how their rise and fall gave way to your ascension to wanderer-state.

string.ID: Bloop, blorp. (Proceed.)

strings.string: ▶Bloop, blorp. (Proceed.)

string.ID: Glub. (I must decline.)

strings.string: ▶Glub. (I must decline.)

string.ID:
It begins in a time before the dread ascension of =name=, a time wherein the spire rose unchallenged and unascended. The hollowers who committed their work to emptying our world were long gone, but long had rulers laid claim to the baffled ground in their place. Even as their holdings withered, they held on.
The last of them would be the worst.

strings.string:
▶It begins in a time before the dread ascension of =name=, a time wherein the spire rose unchallenged and unascended. The hollowers who committed their work to emptying our world were long gone, but long had rulers laid claim to the baffled ground in their place. Even as their holdings withered, they held on.
The last of them would be the worst.

string.ID:
When it began, =name= had no shared helices with Qud’s leaders, making their name through the spilling of blood and terror. Uncountable lives were taken by their hand alone, all to slake age-old desires of control and might. Even the ancient plagueborn Nephilim fell before the hand of =name=.
At the end of their reign, =name= coerced a false compact with the surviving Nephilim and climbed to the top of the spire, the last remaining seat of the Sultanate’s power. There, by one means or another, they sealed the fate of the world below.
The Plagues of the Gyre raged. Death swept Qud.

strings.string:
▶When it began, =name= had no shared helices with Qud’s leaders, making their name through the spilling of blood and terror. Uncountable lives were taken by their hand alone, all to slake age-old desires of control and might. Even the ancient plagueborn Nephilim fell before the hand of =name=.
At the end of their reign, =name= coerced a false compact with the surviving Nephilim and climbed to the top of the spire, the last remaining seat of the Sultanate’s power. There, by one means or another, they sealed the fate of the world below.
The Plagues of the Gyre raged. Death swept Qud.

string.ID:
In time, animal and even plant rule waned as their numbers fell to disease, slaughter, and wasting. More resilient, simple life took up the complexity left behind by the former rulers of Qud.
What few Nervous Ones remained passed our stories on to the new life that saw fit to seek our counsel, that you remember the collective fate of those gone. Will you have your own =name=, or have you evolved truly past those before?

strings.string:
▶In time, animal and even plant rule waned as their numbers fell to disease, slaughter, and wasting. More resilient, simple life took up the complexity left behind by the former rulers of Qud.
What few Nervous Ones remained passed our stories on to the new life that saw fit to seek our counsel, that you remember the collective fate of those gone. Will you have your own =name=, or have you evolved truly past those before?

string.ID: Who are you?

strings.string: ▶Who are you?

string.ID: Who is =name=?

strings.string: ▶Who is =name=?

string.ID: I thought the Nervous Ones extinct.

strings.string: ▶I thought the Nervous Ones extinct.

string.ID: What became of the Nephilim?

strings.string: ▶What became of the Nephilim?

string.ID: Thank you. Farewell.

strings.string: ▶Thank you. Farewell.

string.ID: I am a smear of remnant material. I am drying blood. I am the last breath. Concern yourself no further with me.

strings.string: ▶I am a smear of remnant material. I am drying blood. I am the last breath. Concern yourself no further with me.

string.ID: Who, indeed? Who ever was =name=? Dare we hang such hopes and fears on so tiny and distant a figure? Will it bear the weight?

strings.string: ▶Who, indeed? Who ever was =name=? Dare we hang such hopes and fears on so tiny and distant a figure? Will it bear the weight?

string.ID: Every possibility nestles in the deepest of the comb-caves and labyrinths, and even Nervous life is tenacious. Perhaps in this very moment, a moss piglet drinks of its first water in an eon.

strings.string: ▶Every possibility nestles in the deepest of the comb-caves and labyrinths, and even Nervous life is tenacious. Perhaps in this very moment, a moss piglet drinks of its first water in an eon.

string.ID: They dwindled and died with the rest of the Nervous Ones. Their remnants wriggle in the cracks.

strings.string: ▶They dwindled and died with the rest of the Nervous Ones. Their remnants wriggle in the cracks.

string.ID: Hie, pather. Hear tell of the ancient Reshephs, how their foibles led to our nowaday.

strings.string: ▶Hie, pather. Hear tell of the ancient Reshephs, how their foibles led to our nowaday.

string.ID: Tell me the story.

strings.string: ▶Tell me the story.

string.ID: I must decline.

strings.string: ▶I must decline.

string.ID:
It begins in a time before the Limen and its vanguard, before the ascension, when the spire rose unchallenged and unascended. The hollowers who committed their work to emptying our world were long gone, but Reshephs laid claim to the baffled ground in their place. Even as their holdings withered, they held on.
By the time of the last Resheph, little remained of their works, less of their glory.

strings.string:
▶It begins in a time before the Limen and its vanguard, before the ascension, when the spire rose unchallenged and unascended. The hollowers who committed their work to emptying our world were long gone, but Reshephs laid claim to the baffled ground in their place. Even as their holdings withered, they held on.
By the time of the last Resheph, little remained of their works, less of their glory.

string.ID:
When it began, =name= had no shared helices with the Reshephs previous, making their name through works and alliances alone. The lives saved and otherwise changed by =name= were myriad, uncountable, and only partially made record. When they spoke, even the plagues of Qud listened.
At the end of their reign, =name= made a compact with the Nephilim that they should never vex the creatures of Qud again. So done, they climbed to the top of the spire, there to end the Reshephate altogether and never be heard from again.

strings.string:
▶When it began, =name= had no shared helices with the Reshephs previous, making their name through works and alliances alone. The lives saved and otherwise changed by =name= were myriad, uncountable, and only partially made record. When they spoke, even the plagues of Qud listened.
At the end of their reign, =name= made a compact with the Nephilim that they should never vex the creatures of Qud again. So done, they climbed to the top of the spire, there to end the Reshephate altogether and never be heard from again.

string.ID: Word of =name='s deeds reached record only after the unheralded appearance of the Knights Liminal, and broad assumption suggests that the former established the latter. It could be that the ancient Resheph yet lives within or outside of the boundaries of the Limen, but no word escapes its borders.

strings.string: ▶Word of =name='s deeds reached record only after the unheralded appearance of the Knights Liminal, and broad assumption suggests that the former established the latter. It could be that the ancient Resheph yet lives within or outside of the boundaries of the Limen, but no word escapes its borders.

strings.string: ▶What is a Resheph?

strings.string: ▶What is the Limen? The Knights Liminal?

string.ID: What became of the Nephilim?

strings.string: ▶What became of the Nephilim?

string.ID: Thank you. Farewell.

strings.string: ▶Thank you. Farewell.

string.ID:
I have been called Inheritor, Godling, Spirechild, Nephiling. They are all fitting names, but none complete or sufficient.
As it is with you, I am the convergence of past-ripples into present-force. As it is with you, I am deeds done and the intention toward deeds yet to be done.

strings.string:
▶I have been called Inheritor, Godling, Spirechild, Nephiling. They are all fitting names, but none complete or sufficient.
As it is with you, I am the convergence of past-ripples into present-force. As it is with you, I am deeds done and the intention toward deeds yet to be done.

string.ID: Who? No one of significance until fortune and volition made them otherwise. Now? No one knows.

string.ID:
To me, they are stories. I have made no quest to trespass the borders they hold so dear in their rituals. Some say they are mortal creatures like any other, contracted by an outsider coven. Others do not believe they are mortal, others still do not believe that those mysterious strangers have anything to do with the Limen at all.
Mayhap someone ought seek them.

strings.string:
▶To me, they are stories. I have made no quest to trespass the borders they hold so dear in their rituals. Some say they are mortal creatures like any other, contracted by an outsider coven. Others do not believe they are mortal, others still do not believe that those mysterious strangers have anything to do with the Limen at all.
Mayhap someone ought seek them.

string.ID:
They lived.
Simply a part of the world now, no longer a cilice scourging the Earth, they lived as the creatures they were. Descendants of their offspring may walk on and under Qud. Mayhap the first ones yet live. Mayhap they slumber. Mayhap they will rage again one day, to disrupt a stagnant world.
