strings.string: ▶Who, indeed? Who ever was =name=? Dare we hang such hopes and fears on so tiny and distant a figure? Will it bear the weight?

string.ID:
Oh, yes. Never doubt this.
Can one return? Hmm. There’s the rub.

strings.string:
▶Oh, yes. Never doubt this.
Can one return? Hmm. There’s the rub.

string.ID:
They lived.
Simply a part of the world now, no longer a cilice scourging the Earth, they lived as the creatures they were. Descendants of their offspring walk on and under Qud. It’s said that they ascended to the stars to find =name=, but it seems equally plausible that they may have returned to their slumber in the depths.

strings.string:
▶They lived.
Simply a part of the world now, no longer a cilice scourging the Earth, they lived as the creatures they were. Descendants of their offspring walk on and under Qud. It’s said that they ascended to the stars to find =name=, but it seems equally plausible that they may have returned to their slumber in the depths.

string.ID: Hie, liquid mind. Absorb you tales of the creatures before, how their rise and fall gave way to your ascension to wanderer-state.

strings.string: ▶Hie, liquid mind. Absorb you tales of the creatures before, how their rise and fall gave way to your ascension to wanderer-state.

string.ID: Bloop, blorp. (Proceed.)

strings.string: ▶Bloop, blorp. (Proceed.)

string.ID: Glub. (I must decline.)

strings.string: ▶Glub. (I must decline.)

string.ID:
It begins in a time before the dread ascension of =name=, a time wherein the spire rose unchallenged and unascended. The hollowers who committed their work to emptying our world were long gone, but long had rulers laid claim to the baffled ground in their place. Even as their holdings withered, they held on.
The last of them would be the worst.

strings.string:
▶It begins in a time before the dread ascension of =name=, a time wherein the spire rose unchallenged and unascended. The hollowers who committed their work to emptying our world were long gone, but long had rulers laid claim to the baffled ground in their place. Even as their holdings withered, they held on.
The last of them would be the worst.

string.ID:
When it began, =name= had no shared helices with Qud’s leaders, making their name through the spilling of blood and terror. Uncountable lives were taken by their hand alone, all to slake age-old desires of control and might.
Perhaps hunger turned to malice, or the adoption of a greater principle, or simple boredom. Whatever the reason, =name= formed a fast alliance with the ancient plagueborn Nephilim, ascended the spire, and sealed the fate of the world below.
The Plagues of the Gyre raged unchecked.

strings.string:
▶When it began, =name= had no shared helices with Qud’s leaders, making their name through the spilling of blood and terror. Uncountable lives were taken by their hand alone, all to slake age-old desires of control and might.
Perhaps hunger turned to malice, or the adoption of a greater principle, or simple boredom. Whatever the reason, =name= formed a fast alliance with the ancient plagueborn Nephilim, ascended the spire, and sealed the fate of the world below.
The Plagues of the Gyre raged unchecked.

string.ID:
In time, animal and even plant rule waned as their numbers fell to disease, slaughter, and wasting. More resilient, simple life took up the complexity left behind by the former rulers of Qud.
What few Nervous Ones remained passed our stories on to the new life that saw fit to seek our counsel, that you remember the collective fate of those gone. Will you have your own =name=, or have you evolved truly past those before?

strings.string:
▶In time, animal and even plant rule waned as their numbers fell to disease, slaughter, and wasting. More resilient, simple life took up the complexity left behind by the former rulers of Qud.
What few Nervous Ones remained passed our stories on to the new life that saw fit to seek our counsel, that you remember the collective fate of those gone. Will you have your own =name=, or have you evolved truly past those before?

strings.string: ▶Who is =name=?

string.ID: I thought the Nervous Ones extinct.

strings.string: ▶I thought the Nervous Ones extinct.

string.ID: What became of the Nephilim?

strings.string: ▶What became of the Nephilim?

string.ID: Thank you. Farewell.

strings.string: ▶Thank you. Farewell.

string.ID:
I am history’s leftovers, an inheritor of nothing, a bit of marginalia in a burned tome.
That I have persisted to witness this day leaves me in awe. It is extraordinary.

strings.string:
▶I am history’s leftovers, an inheritor of nothing, a bit of marginalia in a burned tome.

string.ID: Who, indeed? Who ever was =name=? Dare we hang such hopes and fears on so tiny and distant a figure? Will it bear the weight?

strings.string: ▶Who, indeed? Who ever was =name=? Dare we hang such hopes and fears on so tiny and distant a figure? Will it bear the weight?

string.ID: Every possibility nestles in the deepest of the comb-caves and labyrinths, and even Nervous life is tenacious. Perhaps in this very moment, a moss piglet drinks of its first water in an eon.

strings.string: ▶Every possibility nestles in the deepest of the comb-caves and labyrinths, and even Nervous life is tenacious. Perhaps in this very moment, a moss piglet drinks of its first water in an eon.

string.ID:
They played their role so well, and lived in power for a time.
If they had any illusion that they would be spared the fate =name= determined for life on Qud, it surely died before the great beings themselves. Mayhap they went to ground and survived. Mayhap their spawn persisted.

strings.string:
▶They played their role so well, and lived in power for a time.
If they had any illusion that they would be spared the fate =name= determined for life on Qud, it surely died before the great beings themselves. Mayhap they went to ground and survived. Mayhap their spawn persisted.

string.ID: Once in the fullness of time there met the Fool of the Gyre and a wanderer. The Fool offered a tale of the Reshephs, and the wanderer sat to hear.

strings.string: ▶Once in the fullness of time there met the Fool of the Gyre and a wanderer. The Fool offered a tale of the Reshephs, and the wanderer sat to hear.

string.ID:
Ere the limen, ere ascension, when the spire rose lonely strong, the Reshephs ruled the hollow land devouring one another as they saw fit.
Qud held no mysterious borders, grasped no guiding hands -- at least, none the denizens could grasp. So they knew.

strings.string:
▶Ere the limen, ere ascension, when the spire rose lonely strong, the Reshephs ruled the hollow land devouring one another as they saw fit.

string.ID:
None hailed =name= and =name= hailed none but with word and blade deed and disregard they stood apart and above
To push back the Gyre, to spill of Nephil ichor they took to the spire and quieted the Reshephate.

▶None hailed =name= and =name= hailed none but with word and blade deed and disregard they stood apart and above

Only silence on the ground met we benighted things until the Knights Liminal drew their lines upon the salt.
Unknowing, unseeing, waiting only to know who will spin us around next.

No one of fate, no one of blood, no one of importance, until, suddenly, someone of all of these things.
=name= is a dream from which we cannot awaken.

Countless years of struggle centuries of change. We remember what we can and watch new and old die.

string.ID: In my travels I encountered a people, the slynth, seeking a new home.

strings.string: ▶In my travels I encountered a people, the slynth, seeking a new home.

string.ID: About the slynth...

strings.string: ▶About the slynth...

string.ID: I see the slynth have arrived. How are they faring?

strings.string: ▶I see the slynth have arrived. How are they faring?

string.ID: It's been a week. Are the slynth settled in?

strings.string: ▶It's been a week. Are the slynth settled in?

string.ID: There are no more words for us, wanderer.

strings.string: ▶There are no more words for us, wanderer.

string.ID: =name=! Live and drink, pilgrim.

strings.string: ▶=name=! Live and drink, pilgrim.

string.ID: =name=! Live and drink, pilgrim.

strings.string: ▶=name=! Live and drink, pilgrim.

string.ID: I have visited the Six Day Stilt.

strings.string: ▶I have visited the Six Day Stilt.

string.ID:
Ah!
Tell me, =pronouns.formalAddressTerm=, was it the picture of wonder as I see it in my mind's eye? Were you beauty-struck by its truths?

strings.string:
▶Ah!
Tell me, =pronouns.formalAddressTerm=, was it the picture of wonder as I see it in my mind's eye? Were you beauty-struck by its truths?

string.ID: Truly breathtaking. How the glass glittered in the sun!

strings.string: ▶Truly breathtaking. How the glass glittered in the sun!

string.ID: To behold the Argent Fathers in simulacra... what revelation!

strings.string: ▶To behold the Argent Fathers in simulacra... what revelation!

string.ID: I saw only empty spectacle. Who can worship a hole in the ground?

strings.string: ▶I saw only empty spectacle. Who can worship a hole in the ground?

string.ID:
So it's true! O Argent Fathers, how far-reaching your works!
... and my trinket? Did you cast it into the Sacred Well?

strings.string:
▶So it's true! O Argent Fathers, how far-reaching your works!
... and my trinket? Did you cast it into the Sacred Well?

string.ID: I did.

strings.string: ▶I did.

string.ID: Sadly, it was lost.

strings.string: ▶Sadly, it was lost.

string.ID: No, I took it apart or sold it or something.

strings.string: ▶No, I took it apart or sold it or something.

string.ID:
Moon and Sun! The Argent Fathers bless us, our paths are chromed and glistering.
You have my thanks, =pronouns.formalAddressTerm=. Bel shield you.

strings.string:
▶Moon and Sun! The Argent Fathers bless us, our paths are chromed and glistering.
You have my thanks, =pronouns.formalAddressTerm=. Bel shield you.

string.ID: And you as well.

strings.string: ▶And you as well.

string.ID:
Oh, I am leaden with this knowledge. Yet am I soothed by your pilgrimage.
Moon and Sun, I feel the warmth of the Kasaphescence yet. Praise the Argent Fathers.

strings.string:
▶Oh, I am leaden with this knowledge. Yet am I soothed by your pilgrimage.
Moon and Sun, I feel the warmth of the Kasaphescence yet. Praise the Argent Fathers.

string.ID:
Oh, how your words rasp my soul, =player.formalAddressTerm=. You abrade me.
Let us speak no more.

strings.string:
▶Oh, how your words rasp my soul, =player.formalAddressTerm=. You abrade me.
Let us speak no more.

string.ID: Very well.

strings.string: ▶Very well.

string.ID:
So you have seen the truth? Great are the machinations of our Argent Fathers!
Our meeting, a tiny Canticle. Fate dances in our shadows by their will and word.
Moon and sun, what a day! What a fine day. Praise Shekhinah!

strings.string:
▶So you have seen the truth? Great are the machinations of our Argent Fathers!
Our meeting, a tiny Canticle. Fate dances in our shadows by their will and word.
Moon and sun, what a day! What a fine day. Praise Shekhinah!

string.ID: Praise Shekhinah!

strings.string: ▶Praise Shekhinah!

string.ID:
Wh-
My heart's sheen wanes to hear this of you. You abrade me, =player.formalAddressTerm=, I am scuffed.
What of my trinket, then? Did you cast it into the... "hole in the ground?"

strings.string:
▶Wh-
My heart's sheen wanes to hear this of you. You abrade me, =player.formalAddressTerm=, I am scuffed.
What of my trinket, then? Did you cast it into the... "hole in the ground?"

string.ID: Yes, I threw it in the hole.

strings.string: ▶Yes, I threw it in the hole.

string.ID: No, I lost it.

strings.string: ▶No, I lost it.

string.ID: I gave it to someone. Or sold it, perhaps.

strings.string: ▶I gave it to someone. Or sold it, perhaps.

string.ID:
Well... the light of the Kasaphescence yet glimmers through your rasping edge.
I must, then, thank you.

strings.string:
▶Well... the light of the Kasaphescence yet glimmers through your rasping edge.
I must, then, thank you.

string.ID: You're welcome.

strings.string: ▶You're welcome.

string.ID:
My stomach lurches and quavers at the shock of this knowledge.
If there is a lesson in your disregard, I will meditate upon it in my own time.
Let us speak no more.

strings.string:
▶My stomach lurches and quavers at the shock of this knowledge.
If there is a lesson in your disregard, I will meditate upon it in my own time.
Let us speak no more.

string.ID: As you say.

strings.string: ▶As you say.

string.ID:
Ah, a pit opens under my stomach!
Let us speak no more, I beg you. You scuff me. Live and drink.

strings.string:
▶Ah, a pit opens under my stomach!
Let us speak no more, I beg you. You scuff me. Live and drink.

string.ID: Wanderer and =pronouns.formalAddressTerm=! Have you journeyed yet to the Stilt, and seen the Sacred Well?

strings.string: ▶Wanderer and =pronouns.formalAddressTerm=! Have you journeyed yet to the Stilt, and seen the Sacred Well?

string.ID: Not yet, friend. Live and drink.

strings.string: ▶Not yet, friend. Live and drink.

string.ID: Wanderer! Do you venture northwise? Into the Great Desert and nearer the Six Day Stilt?

strings.string: ▶Wanderer! Do you venture northwise? Into the Great Desert and nearer the Six Day Stilt?

string.ID: What is the Six Day Stilt?

strings.string: ▶What is the Six Day Stilt?

string.ID: Why do you ask?

strings.string: ▶Why do you ask?

string.ID:
Ah! The great Mechanimist temple of glass, the sacred offering Well, and history in stone relief. Peopled by the Argent Fathers, in statue and light sculpture. And circled by the grand bazaar. I hear there are more people there than numbers in the void, and their chatter makes a sound wholly raw and new to the world.
Will you go there, and take my bauble? Will you offer it at the Well, where I cannot?

strings.string:
▶Ah! The great Mechanimist temple of glass, the sacred offering Well, and history in stone relief. Peopled by the Argent Fathers, in statue and light sculpture. And circled by the grand bazaar. I hear there are more people there than numbers in the void, and their chatter makes a sound wholly raw and new to the world.
Will you go there, and take my bauble? Will you offer it at the Well, where I cannot?

string.ID: Your bauble?

strings.string: ▶Your bauble?

string.ID: Argent Fathers?

strings.string: ▶Argent Fathers?

string.ID: Why can you not go?

strings.string: ▶Why can you not go?

string.ID: I will make the journey.

strings.string: ▶I will make the journey.

string.ID: I cannot commit to this. Live and drink.

strings.string: ▶I cannot commit to this. Live and drink.

string.ID:
Yes! My neighbor-kin tire of the tale. I was scything the vine when the flat of my blade turned something loose from the soil. My heart has stirred before at the sight of chrome, but to free a small splinter myself, to slide a bead on the abacus of Beauty...
Will you go, then? And offer my bauble at the Well?

strings.string:
▶Yes! My neighbor-kin tire of the tale. I was scything the vine when the flat of my blade turned something loose from the soil. My heart has stirred before at the sight of chrome, but to free a small splinter myself, to slide a bead on the abacus of Beauty...
Will you go, then? And offer my bauble at the Well?

string.ID: Why can you not go?

strings.string: ▶Why can you not go?

string.ID: What is the Six Day Stilt again?

strings.string: ▶What is the Six Day Stilt again?

string.ID: I will make the journey.

strings.string: ▶I will make the journey.

string.ID: I cannot commit to this. Live and drink.

strings.string: ▶I cannot commit to this. Live and drink.

string.ID:
I am no rector, understand, but They are the molders of chrome. The gods under Shekhinah who wrought metal edifices from the raw Kasaphescence.
Will you go?

strings.string:
▶I am no rector, understand, but They are the molders of chrome. The gods under Shekhinah who wrought metal edifices from the raw Kasaphescence.
Will you go?

string.ID: Perhaps. Why?

strings.string: ▶Perhaps. Why?

string.ID: I cannot commit to this. Live and drink.

strings.string: ▶I cannot commit to this. Live and drink.

string.ID: I would ask you make an offering at the sacred Well of my bauble. Moon and sun, I beg you!

strings.string: ▶I would ask you make an offering at the sacred Well of my bauble. Moon and sun, I beg you!

string.ID: Why can you not go?

strings.string: ▶Why can you not go?

string.ID: What is the Six Day Stilt?

strings.string: ▶What is the Six Day Stilt?

string.ID: I will make the journey.

strings.string: ▶I will make the journey.

string.ID: I cannot commit to this. Live and drink.

strings.string: ▶I cannot commit to this. Live and drink.

string.ID:
Friend, I would be a smoldering heap, cooked to death by the ray of a dawnglider! I would be a slug-riddled corpse by the rifles of the Issachari!
There is no kindness in the Great Desert, and little more in the canyons. I cannot go and live.

strings.string:

There is no kindness in the Great Desert, and little more in the canyons. I cannot go and live.

string.ID: I cannot commit to this. Live and drink.

string.ID:
Moon and sun, =pronouns.formalAddressTerm=! You have my deep and many-sided thanks. Here, take the trinket now. And if you're to ever return, let us visit again.
Live and drink!

strings.string:
▶Moon and sun, =pronouns.formalAddressTerm=! You have my deep and many-sided thanks. Here, take the trinket now. And if you're to ever return, let us visit again.
Live and drink!

string.ID:
Yes! My neighbor-kin tire of the tale. I was scything the vine when the flat of my blade turned it loose from the soil. My heart has stirred before at the sight of chrome, but to free a small splinter myself, to slide a bead toward the beam on the abacus of Beauty...
Will you go, then? And offer my bauble at the Well?

▶Yes! My neighbor-kin tire of the tale. I was scything the vine when the flat of my blade turned it loose from the soil. My heart has stirred before at the sight of chrome, but to free a small splinter myself, to slide a bead toward the beam on the abacus of Beauty...
Will you go, then? And offer my bauble at the Well?

string.ID:

Will you go, then? And offer my bauble at the Well?

There is no kindness in the Great Desert. I cannot go and live.

Will you go, then? And offer my bauble at the Well?

There is no kindness deep in the Great Desert. I cannot go and live.

There is no kindness deep in the Great Desert. I cannot go and live.

Will you go, then? And offer my bauble at the Well?

string.ID:
-mm. Mmm? =player.FormalAddressTerm=?
{{emote|*Elder Irudad smiles.*}}
Live and drink. Come in- come sit 'neath the cool shade, 'cross a pillow there. And welcome to Joppa.
You may drink of our freshwater, too, and quench your thirst.

strings.string:
▶-mm. Mmm? =player.FormalAddressTerm=?
{{emote|*Elder Irudad smiles.*}}
Live and drink. Come in- come sit 'neath the cool shade, 'cross a pillow there. And welcome to Joppa.
You may drink of our freshwater, too, and quench your thirst.

string.ID: I'm back from Red Rock with the corpse of a pale spiderling. Elder, would you examine it?

strings.string: ▶I'm back from Red Rock with the corpse of a pale spiderling. Elder, would you examine it?

string.ID: What is this place, Joppa?

strings.string: ▶What is this place, Joppa?

string.ID: Do you sell wares here?

strings.string: ▶Do you sell wares here?

string.ID: I'm looking for work.

strings.string: ▶I'm looking for work.

string.ID: I'm looking for work.

strings.string: ▶I'm looking for work.

string.ID: Can you tell me about the Gyre and the Girsh nephilim again?

strings.string: ▶Can you tell me about the Gyre and the Girsh nephilim again?

string.ID: What can you tell me about the Six Day Stilt?

strings.string: ▶What can you tell me about the Six Day Stilt?

string.ID: Argyve wants me to meet the Barathrumites.

strings.string: ▶Argyve wants me to meet the Barathrumites.

string.ID:
-this? The oasis-hamlet. 'Neath the shelf of the world. A million breaths of salt the wind heaves over the Great Salt Desert Moghra'yi. And to the east, the rotting jungles of Qud.
Here in the crack between the two, watervine can grow, and we grow it. mmm, =player.formalAddressTerm=.

strings.string:
▶-this? The oasis-hamlet. 'Neath the shelf of the world. A million breaths of salt the wind heaves over the Great Salt Desert Moghra'yi. And to the east, the rotting jungles of Qud.
Here in the crack between the two, watervine can grow, and we grow it. mmm, =player.formalAddressTerm=.

string.ID: Can you tell me about Qud?

strings.string: ▶Can you tell me about Qud?

string.ID:
-mm, there? Land slopes up and is toothed in chrome steeples, ageless things. Looming over the old-earth tunnels, pillowed in rotting jungle and fungus groves. And broken against the mounts of the north, they are, in the shadow of the Spindle...
There are people, friends, communities. And friends-to-noone, too. History is thick as the high salt sun, =player.formalAddressTerm=, and where the past is ground up like matz meal, a mix of life sets in.
-mm, adventurous ones set off for their own splinter of artifact. To both Fates, life and death...

strings.string:
▶-mm, there? Land slopes up and is toothed in chrome steeples, ageless things. Looming over the old-earth tunnels, pillowed in rotting jungle and fungus groves. And broken against the mounts of the north, they are, in the shadow of the Spindle...
There are people, friends, communities. And friends-to-noone, too. History is thick as the high salt sun, =player.formalAddressTerm=, and where the past is ground up like matz meal, a mix of life sets in.
-mm, adventurous ones set off for their own splinter of artifact. To both Fates, life and death...

string.ID: -here? Speak to my daughter through the east door, for herbs. And sitting Tam in the southeast has all manner of trinket, against his chests o' drawers.

strings.string: ▶-here? Speak to my daughter through the east door, for herbs. And sitting Tam in the southeast has all manner of trinket, against his chests o' drawers.

string.ID:
-mm, work? The farmers are plagued by cave vermin. You might speak to Mehmet o' there, by the southern watervine patch.
And Argyve, too, =player.formalAddressTerm=. The tinker. Always looking for trinkets to wire between, heh. Go through his hut of sheet metal, to the southwest.

strings.string:
▶-mm, work? The farmers are plagued by cave vermin. You might speak to Mehmet o' there, by the southern watervine patch.
And Argyve, too, =player.formalAddressTerm=. The tinker. Always looking for trinkets to wire between, heh. Go through his hut of sheet metal, to the southwest.

string.ID: -mm, work? Try Argyve, =player.formalAddressTerm=. The tinker. Always looking for trinkets to wire between, heh. Go through his hut of sheet metal, to the southwest.

strings.string: ▶-mm, work? Try Argyve, =player.formalAddressTerm=. The tinker. Always looking for trinkets to wire between, heh. Go through his hut of sheet metal, to the southwest.

string.ID: -ahh, mm, such spectacle. The statues within, a revelation to the eyes. Chandlers enough to drain your skins dry 'twixt Shallows and Beetle Moon.

strings.string: ▶-ahh, mm, such spectacle. The statues within, a revelation to the eyes. Chandlers enough to drain your skins dry 'twixt Shallows and Beetle Moon.

string.ID: -mm, Barathrumites. Strange draft o'those bearfolk. They, mm, hah. They care not overly for outsiders. I hope Argyve sold you not a better welcome than you'll have.

strings.string: ▶-mm, Barathrumites. Strange draft o'those bearfolk. They, mm, hah. They care not overly for outsiders. I hope Argyve sold you not a better welcome than you'll have.

string.ID:
-this? Oh? Oh...
{{emote|*Elder Irudad pauses for several minutes.*}}
Warted leg? mm. Foul smell of sour gum? mmm. Moon and sun....
A girshling? This is a girshling.

strings.string:
▶-this? Oh? Oh...
{{emote|*Elder Irudad pauses for several minutes.*}}
Warted leg? mm. Foul smell of sour gum? mmm. Moon and sun....
A girshling? This is a girshling.

string.ID: What's a girshling?

strings.string: ▶What's a girshling?

string.ID:
Creature of plague, =player.formalAddressTerm=. mmm. This one...
{{emote|*Elder Irudad pauses.*}}
This one covered in slick and muscled out the bilge hose of sleeping Agolgot, in the cave under the Cloaca...
-mm, but here? Girshling this far west? There must be hundreds for one to reach... mm, does the Gyre widen again??

strings.string:

-mm, but here? Girshling this far west? There must be hundreds for one to reach... mm, does the Gyre widen again??

string.ID: I talked to a strange figure next to the girshling.

strings.string: ▶I talked to a strange figure next to the girshling.

string.ID: There was a strange figure shadowing the creature...

strings.string: ▶There was a strange figure shadowing the creature...

string.ID: I noticed the creature has had its fangs removed.

strings.string: ▶I noticed the creature has had its fangs removed.

string.ID:
{{emote|*Elder Irudad pauses.*}}
-mm, plagues. Of our great grandsires many-times-over. Salt, darkness, svardym-frog... Girshling.

strings.string:
▶{{emote|*Elder Irudad pauses.*}}
-mm, plagues. Of our great grandsires many-times-over. Salt, darkness, svardym-frog... Girshling.

string.ID:
{{emote|*Elder Irudad pauses.*}}
-mm, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Do not like to sour the air with a harsh word! But this tiding bites my liver like acid. mm, must ask Nima for an elixir of yuckwheat...

-mm, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Do not like to sour the air with a harsh word! But this tiding bites my liver like acid. mm, must ask Nima for an elixir of yuckwheat...

string.ID: I am sorry to cause pain, Elder.

strings.string: ▶I am sorry to cause pain, Elder.

string.ID: -mm, oh? In dyed robes, flashing gestures of hand? And ranting about pipe milk? A gyre wight, must be. They about worship the Girsh nephilim as gods.

strings.string: ▶-mm, oh? In dyed robes, flashing gestures of hand? And ranting about pipe milk? A gyre wight, must be. They about worship the Girsh nephilim as gods.

string.ID: Girsh nephilim?

strings.string: ▶Girsh nephilim?

string.ID:
{{emote|*Elder Irudad pauses.*}}
-mm, nephilim. Seventh plague. Girsh titans born on the Moon Stair, and quickened to life to eat our young. Sultan Resheph drove them back a chiliad ago, away to slumber. mm, do they rouse?

strings.string:
▶{{emote|*Elder Irudad pauses.*}}
-mm, nephilim. Seventh plague. Girsh titans born on the Moon Stair, and quickened to life to eat our young. Sultan Resheph drove them back a chiliad ago, away to slumber. mm, do they rouse?

string.ID: -mm, oh? A gyre wight, must be. They bind the teeth right up to their own gums, to make a show for the Girsh nephilim.

strings.string: ▶-mm, oh? A gyre wight, must be. They bind the teeth right up to their own gums, to make a show for the Girsh nephilim.

string.ID: Girsh nephilim?

strings.string: ▶Girsh nephilim?

string.ID:
-mm? No, =player.formalAddressTerm=! Your finding is rich in value to us. We are poor farmers, and sharpen our vinereapers is all we can do. But others? Perhaps more.
Take these prickly-boons as thanks. mm, I will not soon forget this, =name=. Leave me now to muse, kindly...

strings.string:
▶-mm? No, =player.formalAddressTerm=! Your finding is rich in value to us. We are poor farmers, and sharpen our vinereapers is all we can do. But others? Perhaps more.
Take these prickly-boons as thanks. mm, I will not soon forget this, =name=. Leave me now to muse, kindly...

string.ID:
-mm, yes? Plagues, a chiliad old. Seven such: girshlings, darkness. mm, svardym-frog...
Ah, nephilim, too, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Girsh titans who eat the young of kith and kin. Sultan Resheph drove them under the earth, but do they stir??

strings.string:
▶-mm, yes? Plagues, a chiliad old. Seven such: girshlings, darkness. mm, svardym-frog...
Ah, nephilim, too, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Girsh titans who eat the young of kith and kin. Sultan Resheph drove them under the earth, but do they stir??

string.ID: -mm, oh? You're wondering if they might come to Joppa, then?

strings.string: ▶-mm, oh? You're wondering if they might come to Joppa, then?

string.ID: mm, I am for you, =name=. Any friend of yours is too a friend of Joppa, and if those friends desire shelter I wouldn't dare turn them away. I only hope these lilypad-folk have the patience for a farmer's life. -mm, not as exciting here as it was in the Palladium Reef.

strings.string: ▶mm, I am for you, =name=. Any friend of yours is too a friend of Joppa, and if those friends desire shelter I wouldn't dare turn them away. I only hope these lilypad-folk have the patience for a farmer's life. -mm, not as exciting here as it was in the Palladium Reef.

string.ID: You have my thanks, Elder.

strings.string: ▶You have my thanks, Elder.

string.ID: -mm, blessings upon your generous heart, =name=. I mean no slight to these slynth, but it is too great a favor you ask of the people of Joppa.

strings.string: ▶-mm, blessings upon your generous heart, =name=. I mean no slight to these slynth, but it is too great a favor you ask of the people of Joppa.

string.ID: Have you spoken to the slynth, =name=? I am curious to hear what destination they choose.

strings.string: ▶Have you spoken to the slynth, =name=? I am curious to hear what destination they choose.

string.ID:
-mm, your luminous friends are settling in quite well.
There is yet a pall of ennui among some, but such is the case for any party of brave migrants. Ah, they will find their ground or their path, all in time. Some farmers show some small discomfort but that will pass in time.

strings.string:
▶-mm, your luminous friends are settling in quite well.
There is yet a pall of ennui among some, but such is the case for any party of brave migrants. Ah, they will find their ground or their path, all in time. Some farmers show some small discomfort but that will pass in time.

string.ID: My thanks, Elder.

strings.string: ▶My thanks, Elder.

string.ID:
-mm, ah, =name=. Come see how the slynth have become a part of Joppa!
Some cared not for the slow pace of our lives and struck out on their own, and with their thews and wits I have no doubt they will live to find purpose. mm, others are welcome to grow and flourish here in our marshes.

strings.string:
▶-mm, ah, =name=. Come see how the slynth have become a part of Joppa!
Some cared not for the slow pace of our lives and struck out on their own, and with their thews and wits I have no doubt they will live to find purpose. mm, others are welcome to grow and flourish here in our marshes.

string.ID: My thanks again, Elder.

strings.string: ▶My thanks again, Elder.

string.ID: Live and drink, =name=. Any news from Red Rock?

strings.string: ▶Live and drink, =name=. Any news from Red Rock?

string.ID: Yes. I found the vermin and bits of gnawed watervine. I carry one's corpse with me.

strings.string: ▶Yes. I found the vermin and bits of gnawed watervine. I carry one's corpse with me.

string.ID: None yet.

strings.string: ▶None yet.

string.ID: Live and drink, =name=.~ Taste what on the wind today, =name=?~ Moon and sun, =name=.~ I can taste lime, =name=. And mayhaps gallium?~ Aye, the pest-vanquisher! Live and drink, =name=.

strings.string: ▶Live and drink, =name=.~ Taste what on the wind today, =name=?~ Moon and sun, =name=.~ I can taste lime, =name=. And mayhaps gallium?~ Aye, the pest-vanquisher! Live and drink, =name=.

string.ID: A waterhand? Aye. Live and drink, traveller.

strings.string: ▶A waterhand? Aye. Live and drink, traveller.

string.ID: I am called =name=.

strings.string: ▶I am called =name=.

string.ID: Can you tell me about your village, Joppa?

strings.string: ▶Can you tell me about your village, Joppa?

string.ID: I am in search of work.

strings.string: ▶I am in search of work.

string.ID: Mehmet, the tongue says. Live and drink, =name=.

strings.string: ▶Mehmet, the tongue says. Live and drink, =name=.

string.ID: Watervine farm in the lap of the marsh. You've sucked the moisture out a vinewafer, yea? We tend the plant here.

strings.string: ▶Watervine farm in the lap of the marsh. You've sucked the moisture out a vinewafer, yea? We tend the plant here.

string.ID:
Wind off the Great Desert cools a touch and gives up moisture. Just enough. A tongue can taste a hundred kinds of wind, y'know?
Anywhile, that's where my wandering mind goes. More's about Joppa I say speak to our Elderfriend. Irudad. Up northwise the path.

strings.string:
▶Wind off the Great Desert cools a touch and gives up moisture. Just enough. A tongue can taste a hundred kinds of wind, y'know?
Anywhile, that's where my wandering mind goes. More's about Joppa I say speak to our Elderfriend. Irudad. Up northwise the path.

string.ID:
Aye? I have it, then.
Somethin' is eating our watervine, 'round Beetle Moon. Q-ruun says he saw a creature, spider-like, slinking in the brine. But no cave spider would dare get so near Warden's stomps.
I tasted a bit of red fleck in the pool. Shale, like we find in the soil by Red Rock...

strings.string:
▶Aye? I have it, then.
Somethin' is eating our watervine, 'round Beetle Moon. Q-ruun says he saw a creature, spider-like, slinking in the brine. But no cave spider would dare get so near Warden's stomps.
I tasted a bit of red fleck in the pool. Shale, like we find in the soil by Red Rock...

string.ID:
Hike there, will you? To Red Rock. Just about two parasangs north of Joppa.
Kill the vermin and bring one's corpse back, for seein' what it is. Elder will take care to pay you after, waterhand.

strings.string:
▶Hike there, will you? To Red Rock. Just about two parasangs north of Joppa.
Kill the vermin and bring one's corpse back, for seein' what it is. Elder will take care to pay you after, waterhand.

string.ID: I will do as you ask.

strings.string: ▶I will do as you ask.

string.ID: I'm not interested.

strings.string: ▶I'm not interested.
▶Aye.

string.ID:
Oh? Oh. {{emote|*Mehmet pauses.*}}
Don't like the look o' that thing. Best bring it to Elder. Hut's northwise up the path.

strings.string:
▶Oh? Oh. {{emote|*Mehmet pauses.*}}
Don't like the look o' that thing. Best bring it to Elder. Hut's northwise up the path.

string.ID: As you say.

strings.string: ▶As you say.
▶=generic=

string.ID: =player.apparentSpecies=? We are greeted! What do you desire?

strings.string: ▶=player.apparentSpecies=? We are greeted! What do you desire?

string.ID: I am =name=. Who are you?

strings.string: ▶I am =name=. Who are you?

string.ID: Do you live here?

strings.string: ▶Do you live here?

string.ID: What kind of creature are you?

strings.string: ▶What kind of creature are you?

string.ID: I desire nothing. Live and drink.

strings.string: ▶I desire nothing. Live and drink.

string.ID: It is a pleasure to know this, =player.apparentSpecies= =player.formalAddressTerm= =name=! I am Tam.

strings.string: ▶It is a pleasure to know this, =player.apparentSpecies= =player.formalAddressTerm= =name=! I am Tam.

string.ID:
Joppa is my home, yes.
I walked Moghra'yi in the caravans of my brethren and the saltback, but upon meeting Elder Irudad, knew at once to settle down here. You will understand, =player.formalAddressTerm= =player.apparentSpecies=, if you speak to him.

strings.string:
▶Joppa is my home, yes.
I walked Moghra'yi in the caravans of my brethren and the saltback, but upon meeting Elder Irudad, knew at once to settle down here. You will understand, =player.formalAddressTerm= =player.apparentSpecies=, if you speak to him.

string.ID: I am dromad, =player.apparentSpecies= =player.formalAddressTerm=. Some say saltstrider. Do you know this?

strings.string: ▶I am dromad, =player.apparentSpecies= =player.formalAddressTerm=. Some say saltstrider. Do you know this?

string.ID: I do.

strings.string: ▶I do.

string.ID: I do not.

strings.string: ▶I do not.

string.ID: My people have walked the salt for thousands of years, meeting every creature that lives and thinks. From Pale Sea to the marsh of Joppa, and under the Hanging Hills, our chests are drawn.

strings.string: ▶My people have walked the salt for thousands of years, meeting every creature that lives and thinks. From Pale Sea to the marsh of Joppa, and under the Hanging Hills, our chests are drawn.

string.ID: =player.apparentSpecies=? We are greeted! What do you desire?

strings.string: ▶=player.apparentSpecies=? We are greeted! What do you desire?

string.ID: What kind of creature are you?

strings.string: ▶What kind of creature are you?

string.ID: I desire nothing. Live and drink.

strings.string: ▶I desire nothing. Live and drink.

string.ID: I am dromad, =player.apparentSpecies= =player.formalAddressTerm=. Some say saltstrider. Do you know this?

strings.string: ▶I am dromad, =player.apparentSpecies= =player.formalAddressTerm=. Some say saltstrider. Do you know this?

string.ID:
Psst!
Hey, can I interest you in some Consortium wares?

strings.string:
▶Psst!
Hey, can I interest you in some Consortium wares?

string.ID: Welcome a-Joppa, friend. Stay peacelike, and we stay friends, hyeh? You make trouble, it’s my work a-split you open like a croc.~ Elder’s over my right shoulder, chemist a-left. I ask you pick one or turn around. I en’t here for chat.~ Live and drink, yonderling.~ {{emote|*Yrame grunts.*}}~ {{emote|*Yrame nods.*}}~ What follows, then?~ Got an eyeful, heh?~ Well. They en't ended you yet.

strings.string: ▶Welcome a-Joppa, friend. Stay peacelike, and we stay friends, hyeh? You make trouble, it’s my work a-split you open like a croc.~ Elder’s over my right shoulder, chemist a-left. I ask you pick one or turn around. I en’t here for chat.~ Live and drink, yonderling.~ {{emote|*Yrame grunts.*}}~ {{emote|*Yrame nods.*}}~ What follows, then?~ Got an eyeful, heh?~ Well. They en't ended you yet.

string.ID: I must search the Rustwells.

strings.string: ▶I must search the Rustwells.

string.ID: Mehmet has bade me travel to Red Rock.

strings.string: ▶Mehmet has bade me travel to Red Rock.

string.ID: I depart for Grit Gate soon.

strings.string: ▶I depart for Grit Gate soon.

string.ID: I journey North, to the Six Day Stilt.

strings.string: ▶I journey North, to the Six Day Stilt.

string.ID: Who are you?

strings.string: ▶Who are you?

string.ID: What is a Warden?

strings.string: ▶What is a Warden?

string.ID: Called Yrame, Warden a-Joppa. I kill trouble. Don't be trouble.

strings.string: ▶Called Yrame, Warden a-Joppa. I kill trouble. Don't be trouble.

string.ID: Nigh every settlement a-Qud keeps a Warden. We snuff threats to the peace.

strings.string: ▶Nigh every settlement a-Qud keeps a Warden. We snuff threats to the peace.

string.ID: Out East? Uegh. Wouldn't go, I. Git ta Qudzu. Like as rust the pauldrons right off a-shoulders.

strings.string: ▶Out East? Uegh. Wouldn't go, I. Git ta Qudzu. Like as rust the pauldrons right off a-shoulders.

string.ID: Up North? En't far. See them baboons, you put one's light out for me.

strings.string: ▶Up North? En't far. See them baboons, you put one's light out for me.

string.ID: Don't say? Well. Fates favor your feet, hyeh.

strings.string: ▶Don't say? Well. Fates favor your feet, hyeh.

string.ID: If you don't get dry-roasted by the fire snakes, ought be a time of times. Better hit all the food stalls for samples, hyeh?

strings.string: ▶If you don't get dry-roasted by the fire snakes, ought be a time of times. Better hit all the food stalls for samples, hyeh?

string.ID: Ahh, there is a new face. I am Nima Ruda, town apothecary. If your feet point to Qud, you’ll need some of my wares before you go.~ Live and drink, wayfarer.~ Time and rest are the surest way to dress a wound, but my wares can help if you’re in a hurry.~ The Fates watch you, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Don’t let your nostrums run dry on the road. I have what you need.

strings.string: ▶Ahh, there is a new face. I am Nima Ruda, town apothecary. If your feet point to Qud, you’ll need some of my wares before you go.~ Live and drink, wayfarer.~ Time and rest are the surest way to dress a wound, but my wares can help if you’re in a hurry.~ The Fates watch you, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Don’t let your nostrums run dry on the road. I have what you need.

string.ID: What wares do you offer?

strings.string: ▶What wares do you offer?

string.ID: Where are you from?

strings.string: ▶Where are you from?

string.ID: Witchwood for pain, bandages for bleeding, yuckwheat and honey for when your guts act up. Coldcaps when I can find them. Why not take a look?

strings.string: ▶Witchwood for pain, bandages for bleeding, yuckwheat and honey for when your guts act up. Coldcaps when I can find them. Why not take a look?

string.ID: I grew up right here in Joppa, daughter of the Elder and all. Spent some years delving, but gave it up after a few near escapes and nearly deadly wounds. I’m better suited to herbalism anyway, and my father worries less.

strings.string: ▶I grew up right here in Joppa, daughter of the Elder and all. Spent some years delving, but gave it up after a few near escapes and nearly deadly wounds. I’m better suited to herbalism anyway, and my father worries less.

string.ID: Will you inherit leadership of Joppa from your father?

strings.string: ▶Will you inherit leadership of Joppa from your father?

string.ID: Fates forfend. I would hardly like to lead a village and run a shop at the same time.

strings.string: ▶Fates forfend. I would hardly like to lead a village and run a shop at the same time.

string.ID: Fair enough. Live and drink.

strings.string: ▶Fair enough. Live and drink.

string.ID: Live and drink, traveler. Moist starapples for the road?~ Mind the trees, =player.formalAddressTerm=. They ain't yours.~ Now you keep your eyes off my young, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Can't go wrong with starapples, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Good for what ails ya.~ You know how to make starapple jam? If not, you can buy it from me.~ Spread starapple on yer matz! It's proof against thirst and harm alike.~ See my whiskers? Starapples. They'll boost your virility threefold.

strings.string: ▶Live and drink, traveler. Moist starapples for the road?~ Mind the trees, =player.formalAddressTerm=. They ain't yours.~ Now you keep your eyes off my young, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Can't go wrong with starapples, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Good for what ails ya.~ You know how to make starapple jam? If not, you can buy it from me.~ Spread starapple on yer matz! It's proof against thirst and harm alike.~ See my whiskers? Starapples. They'll boost your virility threefold.

string.ID: Live and drink, traveler. Are you hungry?~ Git ta pig mud. Mud?~ Yeh?~ Mind the pig leavins, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Now don't you go breaking my fence.~ You best not hurt my critters.~ I en't filthy. I'm muddy. Big difference.~ It's get meat here or risk a slugsnout ball in the gut. Your choice, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Good clean meat! Well. Clean as it gets.~ Moon and sun, =player.formalAddressTerm=.

strings.string: ▶Live and drink, traveler. Are you hungry?~ Git ta pig mud. Mud?~ Yeh?~ Mind the pig leavins, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Now don't you go breaking my fence.~ You best not hurt my critters.~ I en't filthy. I'm muddy. Big difference.~ It's get meat here or risk a slugsnout ball in the gut. Your choice, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Good clean meat! Well. Clean as it gets.~ Moon and sun, =player.formalAddressTerm=.

string.ID: Now don't you fret. My crabs are docile as dogs.~ Get close if you like, they don't pinch.~ You ever run into one of these in the wild? The lengths some folks will go for a crab leg!~ I hand-reared each one of these critters. They've had a life of luxury.~ Stressed crab means tough crab meat. Buy domesticated meat.~ Ain't they precious? Cute little buggers.~ My crabs are as gentle as can be. Delicious, too.~ They say we'll all be crabs, eventually.

strings.string: ▶Now don't you fret. My crabs are docile as dogs.~ Get close if you like, they don't pinch.~ You ever run into one of these in the wild? The lengths some folks will go for a crab leg!~ I hand-reared each one of these critters. They've had a life of luxury.~ Stressed crab means tough crab meat. Buy domesticated meat.~ Ain't they precious? Cute little buggers.~ My crabs are as gentle as can be. Delicious, too.~ They say we'll all be crabs, eventually.

string.ID: Need something?~ Hm.~ Sorry bout the smell.~ Watch for blood puddles.~ No lie, I love my job.~ Leeches. Blood. If that's what you want, I got what you want.~ I feed these critters what blood the ranchers have to spare.~ Sorry. Lost focus a bit. What do you need?~ Blood tastes all right, but I can't fathom living on it.

strings.string: ▶Need something?~ Hm.~ Sorry bout the smell.~ Watch for blood puddles.~ No lie, I love my job.~ Leeches. Blood. If that's what you want, I got what you want.~ I feed these critters what blood the ranchers have to spare.~ Sorry. Lost focus a bit. What do you need?~ Blood tastes all right, but I can't fathom living on it.

string.ID: By the Eaters, I'm exhausted. May I help you?~ Please don't open the gate.~ I beg you. Do not release the cats.~ I'll buy your shiniest things, if you'll sell them.~ I'm a cat herder. My parents were cat herders. Their parents were cat herders, and their parents. I don't understand why we do what we do but it is all I know.~ I've a glimmer of light for sale if you need one, wanderer.~ The cats are not for sale.~ I'm like to faint from this heat.

strings.string: ▶By the Eaters, I'm exhausted. May I help you?~ Please don't open the gate.~ I beg you. Do not release the cats.~ I'll buy your shiniest things, if you'll sell them.~ I'm a cat herder. My parents were cat herders. Their parents were cat herders, and their parents. I don't understand why we do what we do but it is all I know.~ I've a glimmer of light for sale if you need one, wanderer.~ The cats are not for sale.~ I'm like to faint from this heat.

string.ID: Mind your footing! Ha ha ha!~ Takes a simple person to tend a simple creature. I don't mind it.~ Bless this mess and bless you, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ What can I do for you? Need slime?~ Have you ever taken a swig of slime? It's not half bad!~ I keep my amoebas happy! Or, you know, whatever they got in place of happy.~ See how their skin glisters in the salt sun? Lovely.~ Now don't you dare pop my amoeba.~ I think I got all the puddles, but watch for slime all the same.

strings.string: ▶Mind your footing! Ha ha ha!~ Takes a simple person to tend a simple creature. I don't mind it.~ Bless this mess and bless you, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ What can I do for you? Need slime?~ Have you ever taken a swig of slime? It's not half bad!~ I keep my amoebas happy! Or, you know, whatever they got in place of happy.~ See how their skin glisters in the salt sun? Lovely.~ Now don't you dare pop my amoeba.~ I think I got all the puddles, but watch for slime all the same.

string.ID: Step in. Take shelter from the salt.~ What mazes and mandalas could be crafted by human hands that hope to surpass what nature wrought eons before our creation?~ How sublime, the striations of the snail shell. And such a lovely word, striation.~ I think often upon the gyre, from Resheph's gospels. Why do you imagine it is so named?~ Even in the imperfections of a spiral shell we see the perfection of nature.~ My snails aren't so suited to this climate. Some days I spend more water keeping them properly slimy than I make in sales.~ Snails find the spiral of another shell familiar and comforting. Should you wear one, they will look upon you favorably.~ There is kinship from mollusk to mollusk. What secrets do they know that we do not?

strings.string: ▶Step in. Take shelter from the salt.~ What mazes and mandalas could be crafted by human hands that hope to surpass what nature wrought eons before our creation?~ How sublime, the striations of the snail shell. And such a lovely word, striation.~ I think often upon the gyre, from Resheph's gospels. Why do you imagine it is so named?~ Even in the imperfections of a spiral shell we see the perfection of nature.~ My snails aren't so suited to this climate. Some days I spend more water keeping them properly slimy than I make in sales.~ Snails find the spiral of another shell familiar and comforting. Should you wear one, they will look upon you favorably.~ There is kinship from mollusk to mollusk. What secrets do they know that we do not?

string.ID: What d'ya want.~ Goat meat keeps good. Buy some afore you head back to the salt.~ What, you need a menu? I got goat meat and goat jerky.~ I hate my goats and they hate me, but we both hate every other body more.~ Absolutely miserable weather. Whatcha want?~ Meat for sale.~ Goats ain't fun to travel with, but they're good protection.~ I didn't ask for this life, but here we are. Wanna buy something?

strings.string: ▶What d'ya want.~ Goat meat keeps good. Buy some afore you head back to the salt.~ What, you need a menu? I got goat meat and goat jerky.~ I hate my goats and they hate me, but we both hate every other body more.~ Absolutely miserable weather. Whatcha want?~ Meat for sale.~ Goats ain't fun to travel with, but they're good protection.~ I didn't ask for this life, but here we are. Wanna buy something?

string.ID: Some say beetle jerky is too sour. I say, learn to cook!~ Look at their chitin! See the sheen? Means they're healthy.~ Beetles are fine companions, but don't leave your backpack and your pet beetlebum in the same room.~ Nothing wrong with beetle meat. Come, try it.~ Beetle jerky holds its own. You learn to appreciate the aftertaste.~ Meat, fresh and preserved alike, all at reasonable prices.~ Come to see my beasts? All hale and well-fed, I assure you.

strings.string: ▶Some say beetle jerky is too sour. I say, learn to cook!~ Look at their chitin! See the sheen? string.ID: Live and eat honey.~ Oh, look. It is a not-bear. Greetings, not-bear.~ Live and drink, little friend.~ I would enjoy some honey.~ {{emote|*grunting*}}~ {{emote|*snuffle*}}~ {{emote|*whuffling*}}~ {{emote|*heavy sigh*}}~ {{emote|*sigh*}}~ Oh my, what a cute not-bear. Greetings, cute not-bear.~ Oh.~ Hmm.~ Hmm. Oh! Greetings.~ Yes?~ Excuse me.~ Oh. Live and drink, not-bear.~ I cannot decide which I like best: berries, meat, or honey? I simply cannot decide.~ Glowfish are not the tastiest food, but they are the prettiest.~ I once traveled over a mountain, believing I would see something that I had not seen before once past the summit. I was disappointed to find that the other side of the mountain bore a striking resemblance to the one I'd just left. What is the purpose of mountains?

string.ID: Live and eat honey, bear friend.

strings.string: ▶Live and eat honey, bear friend.

string.ID: Mmm.~ Prey.~ Nnnngggh.~ I'm hungry.~ Live and... be eaten.~ {{emote|*licks lips*}}~ Meat.

strings.string: ▶Mmm.~ Prey.~ Nnnngggh.~ I'm hungry.~ Live and... be eaten.~ {{emote|*licks lips*}}~ Meat.

string.ID: Keep your distance, friend.

strings.string: ▶Keep your distance, friend.

string.ID: {{emote|*nods mutely*}}~ Shh. Listen.~ Live and drink.~ I am peaceful.~ Any dangers?~ {{emote|*ignores you*}}~ Let's not linger together.~ May the Eaters gift you.~ Scrap for goods?~ I might be willing to trade.~ {{emote|*shakes =pronouns.possessive= head*}}~ {{emote|*puts a finger to =pronouns.possessive= lips*}}~ I'm armed. Don't try anything.~ {{emote|*tenses as you approach*}}~ Found anything good?~ Finders keepers.~ Lot of good stuff down here. Lots of bad stuff too.

strings.string: ▶{{emote|*nods mutely*}}~ Shh. string.ID: By the sun, you're ugly.~ Pick a direction and walk in it.~ What do you want, lack-salt?~ Got nothing to say to a lack-salt.~ Keep your eyes moving, lack-salt.~ Hey lack-salt. How much water you got? No, don't ever answer that question.~ Be respectful of the red-and-white and we will get along.~ Keep your mouth covered, or the brine air will cure your lungs to jerky.~ Stay warm, lack-salt.~ Stay dry, lack-salt.

string.ID: Glory to Shekhinah.~ Humble before my Fathers, I walk.~ Live and drink, traveler. Show mercy to a weary pilgrim.~ Praise be upon Nisroch, who shelters us stiltseekers.

strings.string: ▶Glory to Shekhinah.~ Humble before my Fathers, I walk.~ Live and drink, traveler. Show mercy to a weary pilgrim.~ Praise be upon Nisroch, who shelters us stiltseekers.

string.ID: Live and drink, traveler. Welcome to the Stilt.

strings.string: ▶Live and drink, traveler. Welcome to the Stilt.

string.ID: Praise be to Shekhinah! O, sovereign Fathers... at last, I am here!

strings.string: ▶Praise be to Shekhinah! O, sovereign Fathers... at last, I am here!

string.ID: This is the Six Day Stilt, huh. It's... colossal, beautiful. I see why the chrome stewards gather here.

strings.string: ▶This is the Six Day Stilt, huh. It's... colossal, beautiful. I see why the chrome stewards gather here.

string.ID: So... many... folks....

strings.string: ▶So... many... folks....

string.ID: Is it true what they say? That it's a petrified kraken?

strings.string: ▶Is it true what they say? That it's a petrified kraken?

string.ID: What a grand bazaar! What's in each of these tents?

strings.string: ▶What a grand bazaar! What's in each of these tents?

string.ID: Live and drink, wardens.

strings.string: ▶Live and drink, wardens.

string.ID: You are among friends here, pilgrim. Stay peaceful.

strings.string: ▶You are among friends here, pilgrim. Stay peaceful.

string.ID:
Then you're not of the faith =player.reflexive=, huh? Me neither. Do go inside, though. She's a beauty. Got dyed glass high in her rafters, she does. And two marvelous carvings on the wings. Plus a light-sculpture of a god. Hear the sermon, too, as you like. The high priest is persuasive, but not half as persuasive as the cathedral herself. In beauty there is power, you know.
Either way, while you're in the cathedral or on the Stiltgrounds, stay peaceful.

strings.string:
▶Then you're not of the faith =player.reflexive=, huh? Me neither. Do go inside, though. She's a beauty. Got dyed glass high in her rafters, she does. And two marvelous carvings on the wings. Plus a light-sculpture of a god. Hear the sermon, too, as you like. The high priest is persuasive, but not half as persuasive as the cathedral herself. In beauty there is power, you know.
Either way, while you're in the cathedral or on the Stiltgrounds, stay peaceful.

string.ID:
Aye, aye. The clamor of it all can overwhelm.
The glowcrows say 'twas a bird-god who taught folks to gather like this, in large flocks. So blame birds.

strings.string:
▶Aye, aye. The clamor of it all can overwhelm.
The glowcrows say 'twas a bird-god who taught folks to gather like this, in large flocks. So blame birds.

string.ID:
Who knows? I've wondered it myself. Sometimes she'll catch my eye, when the moon's silver-bright, and she's there bearing down on the flats.
Whatever she is, she's gigantic. And old. Real old. Way older than the cathedral the Mechanimists built inside her.

strings.string:
▶Who knows? I've wondered it myself. Sometimes she'll catch my eye, when the moon's silver-bright, and she's there bearing down on the flats.
Whatever she is, she's gigantic. And old. Real old. Way older than the cathedral the Mechanimists built inside her.

string.ID:
Are you mad? You think I keep a tally of every shopkeeper that steps foot on the Stiltgrounds? They come and go as they please. You've got merchants of all types here. Winesellers, honey hawkers, bookbinders, cobblers.
Have a look around for =player.reflexive=. Following the road around the Stilt. There's tents the whole way round.

strings.string:
▶Are you mad? You think I keep a tally of every shopkeeper that steps foot on the Stiltgrounds? They come and go as they please. You've got merchants of all types here. Winesellers, honey hawkers, bookbinders, cobblers.
Have a look around for =player.reflexive=. Following the road around the Stilt. There's tents the whole way round.

string.ID: Live and learn, wanderer. Have you come across any books or scrolls in your travels? Do you care to donate one to the cathedral library? Whenever you return, you may speak to me and read anything you've donated.

strings.string: ▶Live and learn, wanderer. Have you come across any books or scrolls in your travels? Do you care to donate one to the cathedral library? Whenever you return, you may speak to me and read anything you've donated.
▶Yes.

string.ID: Where is the library?

strings.string: ▶Where is the library?

string.ID: What use is a library in this salt den? Or in the marshes, strangled by wild plants and poisoned by the glow? Wouldn't a stash of vinereapers serve us better?

strings.string: ▶What use is a library in this salt den? Or in the marshes, strangled by wild plants and poisoned by the glow? Wouldn't a stash of vinereapers serve us better?

string.ID: Not today. Live and drink, chronicler.

strings.string: ▶Not today. Live and drink, chronicler.

string.ID: You imagine they will thrive here at the Stiltgrounds, among the faithful?

strings.string: ▶You imagine they will thrive here at the Stiltgrounds, among the faithful?

string.ID: I do.

strings.string: ▶I do.

string.ID: This wouldn't be the first time the Stiltgrounds have hosted refugees, =name=, and make no mistake: it is a burden upon the church, Catechists and Protectors in particular. But your words echo loud in our hearts as our hallways. Some in our number will see the slynth as the chosen of chosen, and if I speak to them first, everyone else will take it as Shekhinah's will. Which, arguably, it would be. Tell the slynth that the Mechanimists will have them.

strings.string: ▶This wouldn't be the first time the Stiltgrounds have hosted refugees, =name=, and make no mistake: it is a burden upon the church, Catechists and Protectors in particular. But your words echo loud in our hearts as our hallways. Some in our number will see the slynth as the chosen of chosen, and if I speak to them first, everyone else will take it as Shekhinah's will. Which, arguably, it would be. Tell the slynth that the Mechanimists will have them.

string.ID: You have my thanks, Sheba.

strings.string: ▶You have my thanks, Sheba.

string.ID: I mean no slight to these slynth folk, =name=, but the Stiltgrounds have hosted refugees before and it is a substantial burden upon our stewards. Our resources and space are scant, and I must request that you find another home for them. May the Kasaphescence shine upon them, and you, in this endeavor.

strings.string: ▶I mean no slight to these slynth folk, =name=, but the Stiltgrounds have hosted refugees before and it is a substantial burden upon our stewards. Our resources and space are scant, and I must request that you find another home for them. May the Kasaphescence shine upon them, and you, in this endeavor.

string.ID: =name=, bless you. Have you brought tidings of the slynth?

strings.string: ▶=name=, bless you. Have you brought tidings of the slynth?

string.ID:
Praise be to Shekhinah, =name=, your slynth friends are hard workers and quick learners!
I can't help but feel a bit concerned at their ethic, and who in the church might take advantage of it. I hope to foster an interest in reading in them if I can, before they are taught incuriosity. Perhaps a book club?

strings.string:
▶Praise be to Shekhinah, =name=, your slynth friends are hard workers and quick learners!
I can't help but feel a bit concerned at their ethic, and who in the church might take advantage of it. I hope to foster an interest in reading in them if I can, before they are taught incuriosity. Perhaps a book club?

string.ID: My thanks, chronicler.

strings.string: ▶My thanks, chronicler.

string.ID:
Live and learn, =name=.
The slynth are settling in as folk do. I see some flank the Priests and Catechists with empty eye, but some have proven hungry for knowledge. I have established a weekly Canticle study group, and its numbers grow each meeting.
Praise be to Shekhinah for this meeting, =name=.

strings.string:
▶Live and learn, =name=.
The slynth are settling in as folk do. I see some flank the Priests and Catechists with empty eye, but some have proven hungry for knowledge. I have established a weekly Canticle study group, and its numbers grow each meeting.
Praise be to Shekhinah for this meeting, =name=.

string.ID: My thanks again, chronicler.

strings.string: ▶My thanks again, chronicler.

string.ID: Oh, we're in but the first phase of its foundation. The church has amassed a splendid collection of scripts through the years. Glorious Shekhinah, praise be upon Him, gifted us with several caches. The eremites work day and night reproducing them in the scriptorium, and I have taken it upon myself to beseech travelers, for the rarest finds often come from the least likely places.

strings.string: ▶Oh, we're in but the first phase of its foundation. The church has amassed a splendid collection of scripts through the years. Glorious Shekhinah, praise be upon Him, gifted us with several caches. The eremites work day and night reproducing them in the scriptorium, and I have taken it upon myself to beseech travelers, for the rarest finds often come from the least likely places.

string.ID: I will donate a book.

strings.string: ▶I will donate a book.

string.ID: What use is a library in this salt den? Or in the marshes, strangled by wild plants and poisoned by the glow? Wouldn't a stash of vinereapers serve us better?

strings.string: ▶What use is a library in this salt den? Or in the marshes, strangled by wild plants and poisoned by the glow? Wouldn't a stash of vinereapers serve us better?

string.ID: Live and drink, chronicler.

strings.string: ▶Live and drink, chronicler.

string.ID:
You share the pessimism of my kin, and several of the priests as well. My heart hears you, but listen to my words, and maybe you will come to feel as I do.
To devalue wisdom is to devalue the Kasaphescence. She shines in the void, refracting light, illuminating those around her. So does the written wisdom of our elders.
The machinery of chromium is complex in its divinity. Don't we do a disservice to our Fathers when we remain ignorant of it, of our past, of our future? Don't we deserve the joy of knowing? Bless Eschelstadt II, first Child, for he believes as I do.

strings.string:
▶You share the pessimism of my kin, and several of the priests as well. My heart hears you, but listen to my words, and maybe you will come to feel as I do.
To devalue wisdom is to devalue the Kasaphescence. She shines in the void, refracting light, illuminating those around her. So does the written wisdom of our elders.
The machinery of chromium is complex in its divinity. Don't we do a disservice to our Fathers when we remain ignorant of it, of our past, of our future? Don't we deserve the joy of knowing? Bless Eschelstadt II, first Child, for he believes as I do.

string.ID: I will donate a book.

strings.string: ▶I will donate a book.

string.ID: Where is the library?

strings.string: ▶Where is the library?

string.ID: Live and drink, chronicler.

strings.string: ▶Live and drink, chronicler.

string.ID: Peace and health in the light of the Star, pilgrim. Brood with me on the life of Resheph, if you are willing.

strings.string: ▶Peace and health in the light of the Star, pilgrim. Brood with me on the life of Resheph, if you are willing.

string.ID: I am.

strings.string: ▶I am.

string.ID: Who is Resheph?

strings.string: ▶Who is Resheph?

string.ID: What's inside the tent?

strings.string: ▶What's inside the tent?

string.ID: Live and drink, priest.

strings.string: ▶Live and drink, priest.

string.ID:
A spiritual patron of kith and kin, who did so much for us, and who leads me and others like me to the path of healing. For, above all, he was a healer. He dressed the wounds of the sick and rid the land of the plagues of the Gyre.
He was also a sultan, but he was the last sultan. He unbricked the walls of monocracy so we could pick berries in the orchards they hid.

strings.string:
▶A spiritual patron of kith and kin, who did so much for us, and who leads me and others like me to the path of healing. For, above all, he was a healer. He dressed the wounds of the sick and rid the land of the plagues of the Gyre.
He was also a sultan, but he was the last sultan. He unbricked the walls of monocracy so we could pick berries in the orchards they hid.

string.ID: I've more to ask.

strings.string: ▶I've more to ask.

string.ID: Live and drink, priest.

strings.string: ▶Live and drink, priest.

string.ID:
A quiet shrine to the Coiled Lamb, centuries old. Tucked away here, outside the marble parapets and cloaked in the dust of time, it's lost to those who'd sneer at the veneration of Resheph over other fathers.
Step inside and voice a prayer, if you are willing.

strings.string:
▶A quiet shrine to the Coiled Lamb, centuries old. Tucked away here, outside the marble parapets and cloaked in the dust of time, it's lost to those who'd sneer at the veneration of Resheph over other fathers.
Step inside and voice a prayer, if you are willing.

string.ID: I've more to ask.

strings.string: ▶I've more to ask.

string.ID: Live and drink, priest.

strings.string: ▶Live and drink, priest.

string.ID: Don't breathe in too deep, =player.formalAddressTerm=, I've set some glue to dry.~ Live and drink, but please do it elsewhere. I fear spills.~ Greetings, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Feel free to examine my books closely.~ Please inspect only the quality of the letters. I am not a librarian.~ These books can weather the salt and jungle alike.~ I assure you, the smell fades once the glue is dry.~ I've books for trade, if you're interested.

strings.string: ▶Don't breathe in too deep, =player.formalAddressTerm=, I've set some glue to dry.~ Live and drink, but please do it elsewhere. I fear spills.~ Greetings, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Feel free to examine my books closely.~ Please inspect only the quality of the letters. I am not a librarian.~ These books can weather the salt and jungle alike.~ I assure you, the smell fades once the glue is dry.~ I've books for trade, if you're interested.

string.ID: Everything I sell is the product of many hours of toil.~ Come closer, so I can see your face.~ Ink runs in my very veins, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ If you're looking to read, I have what you need.~ Please be gentle with the parchment.~ Do be quick, =player.formalAddressTerm=, as I've much work to do.~ Live and drink, reader.

strings.string: ▶Everything I sell is the product of many hours of toil.~ Come closer, so I can see your face.~ Ink runs in my very veins, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ If you're looking to read, I have what you need.~ Please be gentle with the parchment.~ Do be quick, =player.formalAddressTerm=, as I've much work to do.~ Live and drink, reader.

string.ID: Come here. No, closer. Don't mind the bees, they rarely sting.~ Don't be afraid to approach. The bees rarely sting.~ Care for some beejuice?~ Drink a dram of honey every morning, Slog itself couldn't make you sick.~ You know, bees communicate by dancing. Got a whole language.~ Without bees, all life in Qud would eventually die.~ Bees are smarter than you think. They got that hive mind, see.~ I eat honey matz every morning and I ain't been sick in decades.~ We'd all be dead without bees, you know.

Got a whole language.~ Without bees, all life in Qud would eventually die.~ Bees are smarter than you think. They got that hive mind, see.~ I eat honey matz every morning and I ain't been sick in decades.~ We'd all be dead without bees, you know.

string.ID: Use your gadgets hard, don't you? I can fix them.~ I can repair, recharge, and identify whatever you have! Within reason.~ If you've got anything you can't make heads or tails of it, give it here.~ You've got to respect a machine. Machines bite harder than any croc.~ You a maker?~ Take out what you've busted and I'll jury-rig it for a fair price.~ Need scrap?~ You get used to the nicks and burns, after years working with spark and solder.~ They say some folks can talk to machines. I say we all can, if we listen right.~ My fees for battery charging depend how empty the battery is when you bring it to me.~ Absolutely no refunds or returns on scrap.

string.ID: I would prefer not to interrupt this task long.~ How my joints ache! Buy something to justify my pain.~ Unfinished schematics are obviously not for sale. Everything else is.~ Disturb the trash if you must, but do not touch any of my papers.~ Are you a tinker? Surely I have something you wish to build.~ If you've the wits to build, I've got something you want.~ I have lost much to my dedication. Help me gain anew, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ So help me, Argent Fathers, if someone has changed the order of my papers...~ Please, =player.formalAddressTerm=, buy a schematic. I'm sure it will be of use to you.~ Even if you can't make a thing now, you could gain the insight later.

string.ID: I've the cure for what ails you.~ You don't look so good. You need more yuckwheat and honey in your diet.~ In the market for a tonic, =player.formalAddressTerm=? Spend water now or blood later, your choice.~ Prickly-boons and yuckwheat for trade.~ Cook your meals with yuckwheat if you feel sick. Catch a disease early enough and you can kill it.~ If you came for the humble pie, you had best not have led any mind-hunters here.~ "Ease the pain, addle the brain." Be careful when you chew witchwood bark.~ Don't eat the hoarshrooms too fast, now.~ Have you got enough tonics?~ Got a fungal infection? You'll want one of my spray bottles to apply the cure.~ Got a fungal infection? You'll want one of my spray bottles to apply the cure.~ Get your hands on the Corpus Choliys for disease and fungus cures.~ Get your hands on the Corpus Choliys for disease and fungus cures.

string.ID: I tell you, =player.formalAddressTerm=, my recipes come from years of experience. There's none the like.~ Finest food for parasangs! Finest food in Qud! Recipes and samples!~ I will share my food-secrets with you, =player.formalAddressTerm=, if you're willing to make it worth my while.~ Do you cook, =player.formalAddressTerm=? So long as you aren't the type to throw whatever local debris you find in the pot, I have wares for you.~ Not a word of lie, I studied under a chef who studied under Agate Severance Star herself. That's why my recipes are the best.~ Try my recipe. You'll believe =player.reflexive= to be judging the Carbide Chefs in the Kitchen Heptagon itself.~ Cookbooks are best named from the heart. Those who ridicule the name of a cookbook have lost their sense of wonder.~ Live and eat, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Live and drink, =player.formalAddressTerm=.

Recipes and samples!~ I will share my food-secrets with you, =player.formalAddressTerm=, if you're willing to make it worth my while.~ Do you cook, =player.formalAddressTerm=? So long as you aren't the type to throw whatever local debris you find in the pot, I have wares for you.~ Not a word of lie, I studied under a chef who studied under Agate Severance Star herself. That's why my recipes are the best.~ Try my recipe. You'll believe =player.reflexive= to be judging the Carbide Chefs in the Kitchen Heptagon itself.~ Cookbooks are best named from the heart. Those who ridicule the name of a cookbook have lost their sense of wonder.~ Live and eat, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Live and drink, =player.formalAddressTerm=.

string.ID: Smell a bit strong? That's how you know it's good.~ You can preserve almost anything. Al... most.~ Preserved ingredients cook better, safer.~ Everything I sell is safe to eat as it is.~ Welcome, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Need vittle?~ Crave a bit of salt, =player.formalAddressTerm=, or a load of salt?~ Nothing sadder than a cookfire and nothing to cook over it.~ Are you a chef, =player.formalAddressTerm=? My vittles are of the highest quality.~ Nourishment for the road, =player.formalAddressTerm=?

string.ID: Greetings, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Live and drink deeply, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Ah, =player.formalAddressTerm=, please come in.~ My wares are sweet and strong, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Care to try them?~ Tell me, =player.formalAddressTerm=, is there any sight more sad than a hookah tent without wine?~ Wine, cheese, bread. =player.FormalAddressTerm=, tell me, is there anything else you truly need?~ The kipper and I both know that the finest ingredient is time.~ Greetings, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Try some rose wine? One rose is fair, but as you may know from hanging around the Stiltgrounds, five is death.

string.ID: Liquids...~ Aren't they beautiful, =player.formalAddressTerm=? The bottles, the phials, the light shining through them.~ Live and drink, but not everything. Some things you don't drink.~ Is there any state of form so fine as a liquid?~ Pouring, decanting, collecting, mixing. I adore my calling.~ If it flows, I desire it. You should too, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Do you ever stop and think about fluids? Are they not divine?~ Someday I will plumb the depths of Bethesda Susa, that I may meet the Alchemist.~ Live and drink, and collect, and combine...

strings.string: ▶Liquids...~ Aren't they beautiful, =player.formalAddressTerm=? The bottles, the phials, the light shining through them.~ Live and drink, but not everything. Are they not divine?~ Someday I will plumb the depths of Bethesda Susa, that I may meet the Alchemist.~ Live and drink, and collect, and combine...

string.ID: Hold, aristocrat! I have wares to claim your interest.~ My implants are acquired peaceably, I assure you.~ How becoming you look, Aristocrat! But you could be more becoming.~ Tire of your legs? Arms? Hands? See what I have that fits you.~ Luxury internal adornments for the discerning Aristocrat.~ No additional sterilisation required, of course.~ Quality implants for sale at reasonable prices!~ You strike me as an Aristocrat who knows the value of artisanal organs.~ I recommend everything I carry. Not all at once, of course.~ Hope you'll "becoming" back, ha ha.~ Live and drink, Aristocrat.

strings.string: ▶Hold, aristocrat! I have wares to claim your interest.~ My implants are acquired peaceably, I assure you.~ How becoming you look, Aristocrat! Not all at once, of course.~ Hope you'll "becoming" back, ha ha.~ Live and drink, Aristocrat.

string.ID: Kill anyone valuable?~ You look dangerous. Ever go hunting for parts?~ Got guts?~ Can you imagine sticking one of these things inside you? Disgusting.~ I've plenty water if you've got implants to sell.~ Always check becoming nook shelves for parts.~ Y'ain't peeled open any Sons or Daughters, have you?~ Less I know about where my stock comes from, the better.~ I'll still take parts you ain't washed off, it's fine.~ If you can butcher a boar, you can do the same to a man. Just ain't meat you're looking for.~ My best customers don't ask questions. My best stock asked too many.~ Live and drink.

string.ID: Need something to complete your ensemble, =player.formalAddressTerm=?~ With a good hat, =player.formalAddressTerm=, you'll last longer in the salt sun.~ Peruse my wares, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Adorn your head or heads.~ Greetings, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Care for a new topper?~ You need a new hat, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Or a helmet, if that's the life you lead.~ If you're passing through baboon country, you'll want to protect your head, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Live and drink, =player.formalAddressTerm=.

strings.string: ▶Need something to complete your ensemble, =player.formalAddressTerm=?~ With a good hat, =player.formalAddressTerm=, you'll last longer in the salt sun.~ Peruse my wares, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Or a helmet, if that's the life you lead.~ If you're passing through baboon country, you'll want to protect your head, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Live and drink, =player.formalAddressTerm=.

string.ID: Hello, hello, =player.formalAddressTerm=, let's get your weary feet covered.~ Come in, =player.formalAddressTerm=, and let me 'shoe' you around, ha ha!~ Boots! Shoes! Slippers! Sabatons! How would you prefer to cover your feet, =player.formalAddressTerm=?~ Even as high-quality as my products are, =player.formalAddressTerm=, I don't suggest you go walking in the fracti to test them out.~ Anything you need to ask 'a boot', =player.FormalAddressTerm=? Just a little cobbler's joke, there.~ Hot sands out there, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Is your footwear protecting you?~ Hello, =player.formalAddressTerm=! Care to be shod?~ Walk a few parasangs in my shoes, =player.formalAddressTerm=, and you'll wonder how you ever did otherwise.~ Live and drink, =player.formalAddressTerm=.

string.ID: Please, =player.formalAddressTerm=, do come in. Take your time browsing my wares.~ Welcome, =player.formalAddressTerm=, to the sole bastion of class in this wretched place.~ Please knock the sand from your feet, =player.formalAddressTerm=. It gets everywhere.~ Ah, =player.formalAddressTerm=, I can certainly help you.~ How may I clothe you, =player.formalAddressTerm=?~ Now, =player.formalAddressTerm=, I know you must have an eye for fashion, if you're here.~ Oh dear. Who dressed you, =player.formalAddressTerm=? Let me help you, please.~ Live and drink, =player.formalAddressTerm=.

string.ID: {{emote|*silent nod*}}~ Careful. It's hot.~ =player.FormalAddressTerm=. Need protection?~ Be quick about it, eh?~ Greetings.~ Mm?~ I've got my eye on you.~ Leather, ring, and plate, to keep you alive.~ Don't get near the hearth.~ =player.FormalAddressTerm=. Live and drink.

strings.string: ▶{{emote|*silent nod*}}~ Careful. It's hot.~ =player.FormalAddressTerm=. Need protection?~ Be quick about it, eh?~ Greetings.~ Mm?~ I've got my eye on you.~ Leather, ring, and plate, to keep you alive.~ Don't get near the hearth.~ =player.FormalAddressTerm=. Live and drink.

string.ID: Hand-coats for sale! Spare your digits the indignity of early removal!~ Best protect your hands, =player.formalAddressTerm=. You don't know how much you need them until a madpole takes one.~ Light gloves, heavy gloves, gauntlets. Don't let your hands go bare, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ One size fits all, =player.formalAddressTerm=. If I sell it to you, it fits.~ How do I get my gloves so supple? I'll never tell.~ Moving on soon, =player.formalAddressTerm=? My gloves and gauntlets need no maintenance, so finely are they crafted.~ Live and eat, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Live and drink, =player.formalAddressTerm=.

strings.string: ▶Hand-coats for sale! Spare your digits the indignity of early removal!~ Best protect your hands, =player.formalAddressTerm=.
