I'll never tell.~ Moving on soon, =player.formalAddressTerm=? My gloves and gauntlets need no maintenance, so finely are they crafted.~ Live and eat, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Live and drink, =player.formalAddressTerm=.

string.ID: You can't go wrong with my slugspitters, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Guns, guns, guns! Don't they just make you smile?~ =player.FormalAddressTerm=, I tell you: there is no defense like a good, and distant, offense.~ Ahh, I love the smell of cordite. You know, that sulfury smell? Accelerants make a fine perfume, if you ask me.~ You know, =player.formalAddressTerm=, I once had an traveler from Yawningmoon tell me my shop smelled of home. Now I want to visit! Hah!~ May you find adequate cover and more loot than you can carry, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ I used to be a wayfarer like you, =player.formalAddressTerm=, but old wounds slow you down. Cherish the time while you have it.~ I wish I could allow you to test my wares in the shop, =player.formalAddressTerm=, but walk a parasang in any direction and you'll find a target.~ Might not want to touch anything on the workbenches, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Live, drink, and shoot, =player.formalAddressTerm=, in whichever order you like.

string.ID: Need something blown up, =player.formalAddressTerm=?~ Grenades do no good sitting in a pack. Don't forget to use them.~ =player.FormalAddressTerm=, there is little you can't solve with a well-thrown grenade... as long as you don't stand too close.~ Defoliant and fungicide are perfectly safe, but you may wish to avoid breathing too deeply all the same.~ Can I serve you something explosive, =player.formalAddressTerm=?~ You'll be back, =player.formalAddressTerm=, provided you don't blow =player.reflexive= up.~ Greetings, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Be careful with my wares as you peruse them.~ How is your throwing arm, =player.formalAddressTerm=? Barring that, do you feel lucky?~ It's a dangerous job, =player.formalAddressTerm=, but well worth it.~ The vintners say that 'one rose is fair, but five is death'. I can sell you blossoms that mean death no matter the number.~ Live and drink, =player.formalAddressTerm=.

I can sell you blossoms that mean death no matter the number.~ Live and drink, =player.formalAddressTerm=.

string.ID: There's a shape in every stone waiting to be brought out.~ If you bend the light just so, it frays into brilliance.~ I can wait years for the inspiration to craft another figurine. I have before.~ What manner of jewel are our eyes, to skew light into thought?~ Enter, =player.formalAddressTerm=, and behold my jewels and figurines.~ Uncrafted jewels and metals buy and sell for the same cost, but my art's price tag is up to me.~ Every statuette is a tribute, of a kind, but not every tribute is received well.~ Wouldn't these make a fine conversation piece for a water ritual?~ Beautiful baubles and gleaming gemstones over here!

strings.string: ▶There's a shape in every stone waiting to be brought out.~ If you bend the light just so, it frays into brilliance.~ I can wait years for the inspiration to craft another figurine. string.ID: A well-polished and well-picked gem, no matter how rough, is as beautiful a work of art as any figurine.~ Lean in close to see the detail. No, don't touch.~ Within my gemstones there burns a brighter fire than in some hearts.~ Water-wealth means nothing if you cannot carry it. Need jewels?~ Friend, I have precious metals and jewels to adorn or trade.~ Raw metals and gems buy and sell for a fixed water-cost.~ Come, wanderer, change some of that heavy water for a pocketful of riches.~ Water Barons don't adorn themselves with water, after all.

string.ID: There are caves everywhere, you dolt! Scoop the surface of the marsh, or head on east to the rust wells, or wander into the Desert for all I care...

string.ID:
{{emote|*Argyve whistles.*}}
Impressive, you! Maybe you're fit to poke around my workshop and swap scrap with me. I have been wanting another apprentice. So unfortunate about Skref, what with the disembowelment and all. Take a seat, there.

strings.string:
▶{{emote|*Argyve whistles.*}}
Impressive, you! Maybe you're fit to poke around my workshop and swap scrap with me. I have been wanting another apprentice. So unfortunate about Skref, what with the disembowelment and all. Take a seat, there.

string.ID:
{{emote|*Argyve raises both eyebrows.*}}
Now, to screw the nut on the bolt with an explanation! I'm on the cusp, you see. A grand discovery. The Weirdwire Conduit is near assembled, and once it is, we'll be able to chat with anyone... in instant time! from here to the Yd Freehold. But before I can finish, I need wire. As much as you can find... at least two hundred feet. You should be able to scavenge it from the rust wells.

strings.string:
▶{{emote|*Argyve raises both eyebrows.*}}

string.ID: I'll fetch you your wire.

string.ID: I'm not interested.

string.ID: The wire! Give it to me!

string.ID: Take the wire.

strings.string: ▶Take the wire.

string.ID: I don't have enough yet.

strings.string: ▶I don't have enough yet.

string.ID:
{{emote|*Argyve hoots*}}
Yes, yes! Beautiful wire! -oh, before I forget, I repaired an old recoiler for you. Use it whenever you wish to hop back to Joppa quickly. Now, give me a few moments to attach the wire...

strings.string:

Yes, yes! Beautiful wire! -oh, before I forget, I repaired an old recoiler for you. Use it whenever you wish to hop back to Joppa quickly. Now, give me a few moments to attach the wire...

string.ID: I will return.

strings.string: ▶I will return.

string.ID: It's working! Genius! Genius! Noise in the static- I hear it! I hear!... what's this? What *is* that? Wait...

strings.string: ▶It's working! Genius! Genius! Noise in the static- I hear it! I hear!... what's this? What *is* that? Wait...

string.ID: It's repeating itself...

strings.string: ▶It's repeating itself...

string.ID: {{emote|*Argyve mumbles to himself for several minutes.*}}

strings.string: ▶{{emote|*Argyve mumbles to himself for several minutes.*}}

string.ID: Apprentice! Come, here! Something strange is occurring. The Conduit is picking up a signal, some sort of repeating transmission. I cannot decipher it, however. I lack cryptogull eggs and, well, never you mind! I have a great task for you, my apprentice. Do you accept it?

strings.string: ▶Apprentice! Come, here! Something strange is occurring. The Conduit is picking up a signal, some sort of repeating transmission. I cannot decipher it, however. I lack cryptogull eggs and, well, never you mind! I have a great task for you, my apprentice. Do you accept it?

string.ID: Can I know what it is?

strings.string: ▶Can I know what it is?

string.ID: -yes. You must seek out Barathrum the Old, the eldest and wisest tinker alive. He lives with his followers the Barathrumites under the arch of Grit Gate to the northeast, in the jungle-strangled ruins of Qud. He will know what to make of the signal.

strings.string: ▶-yes. You must seek out Barathrum the Old, the eldest and wisest tinker alive. He lives with his followers the Barathrumites under the arch of Grit Gate to the northeast, in the jungle-strangled ruins of Qud. He will know what to make of the signal.

string.ID: Who are these Barathrumites?

strings.string: ▶Who are these Barathrumites?

string.ID: I require no further information. I will go.

strings.string: ▶I require no further information. I will go.

string.ID: Disciples of Barathrum. Mostly urshiib, like their mentor- quilled albino bears who prefer their candle-dim caves to the sun-salted surface of the jungle. A thousand years ago Barathrum and his kin crossed the Homs Delta into the rusting heart of Qud. He has spent centuries peeling the chrome shells off time's artifacts in his workshop. If he cannot decipher the signal, no one can.

strings.string: ▶Disciples of Barathrum. Mostly urshiib, like their mentor- quilled albino bears who prefer their candle-dim caves to the sun-salted surface of the jungle. A thousand years ago Barathrum and his kin crossed the Homs Delta into the rusting heart of Qud. He has spent centuries peeling the chrome shells off time's artifacts in his workshop. If he cannot decipher the signal, no one can.

string.ID: I accept the task, Argyve.

strings.string: ▶I accept the task, Argyve.

string.ID: I must think on this.

strings.string: ▶I must think on this.

string.ID: Farewell, Argyve.

strings.string: ▶Farewell, Argyve.

string.ID:
Splendid! Perfect! Let me record the signal to disk, which you'll need to guard with your life, I'm afraid.
I'll rig up a droid scrambler for you, too. You see, the Barathrumites have programmed a troupe of waydroids to guard the approach to Grit Gate. With the scrambler, you'll needn't worry about them. Wait there.

strings.string:

string.ID: Here you are. Now, go! Off with you! May you live long enough to do my bidding. Away, away!

strings.string: ▶Here you are. Now, go! Off with you! May you live long enough to do my bidding. Away, away!

string.ID: Farewell, Argyve.

strings.string: ▶Farewell, Argyve.

string.ID: The Barathrumites say I must plumb a cave called Golgotha before joining them.

strings.string: ▶The Barathrumites say I must plumb a cave called Golgotha before joining them.

string.ID: Argyve, I am no apprentice. The Barathrumites call me =factionaddress:Barathrumites= now.

strings.string: ▶Argyve, I am no apprentice. The Barathrumites call me =factionaddress:Barathrumites= now.

string.ID: Need anything, Argyve?

strings.string: ▶Farewell, Argyve.

string.ID: My apprentice! What?

strings.string: ▶My apprentice! What?

string.ID: Who are the Barathrumites again?

strings.string: ▶Who are the Barathrumites again?

string.ID:
Did they, now? Well you're not MY =factionaddress:Barathrumites=!
Grit Gate is not Joppa, you pridesome solder-nail, and in this house you are apprentice still.
Now, what did you want? Be quick!

strings.string:
▶Did they, now? Well you're not MY =factionaddress:Barathrumites=!
Grit Gate is not Joppa, you pridesome solder-nail, and in this house you are apprentice still.
Now, what did you want? Be quick!

string.ID:
-what?
No, no, I'm far too engrossed to see to your curiosity. I'm sure the Barathrumites have something for you to do.

strings.string:
▶-what?
No, no, I'm far too engrossed to see to your curiosity. I'm sure the Barathrumites have something for you to do.

string.ID:
Welcome to Grit Gate. I am Otho, Barathrum's steward. I apologize for the manner of our introduction, but we must take precautions. Qud is a very unforgiving place.
You demonstrate tremendous promise to have returned from Golgotha with such inexperience. Take this firearm as your reward. It bears the mark of our finest gunsmith, Sparafucile. Take this bracelet, as well.
Return when you are ready to discuss the signal.

It takes more than a willing spirit to be trusted here, wayfarer.
Prove your worth and bring us a waydroid, and we will have more to speak of.

▶It takes more than a willing spirit to be trusted here, wayfarer.

string.ID: Are you ready to discuss the signal?

strings.string: ▶Are you ready to discuss the signal?
▶Yes.
▶No.

string.ID:
The signal is a repeat transmission being broadcast from an unknown source.=V0tinkeraddendum= One of our tinkers, {{m|Q Girl}}, discovered it while rigging a long wave detector. Unfortunately, it's encrypted, and we do not have the means here to decrypt it. You may be of some help in this matter, however.
We've long known the location of a fully functioning {{W|baetyl}} within the bowels of the great hall {{C|Bethesda Susa}}. The Mechanimists have consecrated the site around it and built a temple there. Q Girl claims to have developed a means to decrypt the signal, but she needs the computing power of the baetyl. If you can infiltrate the Mechanimist compound, you may be able to engage the baetyl and decode the signal.

strings.string:
▶The signal is a repeat transmission being broadcast from an unknown source.=V0tinkeraddendum= One of our tinkers, {{m|Q Girl}}, discovered it while rigging a long wave detector. Unfortunately, it's encrypted, and we do not have the means here to decrypt it. You may be of some help in this matter, however.
We've long known the location of a fully functioning {{W|baetyl}} within the bowels of the great hall {{C|Bethesda Susa}}. The Mechanimists have consecrated the site around it and built a temple there. Q Girl claims to have developed a means to decrypt the signal, but she needs the computing power of the baetyl. If you can infiltrate the Mechanimist compound, you may be able to engage the baetyl and decode the signal.

string.ID: What is a baetyl?

strings.string: ▶What is a baetyl?

string.ID:
They are antique stones located in certain places deep within the caverns of Qud. We believe they are some sort of hyper-advanced machines built by the Eaters. Often one claims to possess a sentience of its own. However, most of them have gone haywire in the eons since their creation; it is rare indeed to discover one whose circuitry is wholly uncorroded.
The Mechanimists worship this one as an idol, and they will protect it at all costs. You will need to find a way through their host to the baetyl itself.
Do you believe you can accomplish this task?

strings.string:
▶They are antique stones located in certain places deep within the caverns of Qud. We believe they are some sort of hyper-advanced machines built by the Eaters. Often one claims to possess a sentience of its own. However, most of them have gone haywire in the eons since their creation; it is rare indeed to discover one whose circuitry is wholly uncorroded.
The Mechanimists worship this one as an idol, and they will protect it at all costs. You will need to find a way through their host to the baetyl itself.
Do you believe you can accomplish this task?

string.ID: Yes, I do.

strings.string: ▶Yes, I do.

string.ID: I must think on this task.

strings.string: ▶I must think on this task.

string.ID:
Good, =factionaddress:Barathrumites=. Speak to {{m|Q Girl}} in the workshop. She'll encode her instructions for the baetyl onto a copy of the disk.
There's one more thing. The baetyl is located beneath the ancient cryobarrios of the Eaters. Time has worked to erode the mechanisms that contain their cryogenic mist. That freezing vapor billows out of the chambers freely now, cooling the entire cavern. You will want to procure warm clothing to protect =player.reflexive=.
The spoils of the Mechanimists are yours to keep. Remember, =factionaddress:Barathrumites=, Barathrum will look kindly upon your service.

string.ID: I must bring the decoded signal to Barathrum immediately. Return in a few hours. By then I'll have discussed our next course of action with Barathrum and will have further instructions for you.

string.ID: =name=, I've brought the decoded signal to Barathrum, and he's finished musing on it. We have fresh instructions for you, =factionaddress:Barathrumites=. Are you ready to hear them?

strings.string: ▶=name=, I've brought the decoded signal to Barathrum, and he's finished musing on it. We have fresh instructions for you, =factionaddress:Barathrumites=. Are you ready to hear them?
▶Yes.

string.ID:
Barathrum needs you for an undertaking of great importance. You must journey to {{C|Omonporch}} far to the north. There the Spindle stretches from earth to sky. Unfortunately, a troublesome merchant from the Consortium of Phyta has relocated there and declared xerself Earl of Omonporch. We need you to broker a deal so that we may lease control of the Spindle. Failing that, you'll need to dispose of the self-appointed Earl.
Be careful on your approach to Omonporch, =factionaddress:Barathrumites=. So far east into the reaches of Qud, the Putus Templar lie in wait.

▶Barathrum needs you for an undertaking of great importance. You must journey to {{C|Omonporch}} far to the north. There the Spindle stretches from earth to sky. string.ID:
The Putus Templar, or the Sons and Daughters, as they call themselves, are an order of knights who claim descendancy from the Eaters, the ancient folk who wrought the chrome halls of Qud. Beware them, for while they despise all mutants, they harbor a special malice for Barathrum.
Take care that you do not find =player.reflexive= inside one of their slave pens.

string.ID:
It's as I feared, =name=. Grit Gate is being assailed. The Putus Templar must have followed you back from Omonporch.
Let us use the precious little time we have before they arrive to prepare our defenses.

strings.string:
▶It's as I feared, =name=. Grit Gate is being assailed. The Putus Templar must have followed you back from Omonporch.
Let us use the precious little time we have before they arrive to prepare our defenses.

string.ID: What can I do?

strings.string: ▶What can I do?

string.ID: Go to the mainframe room and scan the shale surrounding Grit Gate for anomalies. Now, =name=!

strings.string: ▶Go to the mainframe room and scan the shale surrounding Grit Gate for anomalies. Now, =name=!

string.ID: I'll go now.

strings.string: ▶I'll go now.

string.ID:
With the chrome key card I gave you, you now have access to our power grid. There are chain laser emplacements and force projectors across the enclave. Use Ereshkigal's reconnaissance to decide which defenses to enable. You can also broadcast an overclock command or activate Rodanis Y by interfacing with Ereshkigal.
Be mindful of the amperage draw, though. If you overdraw the grid, you could cause brownouts.
Act quickly, =name=! The Templar near us even as we speak.

strings.string:
▶With the chrome key card I gave you, you now have access to our power grid. There are chain laser emplacements and force projectors across the enclave. Be mindful of the amperage draw, though. If you overdraw the grid, you could cause brownouts.

string.ID: I'll do my best to defend Grit Gate.

string.ID: That rumbling... what was it? An explosion? Hmm...

strings.string: ▶That rumbling... what was it? An explosion? Hmm...

string.ID: What are you thinking, Otho?

strings.string: ▶What are you thinking, Otho?

string.ID:
Grave thoughts, =name=. Listen to me now. Take this key card, go to Ereshkigal's room, and-- oh, that's the mainframe. It's what she prefers to be called.
Go to her room, access Ereshkigal, and scan the shale surrounding the enclave for anomalies. I've asked her to ready her sensors.
Update me with what you learn. You may use the intercom in the northeast corner of Ereshkigal's room to deliver your update.
Go, quickly! I'd soon be disabused of my fears.

string.ID:
Furthermore, I spoke with Barathrum. He praised your handling of the Earl of Omonporch, and he thanks you for the bravery you exhibited in defending Grit Gate.
The attack today reminds us: for too long have we put our faith in the isolation of our guild and the preoccupations of the Putus Templar. The looming threat of another attack impels Barathrum to accelerate his plans, and with them, your position in our guild.
You are raised to Disciple, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Barathrum wishes to speak with you immediately.

string.ID: Be straightforward, disciple. You mean to ask if we will house them.

strings.string: ▶Be straightforward, disciple. You mean to ask if we will house them.

string.ID: I am uncertain that you know the enormity of what you ask me, =name=. Nonetheless, I cannot deny what you have done for our order. These slynth must be tested as you were, but should they show the mettle and drive set by your example, we will accept them as apprentices.

string.ID: You have grown bold beyond your station. What you have asked of us you have not earned. If you must ask again, become worthier first.

string.ID:
I did not expect to admit this, disciple, but the refugees have met my expectations. Like you, they have shown more than a willing spirit in work and curiosity both.
The slynth have promise, and you may have been right to bring them to us.

string.ID: It's a word I say out of excitement. Sort of a semantic extension of the feeling I get when I see a quetzal. Oh, a quetzal is a pretty bird in the trogon family. I tend to incorporate things I like into my idiolect.

string.ID:
Oh. Are you lost, =player.formalAddressTerm=?
I don't mind that you're here, but I was not expecting anyone.

string.ID:
I don't know.
Klanq's opacity is alluring, frustrating, and dangerous. Like Klanq, my thoughts on Klanq evade easy explanation.
What you build together will be amazing. Craft well.

string.ID:
These are the final chapters of this story, =name=, and likely of many stories more too.
It will be well to see the other side of all this, one way or another.

string.ID:
You're going to the Thin World? I confess to some measure of envy.
I have dreamt many times of disappearing into a cool ocean of information, shaking the cruft of my physical form from newly-freed quills. If that came of my waking life, would I then dream as chore-doing Iseppa in her chambers? Perhaps it's best I don't know.

strings.string:
▶You're going to the Thin World? I confess to some measure of envy.

string.ID:
Bethesda Susa is an antipodal place, a gallery of life and death and the stages between. Its depths prolong life and end it early, remove life from the flow of days or return it.
It will seek to make you late. Take care you come back on time.

strings.string:
▶Bethesda Susa is an antipodal place, a gallery of life and death and the stages between. Its depths prolong life and end it early, remove life from the flow of days or return it.
It will seek to make you late. Take care you come back on time.

string.ID:
Though I adore the sights and smells of Omonporch, its bug problem becomes distracting.
If I'm to travel there, I always bring something they cannot zip away from.

strings.string:
▶Though I adore the sights and smells of Omonporch, its bug problem becomes distracting.
If I'm to travel there, I always bring something they cannot zip away from.

string.ID:
Yes. That was not the voice of the caverns.
It feels like one of my nightmares come to life at last.

strings.string:
▶Yes. That was not the voice of the caverns.

string.ID:
I have not.
I would, however, love to meet him. He seems a fun fungus.
But I daren't go. I fear the sludges.

▶I have not.

But I daren't go. I fear the sludges.

string.ID: You fear sludge?

strings.string: ▶You fear sludge?

string.ID: I see.

strings.string: ▶I see.

string.ID:
I fear sludges, the kind you may no longer describe with 'some'. Born of the ancient stuff of existence, possessed of malice and wanting nothing more than to eat whatever they can, and they can eat whatever. It is even worse when they drink.
Take care with them.

strings.string:
▶I fear sludges, the kind you may no longer describe with 'some'. Born of the ancient stuff of existence, possessed of malice and wanting nothing more than to eat whatever they can, and they can eat whatever. It is even worse when they drink.
Take care with them.

string.ID:
I am always tired, =player.formalAddressTerm=.
My sleep comes in fits and starts, and always with ghastly visions. Sometimes my rest must be coaxed along with medicine.

strings.string:

Mm-hmm.

string.ID:
I am Iseppa, and she is me.
I've given thought to being someone else, but never enough to try.

strings.string:
▶I am Iseppa, and she is me.
I've given thought to being someone else, but never enough to try.

string.ID: I am contemplating the distinction between animal and rock. Why are they different? How much like a rock must an animal be when it ceases to be an animal?~ I am considering the window of consciousness through which each of us views the universe. What happens to it when we die?~ I am taking inventory of my faculties, and looking for any that I might not previously have considered.~ I am considering the thought as a discrete object. I wish to determine whether I am able to think a single thought only, and to determine how to distinguish it from another thought in the same vein.~ I am considering the determination of goodness and badness in a thing, and how it is determined. The interaction between data and subjective evaluation, and the values that guide us that we cannot put to words.~ I am contemplating the Spindle's place in Qud, its position as a conceptual focal point. How much of what we know of the Spindle is the craft of those before us, carried forward?~ I am considering narrative inheritances. The stories we were told when our minds were more putty-like, the follies that shaped who we are, that shape the whole of Qud.

strings.string: ▶I am contemplating the distinction between animal and rock. Why are they different? How much like a rock must an animal be when it ceases to be an animal?~ I am considering the window of consciousness through which each of us views the universe. What happens to it when we die?~ I am taking inventory of my faculties, and looking for any that I might not previously have considered.~ I am considering the thought as a discrete object. I wish to determine whether I am able to think a single thought only, and to determine how to distinguish it from another thought in the same vein.~ I am considering the determination of goodness and badness in a thing, and how it is determined. The interaction between data and subjective evaluation, and the values that guide us that we cannot put to words.~ I am contemplating the Spindle's place in Qud, its position as a conceptual focal point. How much of what we know of the Spindle is the craft of those before us, carried forward?~ I am considering narrative inheritances. The stories we were told when our minds were more putty-like, the follies that shaped who we are, that shape the whole of Qud.

string.ID:
I have visited the rainbow wood but once, and there I sampled an array of strange foods, one of which allowed me an unusual lens through which to view the world. It was nothing like I had ever experienced, and I imagined such wondrous recipes. I wrote them all down as best I could, of course.
Sadly, once I returned to my ordinary frame of reference, my scribblings proved impossible to read. So it goes.

strings.string: ▶Live and drink, food-tinkerer.

string.ID:
What you smell is Grit Gate's signature dish. The Porridge is a recipe passed down through generations of Barathrumites, and it is the food that inspired me to pursue my craft. Yes, outsiders quail at the intensity of the scent, for its flavor is as bold as its effects!
We use cuisine to channel lightning from our bodies! Other recipes may let us breathe fire, or learn the secrets of the Eaters. The Porridge is as precious a part of our legacy as the Barathrum Clock or the foaminator.

strings.string:
▶What you smell is Grit Gate's signature dish. The Porridge is a recipe passed down through generations of Barathrumites, and it is the food that inspired me to pursue my craft. Yes, outsiders quail at the intensity of the scent, for its flavor is as bold as its effects!
We use cuisine to channel lightning from our bodies! Other recipes may let us breathe fire, or learn the secrets of the Eaters. The Porridge is as precious a part of our legacy as the Barathrum Clock or the foaminator.

string.ID: Live and drink, food-tinkerer.

strings.string: ▶Live and drink, food-tinkerer.

string.ID:
Oh, it changes by the hour, sometimes the minute. Preserve this, observe that, add anything, taste everything.
But the starapple of my eye, the Spindle up which I cast my ambitious gaze... is edible vapor. Food that you eat, food that you breathe. Sadly, to date the most I have managed is an herbed saline suspension. Salty air, if you will.

strings.string:
▶Oh, it changes by the hour, sometimes the minute. Preserve this, observe that, add anything, taste everything.
But the starapple of my eye, the Spindle up which I cast my ambitious gaze... is edible vapor. Food that you eat, food that you breathe. Sadly, to date the most I have managed is an herbed saline suspension. Salty air, if you will.

string.ID: Vapor... and salt?

strings.string: ▶Vapor... and salt?

string.ID: Good luck with your experiments, then.

strings.string: ▶Good luck with your experiments, then.

string.ID: Well, I should be going.

strings.string: ▶Well, I should be going.

string.ID: Yes. The flavor, the breathability, all successful, but the barrier between flavor and food is in the calories, and they have yet eluded me. But it is only a matter of time. I am patient, and I am relentless.

strings.string: ▶Yes. The flavor, the breathability, all successful, but the barrier between flavor and food is in the calories, and they have yet eluded me. But it is only a matter of time. I am patient, and I am relentless.

string.ID: Good luck, then.

strings.string: ▶Good luck, then.

string.ID: I will leave you to it. Live and drink.

strings.string: ▶I will leave you to it. Live and drink.

string.ID:
I have no need for luck, but I appreciate your well-wishes nonetheless.
May your own endeavors drive you as mine drive me. Did you wish to speak of anything else?

strings.string:
▶I have no need for luck, but I appreciate your well-wishes nonetheless.
May your own endeavors drive you as mine drive me. Did you wish to speak of anything else?

string.ID: Live and drink, food-tinkerer.

strings.string: ▶Live and drink, food-tinkerer.

string.ID: Kitchen? You think this a mere kitchen?

strings.string: ▶Kitchen? You think this a mere kitchen?

string.ID: It certainly looks like a kitchen.

strings.string: ▶It certainly looks like a kitchen.

string.ID: No, of course it's a laboratory, I wasn't thinking.

strings.string: ▶No, of course it's a laboratory, I wasn't thinking.

string.ID: Why don't I see myself out?

strings.string: ▶Why don't I see myself out?

string.ID:
And I suppose the Stilt is a modest church, its great bazaar a junk sale?
Look about you. Every instrument you see is precision-calibrated, every tool handcrafted and built to last. In this room, sustenance and ingenuity come together to evolve cuisine itself, to shape not this culture alone but, over time, every culture. Is that kind of influence the product of a kitchen? Can a simple clay oven in the flower fields do what we do here? Has every kitchen an indelible influence over Qud?
{{emote|*He frowns.*}}
Should they? Should we not all?

strings.string:
▶And I suppose the Stilt is a modest church, its great bazaar a junk sale?
Look about you. Every instrument you see is precision-calibrated, every tool handcrafted and built to last. In this room, sustenance and ingenuity come together to evolve cuisine itself, to shape not this culture alone but, over time, every culture. Is that kind of influence the product of a kitchen? Can a simple clay oven in the flower fields do what we do here? Has every kitchen an indelible influence over Qud?
{{emote|*He frowns.*}}
Should they? Should we not all?
▶Yes?
▶No?

string.ID: I'm lost.

strings.string: ▶I'm lost.

string.ID: *mutter 'live and drink' while backing away*

strings.string: ▶*mutter 'live and drink' while backing away*

string.ID:
But perhaps you are right, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Think for a moment.
Every ingredient in the soup of collective knowledge is a valuable one, and who am I to elevate myself over more humble pioneers? But! All the more reason for us to regard cuisine (and by extension, culture itself) to be a scientific endeavor, an ongoing trial-and-error, a blending of what we know and what we don't know, calling upon reality itself to be our guide.
You are more insightful than I realized, =name=. Thank you for this discussion. Did you need aught else?

strings.string:

string.ID: I propose an accord, =factionaddress:Barathrumites=: You remove =player.reflexive= from my sight immediately, and I will refrain from asking that Ereshkigal reduce you to your component atoms.

strings.string: ▶I propose an accord, =factionaddress:Barathrumites=: You remove =player.reflexive= from my sight immediately, and I will refrain from asking that Ereshkigal reduce you to your component atoms.

string.ID: I'm going, I'm going.

strings.string: ▶I'm going, I'm going.

string.ID: Not like this. After all we've accomplished...

strings.string: ▶Not like this. After all we've accomplished...

string.ID: Don't lose hope.

strings.string: ▶Don't lose hope.

string.ID: Ah. It's you again, returning from ever more unreturnable locales. Alive and come to bother the disagreeable urshiib.

strings.string: ▶Ah. It's you again, returning from ever more unreturnable locales. Alive and come to bother the disagreeable urshiib.

string.ID: What do you think of Klanq's visit?

strings.string: ▶What do you think of Klanq's visit?

string.ID: Can we talk, Aloysius?

strings.string: ▶Can we talk, Aloysius?

string.ID:
I did not consider that my life could be further upturned. Truly, I have learned much and I hate it all.
Once you lot reach the spindle's apex, perhaps you could be convinced to stay there? Or perhaps I could go in your stead.

strings.string:
▶I did not consider that my life could be further upturned. Truly, I have learned much and I hate it all.

string.ID: We will miss you too, Aloysius. Live and drink.

strings.string: ▶We will miss you too, Aloysius. Live and drink.

string.ID:
I spent so long preparing for the eventuality that my home might be breached.
I was not ready. This sense of violation burns like electrocautery.

strings.string:
▶I spent so long preparing for the eventuality that my home might be breached.
I was not ready. This sense of violation burns like electrocautery.

string.ID: I must enter Brightsheol through the Tomb of the Eaters.

string.ID: Good. Shut the sarcophagus door behind you.

strings.string: ▶Good. Shut the sarcophagus door behind you.

string.ID: Perhaps I will.

strings.string: ▶Perhaps I will.

string.ID:
Of course it was only a matter of time before you came to speak to me.
I don't suppose I can convince you to let me tend to my duties in peace? I know nothing of interest to a wayfarer. Each of my days is like the others; I maintain and protect my children, and this is enough. If I desire conversation, there is Ereshkigal.

string.ID:
Bethesda Susa is a vibrant and thriving ecosystem in which we have no place. That said, I certainly would not complain if someone were to clear out its Mechanimist infestation.
Should you travel there, watch your step. The fronds of a lurking beth can rapidly exsanguinate fleshy creatures such as we.

string.ID:
I know that Omonporch is a miserable, hot place and Asphodel is a self-important churl.
I don't even like bananas.

string.ID:
Speaking to other organics is as strenuous to me as any physical exercise.
My reclusiveness is not born of antipathy; I simply cannot converse as easily as you do and don't wish to learn how.

string.ID:
Ereshkigal is the mainframe computer of Grit Gate. She keeps watch through the thin world, as she would put it, while we maintain her presence in the thick world.
I feel as though she and I understand one another.

string.ID:
=name=, you are back! I feared we would lose you in the Tomb, but you look better than well. Perhaps I should have had greater faith, or at least less worry.
Have you visited Barathrum's workshop, by the by? Klanq and Q Girl await you there.

string.ID:
There are pools of convalessence there. You see, when cryogenic mist condenses, it forms a cool, luminous liquid that's restorative if you're able to bathe in it.
Oh! And in one of the ruined wards, the Alchemist keeps their shop. Who's the Alchemist, you ask? A sort of enigmatic figure -- amateur liquid-tinker, poet, merchant. Their methods aren't scientific, but they are useful if you're seeking a specific kind of liquid. Just be careful around them, =name=.

string.ID:
{{emote|*Hortensa chuckles.*}}
Years. Decades on decades. Centuries, perhaps. Most of these wet-earred cubs were merely sketches in their mothers' dreambooks when I arrived to study under Barathrum. We knew so little then, know so little now.

string.ID: Could you tell me about the other Barathrumites?

strings.string: ▶Could you tell me about the other Barathrumites?

string.ID: Are you a liquid-tinker?

strings.string: ▶Are you a liquid-tinker?

string.ID:
{{emote|*Hortensa chuckles.*}}
You are sharp, =name=. In a way that's what I am. But liquids are more willful than scrap. I can't solder them together; they would run away, hide in the shale cracks, slowly come apart and disappear. I moreso think of myself as a wisewoman in dialogue with them -- I manage their moods and phases. My notebooks are full of their quirks and caprices. It's a wonder, isn't it, how at just the right temperature and pressure the continuity of matter is smashed apart? How the gaseous butterfly flits out of the dense worm?

strings.string:

string.ID: After supper I like to retreat to the library, take a storybook off the shelves, flop down on the chairbear, and lose myself in another world. Many of these worlds feature palaces, markets, gardens, ships. Many of those places have bells. When they do, I always think of Mafeo. More than anyone else, Mafeo could be a character in the bright world of a story, where this dusty place is itself confined to a mere storybook.

string.ID: Stay safe, Shem.

string.ID: Approach. Be easy. You are my herefriend, my nowfriend.~ Would you like to read me a story?~ I know of so many other ways to be.~ Where does it end?~ I live, but do I drink?~ Would you like to eat vapor?~ Quetzal, I say.~ {{emote|*Shem nods.*}}~ The gaseous butterfly flits out of the dense worm.~ I am sharp. I am handy.~ {{emote|*Shem yawns.*}} I am yawning.~ 'Immaculate Chrome' is my favorite.

string.ID: You're a chromeling... that speaks? Can you understand me?

string.ID: I am glad you are safe, =name=.

string.ID: I wonder if the distributed consciousness of a fungal entity is similar to that of a distributed machine mind. I shall ask Father when he is not so busy.

strings.string: ▶I wonder if the distributed consciousness of a fungal entity is similar to that of a distributed machine mind. I shall ask Father when he is not so busy.

string.ID: Is... is this a question trick? I suppose I cannot know what you intend. Can I understand you?

string.ID: What kind words. It seems so with you, too.

string.ID:
Would you like to hear? When I was first put together by Father and friends, I was Shem 2, the second iteration of the make-me project.
As I came along, scampered through the halls, listened to the stories Neek read me, climbed onto Sparafucile's workbench to have my screws replaced, I realized I was not what I could be. And so I downgraded myself to Shem 1.
That has happened three times.

strings.string:
▶Would you like to hear? When I was first put together by Father and friends, I was Shem 2, the second iteration of the make-me project.
As I came along, scampered through the halls, listened to the stories Neek read me, climbed onto Sparafucile's workbench to have my screws replaced, I realized I was not what I could be. And so I downgraded myself to Shem 1.
That has happened three times.

string.ID: Are you worried that you're getting further away from your ideal self?

strings.string: ▶Are you worried that you're getting further away from your ideal self?

string.ID: It's unclear to me that I should be.

strings.string: ▶It's unclear to me that I should be.

string.ID: I am your friend, =name=.

string.ID: Who are you? What? Please, do not disturb me.

string.ID:
The Templar are assaulting the enclave? Oh dear, dear...
May our guns' lasers shine with the light of the Kasaphescence.

strings.string:
▶The Templar are assaulting the enclave? Oh dear, dear...
May our guns' lasers shine with the light of the Kasaphescence.

string.ID: I must go.

strings.string: ▶I must go.

string.ID:
Why, =name=, Brightsheol treated you well. There is a new gravity about you; your proverbial boots ring louder in the Annals with each step.
I imagine you're off to Teach's study? They're already at work down there.

strings.string:
▶Why, =name=, Brightsheol treated you well. There is a new gravity about you; your proverbial boots ring louder in the Annals with each step.
I imagine you're off to Teach's study? They're already at work down there.

string.ID: What do you think of Klanq's presence?

strings.string: ▶What do you think of Klanq's presence?

string.ID: Light shine through you, Jacobo. Let's talk.

strings.string: ▶Light shine through you, Jacobo. Let's talk.

string.ID:
I admit a burning curiosity to see the joined imagination of our Q Girl and Pax Klanq, and no doubt yours as well. Watching such a creation burgeon from empty space to fullness of being would be a joyful entry in the chronicles of my life, but...
Too many fingers tangle in the honeypot, as my cubhood mentor would tell me.

string.ID:
Never before had the Templar broken so far through our defenses. We live a new reality now, one harder to weather.
Is there anything you need, =name=?

Be certain to visit the village of Ezra. The Daughter of Exile who lives there is as good a tinker as any I know, and she always has surplus she's willing to sell.

string.ID:
Beauty manifest, whose chromium shoals are Awe itself. In my belief system, She's the being from whom all metal was birthed, out in the ever-void. There are pieces of Her in every chrome belfry and every machine. Even bits of Her in our own blood.
For me, Her essence extends beyond mere metal. Anything that's ordered, She infuses: a poem, a mathematical proof, a clean workspace... so definitely not Q Girl's.

string.ID:
Don't I know it. I've had to invent eight separate systems of organization to manage them all. At the moment I'm trying out a new one, Harmonices Spiralis. Spiral towers with heights increasing according to the harmonic series of numbers. It's... fine.
The problem is I'm always inscribing more disks. New contraptions. Reverse-engineered artifacts. It's a good problem to have, I suppose.
Take a look. See if any interest you.

string.ID:
We're a vibrant community here. A circle of monks mapping the outer lattices and raising viaducts where we need to.
We remain secluded to protect ourselves. Otho and Barathrum insist on it. They are wise, and I defer to them. My collaboration with Sheba Hag does cause them worry, but they tolerate it, bless their hearts.

Then it tells you and you go get the bracelets.

string.ID: You go and run at Q Girl and tap all the gadgets and tap her on the head. Then you sneak by Otho's office. Then you hug Shem -1 and you drag them to the library and read to them. Sometimes Barathrum and Hortensa are in there, and they smile at you. Then you get hungry and you roll toward the kitchen. You slurp honey from the vase and Dardi glares at you. You say, "I'm just 'jidding'." Then you climb the pipes and whisper to Aloysius, "Live and drink, live and drink, live and drink." Then you pat the chromelings on their heads. You say to Ereshkigal, "boom boom boom boom boom I love you." Then you sneak into storage and pat all the chromelings on their heads. You take a nap in the peptic chair. Then you get a bright idea and go back to your room to write it in your notebook.

string.ID:
[several minutes pass]
So you wish to study with us. Unfortunately, we require more than a willing spirit.
Qud is not =villageZeroName=. You will need to prove your worth, that you might not waste our time and efforts. Travel to the great cavern Golgotha to the north. Within its halls you will find a cache of dysfunctional waydroids.
Recover one, repair it, and return here. If we are satisfied with your work, you will be admitted to our order. Otherwise, you will not be.
Do you accept this arrangement?

strings.string:

Recover one, repair it, and return here. If we are satisfied with your work, you will be admitted to our order. Otherwise, you will not be.

string.ID:
I always knew this part of our story would come. Our efforts today determine the genre of the tale we tell. Is this a triumphant epic, or a tale of woe?
Fight well, =player.formalAddressTerm=.

Such interesting times we inhabit, =name=!
Good to see you well. Is there anything you need?

string.ID:
What novelty, to shelter the mysterious Klanq! I have heard no stories of this tinker-fungus that could be described as dull, though ‘calamitous' could apply to more than one.
My mind tells tales of what might be brewing in the basement, but I am quite relieved to be out here rather than down there.

strings.string:

string.ID:
Coming from anyone else, I would ask that further japery be left to me.
But from you? I wouldn't startle to see you return wearing a Sultan's burial mask, having destroyed half a dozen invincible cherubim in the doing. Fates be with you.

string.ID:
My condolences to your sense of smell, =player.formalAddressTerm=.
Golgotha is an execrable place in more ways than one, and I would advise you not to visit without a healthy stock of yuckwheat and honey. If you can cook, a meal with yuckwheat may banish a disease before it comes into its own. Bring salves or urberries, too, and mind your feet in the Cloaca.

strings.string:
▶My condolences to your sense of smell, =player.formalAddressTerm=.
Golgotha is an execrable place in more ways than one, and I would advise you not to visit without a healthy stock of yuckwheat and honey. If you can cook, a meal with yuckwheat may banish a disease before it comes into its own. Bring salves or urberries, too, and mind your feet in the Cloaca.

string.ID: Bethesda Susa? Lovely, but a bit dangerous for a holiday destination. You'll want to bring bandages and warm clothing. Why not take a look at my stock in case something suits you?

string.ID:
It's a lovely place, and the bananas are delicious.
As for the so-called Earl, well. I'm loath to recognize nobility to begin with, and I cannot decide whether Asphodel claiming xyr own title is better or worse than if xe inherited it.

strings.string:
▶It's a lovely place, and the bananas are delicious.

string.ID: Live and drink, Mafeo.

string.ID:
Nothing short of explosives or heavy equipment could have made such a sound.
Be ready for the worst, =player.formalAddressTerm=.

▶Nothing short of explosives or heavy equipment could have made such a sound.

string.ID: Live and drink, Mafeo.

string.ID:
The Rainbow Wood is a fair bit too dangerous for a casual promenade, but nothing compares to its beauty. Once, I viewed it from above by means of a gyrocopter, and I will never forget the sights that I saw.
Nor will I forget crashing to the ground because the gyrocopter broke, but every adventure has its complications, wouldn't you say?

strings.string:
▶The Rainbow Wood is a fair bit too dangerous for a casual promenade, but nothing compares to its beauty. Once, I viewed it from above by means of a gyrocopter, and I will never forget the sights that I saw.
Nor will I forget crashing to the ground because the gyrocopter broke, but every adventure has its complications, wouldn't you say?

string.ID: Live and drink, Mafeo.

string.ID:
Oh, I sell whatever sundries that meet my standards of quality, with some measure of curation. I try to ensure that my shelves carry a bit of many things, but you can count on finding more than enough ammunition and a few recoilers that can lead you back here in difficult times.
If you have anything in need of identification or repair, I can take care of that for you for a few drams as well.

strings.string:
▶Oh, I sell whatever sundries that meet my standards of quality, with some measure of curation. I try to ensure that my shelves carry a bit of many things, but you can count on finding more than enough ammunition and a few recoilers that can lead you back here in difficult times.
If you have anything in need of identification or repair, I can take care of that for you for a few drams as well.

string.ID: Live and drink, Mafeo.

strings.string: ▶Live and drink, Mafeo.

string.ID:
Why, this place is Grit Gate! O the vaulted halls, the glint of chrome, the gentle hum of chain turret emplacements!
There's nowhere like Grit Gate in the whole of Qud, =player.formalAddressTerm=. I've journeyed in my comparatively short time, but I always return here. The very air buzzes with knowledge, as well as quite a few other things.

▶Why, this place is Grit Gate! O the vaulted halls, the glint of chrome, the gentle hum of chain turret emplacements!

string.ID: Your twinblades are works of art. Where did you get them?

strings.string: ▶Your twinblades are works of art. Where did you get them?

string.ID: Crowsong, Deathwonder, a colony of ants eating me, the leaves, the light, and there on.

strings.string: ▶Crowsong, Deathwonder, a colony of ants eating me, the leaves, the light, and there on.

string.ID: Hiding, no. Being grass. The feeling of animate being. Radiate inward like a turned out star.

string.ID: Why are you here, in Kyakukya?

strings.string: ▶Why are you here, in Kyakukya?

string.ID: Death is the color of everything but sometimes it waves in bright ribbons, like here. The whittlers weigh their passing goods, and the walls are corpse eaters.

strings.string: ▶Death is the color of everything but sometimes it waves in bright ribbons, like here. The whittlers weigh their passing goods, and the walls are corpse eaters.

string.ID: Tugged from the claws of one who had become a cord in time's silly carpet. I outrooted the hilts and sheathed the blades, and now I am he. I still have the nail dirt.

strings.string: ▶Tugged from the claws of one who had become a cord in time's silly carpet. I outrooted the hilts and sheathed the blades, and now I am he. I still have the nail dirt.

string.ID: Friend! Guns? Knives? Hats? Cucumbers?

strings.string: ▶Friend! Guns? Knives? Hats? Cucumbers?

string.ID: You're a member of the Consortium of Phyta, right? What do you know about the Earl of Omonporch?

strings.string: ▶You're a member of the Consortium of Phyta, right? What do you know about the Earl of Omonporch?

string.ID: What are you? What's your story?

strings.string: ▶What are you? What's your story?

string.ID: I'm Yurl, chandler and Consortium notary. As for my story, I've been growing out of this pot for a while now. Before that, I was in another pot.

strings.string: ▶I'm Yurl, chandler and Consortium notary. As for my story, I've been growing out of this pot for a while now. Before that, I was in another pot.
▶Consortium?

string.ID:
Yes, the Consortium of Phyta. We're a merchant fellowship of trees, vines, shrubs, weeds, flowers, herbs, cacti, algae -- most sorts of plants, really.
I can't say I trust any of them, but there is no doubting their usefulness. My shelves are full and the gossip flows.

strings.string:

I can't say I trust any of them, but there is no doubting their usefulness. My shelves are full and the gossip flows.

strings.string: ▶Let's change the subject.

string.ID:
I am a gentleplant, -friend-. Uncross your roots and figure it out.
Live and DRINK.

strings.string:
▶I am a gentleplant, -friend-. Uncross your roots and figure it out.
Live and DRINK.

string.ID:
Asphodel the socialite? Asphodel the scoundrel? You can hate xym -- and I do -- but you have to admire xym (I don't).
The truth of it is that Plysago had the idea first, to lay claim to the Spindle per some precedent of law established in Abram's time. Of course, Plysago isn't around to make their case, are they?

strings.string:
▶Asphodel the socialite? Asphodel the scoundrel? You can hate xym -- and I do -- but you have to admire xym (I don't).
The truth of it is that Plysago had the idea first, to lay claim to the Spindle per some precedent of law established in Abram's time. Of course, Plysago isn't around to make their case, are they?

string.ID: How can I convince Asphodel to lease the Spindle to Barathrum?

strings.string: ▶How can I convince Asphodel to lease the Spindle to Barathrum?

string.ID:
Asphodel trades on reputation and favors. Xe is likely to want to leverage your connections, so be in good social standing with a few factions for xem to even consider it.
Now, alternatively, if you're loved by the Consortium, xe will feel the pressure to acquiesce. Xe has enough enemies among phyta.
Of course, where all else fails, you can always sharpen your shears, if you get my meaning.
{{emote|*Yurl winks with one of their leaves.*}}

string.ID: I see. Live and drink, Yurl.

strings.string: ▶I see. Live and drink, Yurl.

string.ID: Be ape-still and muse, wanderer, and welcome to my village, Kyakukya. Have some mulled mushroom cider!

strings.string: ▶Be ape-still and muse, wanderer, and welcome to my village, Kyakukya. Have some mulled mushroom cider!

string.ID: You are... an albino ape.

strings.string: ▶You are... an albino ape.

string.ID: Why do you call it "your" village?

strings.string: ▶Why do you call it "your" village?

string.ID: What can you tell me about Kyakukya?

strings.string: ▶What can you tell me about Kyakukya?

string.ID: Is there work to be found here?

strings.string: ▶Is there work to be found here?

string.ID: Have you heard news of girshlings on Qud's surface? The watervine farmers of Joppa confirm it is true.

strings.string: ▶Have you heard news of girshlings on Qud's surface? The watervine farmers of Joppa confirm it is true.

string.ID: I am at your service.

strings.string: ▶I am at your service.
▶Correct!

string.ID:
Ah, bad habit. It's a possessive feeling I should work to scrub myself of, perhaps?
But I am its mayor, and I have been for some time. You see, years ago I deserted my people. We were of two different minds -- they desired nothing but to bludgeon everything to death, while I asked, "What is the nature of this thing we bludgeon? Or of the act itself?"
Recognizing that my answers lay elsewhere, I cast myself into the swell of the wilds, as a sailor from Perth with no windweird casts their ship to the whims of the Pale Sea!

strings.string:
▶Ah, bad habit. It's a possessive feeling I should work to scrub myself of, perhaps?
But I am its mayor, and I have been for some time. You see, years ago I deserted my people. We were of two different minds -- they desired nothing but to bludgeon everything to death, while I asked, "What is the nature of this thing we bludgeon? Or of the act itself?"
Recognizing that my answers lay elsewhere, I cast myself into the swell of the wilds, as a sailor from Perth with no windweird casts their ship to the whims of the Pale Sea!

string.ID: *continue listening*

strings.string: ▶*continue listening*

string.ID: Some years later and twenty ago, I came upon these mushrooms huts and their goodly inhabitants. They are a people full of earthen poetry, and I was charmed by the warmth they welcomed me with. Surely, I owed my acceptance at first to the countenance I share with their mighty god, but they soon grew to love me, and I them. I've remained here ever since in contemplation of those questions that first stirred in me all those years ago.

strings.string: ▶Some years later and twenty ago, I came upon these mushrooms huts and their goodly inhabitants. They are a people full of earthen poetry, and I was charmed by the warmth they welcomed me with. Surely, I owed my acceptance at first to the countenance I share with their mighty god, but they soon grew to love me, and I them. I've remained here ever since in contemplation of those questions that first stirred in me all those years ago.

string.ID:
We're watered by the river spray -- we pluck the fruit of the wood, and we hunt. The worshippers of Oboroqoru whittle and brood, too. They will pay you no mind unless you ask of them. Here you can be with friends, or muse alone.
If it's trade goods that interest you, take a gander at Yurl's wares in the northwest corner. The odd one Crowsong's, too, if you can scry them in the bush.
I must warn you, however; cast no villain's shadow on these grounds. Warden Indrix will be watching.

strings.string:
▶We're watered by the river spray -- we pluck the fruit of the wood, and we hunt. The worshippers of Oboroqoru whittle and brood, too. They will pay you no mind unless you ask of them. Here you can be with friends, or muse alone.
If it's trade goods that interest you, take a gander at Yurl's wares in the northwest corner. The odd one Crowsong's, too, if you can scry them in the bush.
I must warn you, however; cast no villain's shadow on these grounds. Warden Indrix will be watching.

string.ID: Who is Yurl?

strings.string: ▶Who is Crowsong?

strings.string: ▶Who is Indrix?

strings.string: ▶I have some other questions.

string.ID: Yurl is a harmless cucumber vine. They came to Kyakukya a few years ago after the last Consortium chandler, a wicked little hyacinth named Plysago, suffered something of an... accident. In Tarotep's defense, Plysago shouldn't have berated someone with claws so close in resemblance to pruning shears. At any length, Yurl stocks a plethora of goods; you will be satisfied with your visit.

strings.string: ▶Yurl is a harmless cucumber vine. They came to Kyakukya a few years ago after the last Consortium chandler, a wicked little hyacinth named Plysago, suffered something of an... accident. In Tarotep's defense, Plysago shouldn't have berated someone with claws so close in resemblance to pruning shears. At any length, Yurl stocks a plethora of goods; you will be satisfied with your visit.

string.ID: Oh, another of our dwellers. I won't speak to what Crowsong's deal is. Best you find them and ask yourself.

strings.string: ▶Oh, another of our dwellers. I won't speak to what Crowsong's deal is. Best you find them and ask yourself.

string.ID: Warden Indrix is one of the most ferocious warriors I've ever met. Once upon a time, he and his brothers gorged themselves on the flesh of beasts by starlight, but now I count myself lucky to call him my warden. Some believe he is of sour kind, though I assure you, he's but a victim of his goatish nature.

strings.string: ▶Warden Indrix is one of the most ferocious warriors I've ever met. Once upon a time, he and his brothers gorged themselves on the flesh of beasts by starlight, but now I count myself lucky to call him my warden. Some believe he is of sour kind, though I assure you, he's but a victim of his goatish nature.

string.ID: A waterhand, you are? Speak to my friend and warden Indrix. You'll find him patrolling the village.

strings.string: ▶A waterhand, you are? Speak to my friend and warden Indrix. You'll find him patrolling the village.

string.ID: As far west as Joppa, you say? Oh, grim! Yes, we found the remains of pale-things in the mouth of Svy. Does the Gyre widen again? Hrmmmm.

strings.string: ▶As far west as Joppa, you say? Oh, grim! Yes, we found the remains of pale-things in the mouth of Svy. Does the Gyre widen again? Hrmmmm.

string.ID: I don't imagine you brought me this information merely to observe. Are you suggesting that these slynth might take up residence here in my village?

strings.string: ▶I don't imagine you brought me this information merely to observe. Are you suggesting that these slynth might take up residence here in my village?

string.ID: Coming from anyone else, =name=, I might refuse outright. Housing recently-sentient refugees is no mean favor, I think you'll agree. My people are slow to trust, as well, so I fear that the slynth may feel unwelcome for some time. But then, grafted branches grow the best starapples, do they not? Yes, your lilypad friends are welcome here if they wish.

strings.string: ▶Coming from anyone else, =name=, I might refuse outright. Housing recently-sentient refugees is no mean favor, I think you'll agree. My people are slow to trust, as well, so I fear that the slynth may feel unwelcome for some time. But then, grafted branches grow the best starapples, do they not? Yes, your lilypad friends are welcome here if they wish.

string.ID: You have my thanks, mayor.

strings.string: ▶You have my thanks, mayor.

string.ID: Had I no responsibility to represent my people, I might accept out of the goodness of my own heart alone. Sadly, I do not consider my heart, or even my mind, to be more important than my duty. Perhaps if you were a more renowned figure among my people, I would reconsider.

strings.string: ▶Had I no responsibility to represent my people, I might accept out of the goodness of my own heart alone. Sadly, I do not consider my heart, or even my mind, to be more important than my duty. Perhaps if you were a more renowned figure among my people, I would reconsider.

string.ID:
Never has Kyakukya seen such bustle. These slynth are seem to be as good citizens as any, but I am at my limit with the stress of keeping track of everything.
Please check in again after some time, when I have my wits about me once again.

strings.string:
▶Never has Kyakukya seen such bustle. These slynth are seem to be as good citizens as any, but I am at my limit with the stress of keeping track of everything.
Please check in again after some time, when I have my wits about me once again.

string.ID: My thanks, Mayor.

strings.string: ▶My thanks, Mayor.

string.ID:
Greetings once again, =name=. I am pleased to report that the settling-in of the slynth has gone well, more or less. The villagers are yet wary, but as some slynth have joined in the rituals and worship of Oboroqoru that wariness has waned somewhat.
They've settled in across the village over time. Crowsong has taught the basics of hunting to a select few, and I'll be teaching a cooking class once I can wrest aside the time.

strings.string: ▶I will ravage your nubile heart!

string.ID: Grrrraaaah! There is but one task I know to offer. It is most treacherous, and in all likelihood you will perish. Is your interest waned?

strings.string: ▶Grrrraaaah! There is but one task I know to offer. It is most treacherous, and in all likelihood you will perish. Is your interest waned?

string.ID: No. Continue.

strings.string: ▶No. Continue.

string.ID: Yes. Goodbye.

strings.string: ▶Yes. Goodbye.

string.ID: There is a river just south of the village that runs an eastwardly course into the jungle. Along its bank lies a goatfolk village. There resides a mighty shaman, Mamon Souldrinker. He is in possession of a talisman of great power, an amaranthine prism that refracts the psyche of its handler in much the same way, as Mayor Nuntu has explained to me, a common prism refracts light. The thing is cursed, traveler. No man or goat may safely wield it for long. You must travel to the village and retrieve the prism from Mamon by any means necessary. Do you understand?

strings.string: ▶There is a river just south of the village that runs an eastwardly course into the jungle. Along its bank lies a goatfolk village. There resides a mighty shaman, Mamon Souldrinker. He is in possession of a talisman of great power, an amaranthine prism that refracts the psyche of its handler in much the same way, as Mayor Nuntu has explained to me, a common prism refracts light. The thing is cursed, traveler. No man or goat may safely wield it for long. You must travel to the village and retrieve the prism from Mamon by any means necessary. Do you understand?

string.ID: Why don't you retrieve it yourself?

strings.string: ▶Why don't you retrieve it yourself?

string.ID: Yes. Is there anything else I should know?

strings.string: ▶Yes. Is there anything else I should know?

string.ID: Because, traveler, Mamon is my elder brother. He would discern my presence before I could strike.

strings.string: ▶Because, traveler, Mamon is my elder brother. He would discern my presence before I could strike.

string.ID: Is there anything else I should know?

strings.string: ▶Is there anything else I should know?

string.ID:
There is. Firstly, Mamon will likely have several goatfolk under his enthrallment, and they will protect him at all costs.
Secondly, take care to stay out of Mamon's reach, for his power is most potent when he may lay hands on you.
Finally, once you recover the prism, do not under any circumstances wield it. I needn't warn you of the consequences should you return to me bearing that charm.
That is all. Are you willing?

strings.string:
▶There is. Firstly, Mamon will likely have several goatfolk under his enthrallment, and they will protect him at all costs.
Secondly, take care to stay out of Mamon's reach, for his power is most potent when he may lay hands on you.
Finally, once you recover the prism, do not under any circumstances wield it. I needn't warn you of the consequences should you return to me bearing that charm.
That is all. Are you willing?

string.ID: I am willing.

strings.string: ▶I am willing.

string.ID: No, I would risk too much.

strings.string: ▶No, I would risk too much.

string.ID: Just south of the village, there's a river that runs an eastwardly course into the jungle. Follow it to the goatfolk village. There you will find Mamon.

strings.string: ▶Just south of the village, there's a river that runs an eastwardly course into the jungle. Follow it to the goatfolk village. There you will find Mamon.

string.ID: The amaranthine dream! The heights within ourselves we might yet reach with his guidance. There it is in all of us -- shades of our elder selves. Within each man, a goat. Within each goat, a man!

Liquids are better.
I prefer liquids.

I prefer liquids.

string.ID: Who are you?

string.ID:
A connoisseur of liquids. Sure, I dabble in other states of matter.
But I prefer the shifting and tumbling of angleless motion.
Not too hot, not too cold, not too indeterminate.

strings.string:
▶A connoisseur of liquids. Sure, I dabble in other states of matter.
But I prefer the shifting and tumbling of angleless motion.

string.ID: Welcome to Omonporch, traveler. Enjoy your visit to my earldom. Feast your eyes upon my tall and glorious Spindle. Take in the scent of roasted musa.

strings.string: ▶Welcome to Omonporch, traveler. Enjoy your visit to my earldom. Feast your eyes upon my tall and glorious Spindle. Take in the scent of roasted musa.

string.ID: Are you truly the Earl of Omonporch?

strings.string: ▶Are you truly the Earl of Omonporch?

string.ID: Earl Asphodel, the Barathrumites request your permission to lease control of the Spindle. Their inquiries into the past have led them here.

strings.string: ▶Earl Asphodel, the Barathrumites request your permission to lease control of the Spindle. Their inquiries into the past have led them here.

string.ID: Live and drink, Earl.

strings.string: ▶Live and drink, Earl.

string.ID: Indubitably, for I've proclaimed it so! There was no Earl to tell me otherwise.

strings.string: ▶Indubitably, for I've proclaimed it so! There was no Earl to tell me otherwise.

string.ID: Lease control of my Spindle, you say? Well, well... That's a colossal request. There's no simple price I can assign to such a thing. Were I to grant such a request, you would owe me a great debt. You and several of your allies.

strings.string: ▶Lease control of my Spindle, you say? Well, well... That's a colossal request. There's no simple price I can assign to such a thing. Were I to grant such a request, you would owe me a great debt. You and several of your allies.

strings.string: ▶I will convene a council. The First Council of Omonporch. Send word to four of your allied factions. Have them send delegates. Together, perhaps, you can appease me.

string.ID: Don't be coy, =name=. Emboldened by your incursions into our village, you wish to fill it with your indigent foundlings on the weight of your reputation alone. Am I correct?

string.ID:
Live and drink, kendren. I am Hindriarch Keh; welcome to Bey Lah.
It's nearly unprecedented for one such as you to pass by our scouts unaccosted, but these are unprecedented circumstances. I have a task for you. Are you interested?

strings.string:
▶Live and drink, kendren. I am Hindriarch Keh; welcome to Bey Lah.
It's nearly unprecedented for one such as you to pass by our scouts unaccosted, but these are unprecedented circumstances. I have a task for you. Are you interested?

string.ID: Yes. Go on.

strings.string: ▶Yes. Go on.
▶No.

string.ID:
Good.
We hindren are a close-knit and staid people, and our safety depends on our solidarity. In order to preserve our safety and culture, we ask that any of our number who leave us never come back. Recently, one such exile took the treasure of our village, a bracelet named Kindrish, with her when she left. None of our number can leave to get it back, or it will be a violation of the values that I have guarded, and the Hindriarchs before me, for countless generations.
Will you help us recover our treasure? We have a small cache of valuables we can offer as a reward.

strings.string:
▶Good.
We hindren are a close-knit and staid people, and our safety depends on our solidarity. In order to preserve our safety and culture, we ask that any of our number who leave us never come back. Recently, one such exile took the treasure of our village, a bracelet named Kindrish, with her when she left. None of our number can leave to get it back, or it will be a violation of the values that I have guarded, and the Hindriarchs before me, for countless generations.
Will you help us recover our treasure? We have a small cache of valuables we can offer as a reward.

string.ID: All right. I'll find your treasure.

strings.string: ▶All right. I'll find your treasure.

string.ID: No thank you. I don't care for this job.

strings.string: ▶No thank you. I don't care for this job.

string.ID:
Excellent. I will do my best to reward you to your satisfaction.
Though her name is sand in my mouth now, the exile who stole Kindrish is called Eskhind. She left a few weeks ago, and took her sister and brother with her. I don't know where she's gone, but Warden Neelahind might, as they were close friends as children.
Find the exile called Eskhind and retrieve Kindrish from her, even... even if the cost is the life of her and her siblings. Kindrish has been handed down over countless generations, and it belongs to my people, not any individual. Go, kendren. Speak to Warden Neelahind, and find out where Eskhind is hidden.

strings.string:
▶Excellent. I will do my best to reward you to your satisfaction.
Though her name is sand in my mouth now, the exile who stole Kindrish is called Eskhind. She left a few weeks ago, and took her sister and brother with her. I don't know where she's gone, but Warden Neelahind might, as they were close friends as children.
Find the exile called Eskhind and retrieve Kindrish from her, even... even if the cost is the life of her and her siblings. Kindrish has been handed down over countless generations, and it belongs to my people, not any individual. Go, kendren. Speak to Warden Neelahind, and find out where Eskhind is hidden.

string.ID: As you say.

strings.string: ▶As you say.

string.ID: Then I will thank you to leave as quickly as possible. I don't want the faundren to become used to our borders being permeable.

strings.string: ▶Then I will thank you to leave as quickly as possible. I don't want the faundren to become used to our borders being permeable.

string.ID: As you say. Live and drink.

strings.string: ▶As you say. Live and drink.

string.ID:
You've found our treasure? I'll admit, kendren, I'm very impressed. Take this as thanks.
That said, the exile must answer for her crimes. There is further reward for you if you see this case through to the end.

strings.string:
▶You've found our treasure? I'll admit, kendren, I'm very impressed. Take this as thanks.

string.ID:
You've found our treasure? I'll admit, kendren, I'm very impressed.
Take this as thanks, and... well. I suppose you've earned your stay for a while. Just try not to give the faundren any ideas.

The pariah claims to be wrongfully accused, and you believe her?
She is obviously lying. Are all kendren so gullible?

string.ID:
Fine! Go to the Warden, then, and have her solve this mystery.
But know this: until a thief is found and Kindrish is recovered, I cannot reward you. You get nothing. Live and drink, =player.formalAddressTerm=.

▶Fine! Go to the Warden, then, and have her solve this mystery.

Kesehind is a good boy. He lost his parents long ago, but has been like a son to me.

string.ID:
If you ask the exile, I'm sure she'll spin some kind of accusation that I believe gender to be an immutable prison, that I impose it on others.
She's lying. Our people have a long history of two-gender hindren called {{w|hartind}}, respected and consecrated. There is a proper path to gender variance in our society, of which the male exile could have availed himself years ago.
He never did, so I do not recognize him.

She and I would spend time there, back then. Perhaps she is there now, but I don't dare check.

string.ID: Hmm. But the only fur there was from a hindren's pelt, and kendren warriors fight to the death. With no corpse and no other fur, it seems unlikely that a hindren fought an outsider.

strings.string: ▶Hmm. But the only fur there was from a hindren's pelt, and kendren warriors fight to the death. With no corpse and no other fur, it seems unlikely that a hindren fought an outsider.

string.ID: I'm afraid that makes no sense. Why would an outsider invite a trader to our village, when they could simply meet one outside of Bey Lah?

strings.string: ▶I'm afraid that makes no sense. Why would an outsider invite a trader to our village, when they could simply meet one outside of Bey Lah?

string.ID: But weren't the rumors of sore throats in the village? That wouldn't have anything to do with kendren.

strings.string: ▶But weren't the rumors of sore throats in the village? That wouldn't have anything to do with kendren.

strings.string: ▶Why wouldn't an outsider bring their own leather? It would better disguise Kindrish. It seems a lot of work to find and raid our leather stores.

string.ID: Bracers are a Bey Lah craft! It would make no sense for a kendren to have one, then throw it away in the village.

strings.string: ▶Bracers are a Bey Lah craft! It would make no sense for a kendren to have one, then throw it away in the village.

string.ID: Kesehind wields Ari, a battleaxe handed down through generations. It cannot break, and if it broke a weapon there would be scorch marks on it. This evidence does not hold up.

strings.string: ▶Kesehind wields Ari, a battleaxe handed down through generations. It cannot break, and if it broke a weapon there would be scorch marks on it. This evidence does not hold up.

string.ID: There are few voices as low as Kesehind's in our village. Witnesses report a higher-pitched voice, don't they? They would know if Kesehind were speaking.

string.ID: Oh, no, that wouldn't be Kesehind. He'd sooner die of fever than choke down a single stem of yuckwheat.

strings.string: ▶Oh, no, that wouldn't be Kesehind. He'd sooner die of fever than choke down a single stem of yuckwheat.

string.ID: Oh, no, that wouldn't be Kesehind. He'd sooner die of fever than choke down a single stem of yuckwheat.

string.ID: No, that can't be it. Eskhind hates everything about watervine and keeps a wide berth from it. If her blood was spilled, it would have happened nearer to the path.

strings.string: ▶No, that can't be it. Eskhind hates everything about watervine and keeps a wide berth from it. If her blood was spilled, it would have happened nearer to the path.

string.ID: No, no. Eskhind makes the most of what few possessions she keeps, and if she traded a treasure for so much water, she'd never have lost track of any.

strings.string: ▶No, no. Eskhind makes the most of what few possessions she keeps, and if she traded a treasure for so much water, she'd never have lost track of any.

string.ID: I doubt it. If Eskhind were sick, the last place she would stumble to evacuate her guts would be a watervine field.

strings.string: ▶I doubt it. If Eskhind were sick, the last place she would stumble to evacuate her guts would be a watervine field.

string.ID: I'm afraid that Eskhind has no idea how to use proper leatherworking tools, much less pay for a set so fine. This surely isn't hers.

strings.string: ▶I'm afraid that Eskhind has no idea how to use proper leatherworking tools, much less pay for a set so fine. This surely isn't hers.

string.ID: I know the rumor you mean, but villagers heard the clash of weapons. Keh is too old for a prolonged fight like that, so I do not believe it was her.

strings.string: ▶I know the rumor you mean, but villagers heard the clash of weapons. Keh is too old for a prolonged fight like that, so I do not believe it was her.

string.ID: Grand-Doe cannot swim, and panics even near the shallow pools of our paddies. I cannot imagine she would make splashing noises without adding screaming noises to them.

strings.string: ▶Grand-Doe cannot swim, and panics even near the shallow pools of our paddies. I cannot imagine she would make splashing noises without adding screaming noises to them.

string.ID: Copper causes Grand-Doe to break out in great welts. She would not have traded for it, and if she saw a trader drop it, surely she would have told them to pick it up. She hates mess.

strings.string: ▶Copper causes Grand-Doe to break out in great welts. She would not have traded for it, and if she saw a trader drop it, surely she would have told them to pick it up. She hates mess.

string.ID: I cannot bring myself to believe that Grand-Doe would allow anyone to stumble upon her own severed tongue. She would surely burn it as soon as she saw it.

strings.string: ▶I cannot bring myself to believe that Grand-Doe would allow anyone to stumble upon her own severed tongue. She would surely burn it as soon as she saw it.

string.ID: No, Grand-Doe is absolutely meticulous about work clutter. She wouldn't leave scraps lying about.

strings.string: ▶No, Grand-Doe is absolutely meticulous about work clutter. She wouldn't leave scraps lying about.
▶Ah.

string.ID:
Oh. Yes, this does indicate that some kind of =motive.influence= transpired, and =thief.name= was trying to hide it.
So what you're saying is....

strings.string:
▶Oh. Yes, this does indicate that some kind of =motive.influence= transpired, and =thief.name= was trying to hide it.
So what you're saying is....

string.ID: That's right. By concealing =all.influence=, it was =thief.name= who stole Kindrish!

strings.string: ▶That's right. By concealing =all.influence=, it was =thief.name= who stole Kindrish!

string.ID: I'm still not completely certain. Let me ponder it more.

strings.string: ▶I'm still not completely certain. Let me ponder it more.

string.ID:
The evidence is clear. In violation of sacred law and the will of her people, Eskhind stole the artifact called Kindrish from Bey Lah. She will be stripped of honor, stripped of water, and stripped from our oral histories. Never will her name be spoken here again, and she will never return... on pain of death.
And I... I will go with her. May my property be payment for the harm she has done to our people, and I will gladly pay it for the privilege of walking by her side.
I have no doubt that Bey Lah will thrive in my absence as it did before I became warden. Live and drink, my kin. Long may Hindriarch Keh lead you.

And I... I will go with her. May my property be payment for the harm she has done to our people, and I will gladly pay it for the privilege of walking by her side.
I have no doubt that Bey Lah will thrive in my absence as it did before I became warden. Live and drink, my kin. Long may Hindriarch Keh lead you.

She could never hope to repay the harm caused by her actions, but we will grant her this last mercy: Bey Lah will forget her debt alongside her name.
Just is the leadership of Hindriarch Keh. Long may she live!
