string.ID:
The evidence is clear: Eskhind did not steal Kindrish. In fact, I believe that no hindren was responsible for its theft, but one of the kendren who permeated our borders well before our investigator arrived. Any of them could have committed the theft.
Eskhind is free to go, and I'm... I'm going with her. I cannot serve under Hindriarch Keh while my beloved returns to exile.
I have no doubt that Bey Lah will thrive in my absence as it did before I became warden. Live and drink, my kin. Long may Hindriarch Keh lead you.

strings.string:
▶The evidence is clear: Eskhind did not steal Kindrish. In fact, I believe that no hindren was responsible for its theft, but one of the kendren who permeated our borders well before our investigator arrived. Any of them could have committed the theft.
Eskhind is free to go, and I'm... I'm going with her. I cannot serve under Hindriarch Keh while my beloved returns to exile.
I have no doubt that Bey Lah will thrive in my absence as it did before I became warden. Live and drink, my kin. Long may Hindriarch Keh lead you.

string.ID:
The evidence is clear: Eskhind did not steal Kindrish. In fact, I believe that no hindren was responsible for its theft, but rather one of the kendren who permeated our borders well before our investigator arrived. Any of them could have committed the theft.
Eskhind helped us cleave to the path of justice. She is free to go, and her name will not be forgotten, but she must remain in exile.
Just is the leadership of Hindriarch Keh. Long may she live!

string.ID:
The evidence is clear: Eskhind did not steal Kindrish. The crime was committed by none other than Grand-Doe's protector, Kesehind. He will be stripped of the ancestral axe he carries, stripped of his property, and stripped from our oral histories. Never will his name be spoken here again, and he will never return... on pain of death.
Moreover... Keh's attempt to pin blame on Eskhind without due process opened my eyes to her abuses of power. She need not leave Bey Lah, but she is Keh-hind once more-- stripped of her title and standing.
As for the hindriarchy, Eskhind will act as an interim leader until we figure out what to do next, as a people. May Hindriarch Esk lead us to a brighter future!

string.ID:
The evidence is clear: Bey Lah's own Hindriarch has betrayed her people. She took our ancestral treasure as her own, pinning the crime on an exile she knew could not defend herself. For this treason, she is hereby stripped of title, stripped of property, stripped of home.
With the exile of Keh-Hind, the hindriarchy lies vacant, with no elders fit to take it. Eskhind will act as an interim leader until we figure out what to do next, as a people. May Hindriarch Esk lead us to a brighter future!

string.ID: My job here is done. Live and drink.

strings.string: ▶My job here is done. Live and drink.

string.ID:
For me? Are you sure?
But... this is a poem. In Esk's handwriting. Are you s-sure this is for me?

strings.string:
▶For me? Are you sure?
But... this is a poem. In Esk's handwriting. Are you s-sure this is for me?

string.ID: Yes. Please read it.

strings.string: ▶Yes. Please read it.

string.ID: Perhaps I'm mistaken. Live and drink.

strings.string: ▶Perhaps I'm mistaken. Live and drink.

string.ID:
Oh.
Ayvah, she-- Eskhind wrote this about... me? How my head swims at these lavish words. If she wrote this and meant it for me, she must... love me.
But it can't be. Can it?

strings.string:
▶Oh.
Ayvah, she-- Eskhind wrote this about... me? How my head swims at these lavish words. If she wrote this and meant it for me, she must... love me.
But it can't be. Can it?

string.ID: Can't it?

strings.string: ▶Can't it?

string.ID: It is. Live and drink.

strings.string: ▶It is. Live and drink.

string.ID:
Kendren, you must understand. I spent so many years trying in vain to fall out of love with Eskhind. I thought it the only way to endure our adolescence, watching her poor attempts at courtship with other hindren.
I thought it the only way to endure her departure, as well. But she is returned, and she loves me. Ayvah. I am terrified to speak to her of this, but I must.
Thank you.

strings.string:
▶Kendren, you must understand. I spent so many years trying in vain to fall out of love with Eskhind. I thought it the only way to endure our adolescence, watching her poor attempts at courtship with other hindren.
I thought it the only way to endure her departure, as well. But she is returned, and she loves me. Ayvah. I am terrified to speak to her of this, but I must.
Thank you.

string.ID: Will this affect the investigation?

strings.string: ▶Will this affect the investigation?

string.ID: Live and drink, Neelahind.

strings.string: ▶Live and drink, Neelahind.

string.ID:
No. You are the one investigating, so my bias need not enter play. If you determine that Eskhind is guilty, I will heed your word and carry out a just sentence.
After that, I'm not sure.

strings.string:
▶No. You are the one investigating, so my bias need not enter play. If you determine that Eskhind is guilty, I will heed your word and carry out a just sentence.
After that, I'm not sure.

string.ID: In that case, I have further questions.

strings.string: ▶In that case, I have further questions.

string.ID: Of course, kendren. Ask away.

strings.string: ▶Of course, kendren. Ask away.

string.ID: What can you tell me about Hindriarch Keh?

string.ID:
Keh is very wise and very careful, which makes up for her lack of strength or... tact. She always knows what's right, and she runs a very tight shift.
She hates clutter from work like nothing else and cleans up any mess she makes--unless it's a spill, then she makes Kesehind do it. It's because Grand-Doe has a terrible fear of standing pools of water, refusing to touch them. Copper and bronze afflict her with allergy-sores and she can't touch them. She's too old to spar with me, but her bow-arm still aims true.
That's all I can think of.

It's because Grand-Doe has a terrible fear of standing pools of water, refusing to touch them. Copper and bronze afflict her with allergy-sores and she can't touch them. She's too old to spar with me, but her bow-arm still aims true.
That's all I can think of.

string.ID:
Oh. She's, well, she's a good person with strong convictions, or has always seemed so. I suppose that isn't helpful.
Esk has a good eye for detail. She hates watervine so much that she avoids the paddies and won't eat matz without lah broth to make it taste better. Umm, she's afraid of saltbacks. She's good at foraging and terrible at crafting.
I've missed her so much.

string.ID:
Kesehind is completely loyal to Grand-Doe. We used to be friends, but his disposition has become so sour since he was appointed her protector, and he's quite cold to me now. He can't see well in darkness. He's the holder of Ari, an unbreakable heirloom fire axe, and he's very skilled with it.
He's terribly finicky about food. He'll only eat bland food and meat, and... oh! Once, when he had a bad cough as a faundren, a caretaker tried to feed him yuckwheat, and he kicked her so hard it dislocated her jaw. Poor Elder Eselhind.

Please. Please leave me be. My heart... Esk, my heart...

I must admit, =name=, that I can think of few notions more challenging to my people than to welcome a flower-people into our town. Some will see them as no better than walking lah.
But if the notion came from you, they might consider putting it to a vote, at least. If you'll stand by, I will call a referendum.

string.ID:
What do you imagine I am saying? The aging, ineffectual leader of a village in isolation. A system that strives to forget anyone who sees the outside, no matter how much its inhabitants strive for a better tomorrow.
Bey Lah's isolationism provides ideal patsies for any crime the Hindriarch chooses to commit.

string.ID:
Yes. I am falsely accused.
See, Bey Lah strives to forget anyone who sees the outside. The gerontocracy ensures that its leaders will always be aging and fearful. Pariahs like me can be easily accused of crimes committed by Keh or her cronies.

Well, good. I would give you a prize for your insight, but times have been lean.
As you say, the Hindriarch is obviously framing me. As a pariah, I am an ideal patsy for Keh. Much as I love my people, they are weak of will and do not question the Grand-Doe.

string.ID:
Ay, you kendren are just as thick as the elders. I'd hoped otherwise.
Yes, I am suggesting that old Grand-Doe is trying to fool you, and the village as well. I'm not certain that she stole it herself, but an investigation might undermine her authority, and she cannot have that.

string.ID:
Why should you believe me? Well, why should you believe Keh? Ayvah, think about this!
I'm not asking you to give me your unconditional trust, understand? Only to extend to me the same level of trust you give Keh. Is that not reasonable? Is that not just?

string.ID:
Ayvah. I'd wanted Grand-Doe to be wrong about you kendren, but perhaps you are all violent fools after all.
I'm not asking you to trust me, only to extend to me the same level of trust you give Keh. Is that not reasonable?

string.ID:
Rude? How dare--
No, I... I apologize for my rudeness. Please understand that we have lost so much by leaving Bey Lah. My mind is not in a gentle place, and being revisited by the tyranny I left behind is causing newly-closed wounds to open.
Forgive my tone, but please understand: I did not steal Kindrish. You are being used.

string.ID:
The proof is in the petals, kendren. You want justice? Find out what really happened.
If you find evidence, Warden Neelahind will support you. Speak to her. She is loyal to Grand-Doe, but more loyal to the truth.
I will return to the village and we will sort this out. The Hindriarch will have to tolerate my presence until my name is cleared.

string.ID:
Why? Why did I leave a single parasang square piece of land upon which I was expected to live my entire life, forever obeying a woman whose sole qualification of rule is her gender and age? Why did I leave a place where we eat the same damned soup for nine out of ten meals and the height of occupational versatility is leatherworking?
The question isn't why I left, it's why I'm the only one who chose to do so, why none of my pleas were convincing to the hindren I love. If we would just open the borders, it would never have come to this.

strings.string:

The question isn't why I left, it's why I'm the only one who chose to do so, why none of my pleas were convincing to the hindren I love. If we would just open the borders, it would never have come to this.

string.ID:
The Hindriarch is the most likely suspect, in my opinion. She might have kept it for herself or sold it. I've been suspicious of her pet bodyguard, Kesehind, for years--I wouldn't put it past him to steal the treasure himself.
That said, it might have been an outsider like you. I doubt any of the villagers had the nerve to steal such a valuable object, but I suppose it's faintly possible.
But it wasn't Neelahind. You won't find a purer heart in all of Qud than hers.

strings.string:
▶The Hindriarch is the most likely suspect, in my opinion. She might have kept it for herself or sold it. I've been suspicious of her pet bodyguard, Kesehind, for years--I wouldn't put it past him to steal the treasure himself.
That said, it might have been an outsider like you. I doubt any of the villagers had the nerve to steal such a valuable object, but I suppose it's faintly possible.
But it wasn't Neelahind. You won't find a purer heart in all of Qud than hers.

string.ID: You may not.

strings.string: ▶You may not.
▶Oh.

string.ID: You are either very brave or very foolish, to stop me in my path. Perhaps both. What do you want?

strings.string: ▶You are either very brave or very foolish, to stop me in my path. Perhaps both. What do you want?

string.ID: Nothing. Live and drink.

strings.string: ▶Nothing. Live and drink.

string.ID:
Be careful in the flower fields.
Even with Bey Lah marked on your map, it's easy to get lost. Lost travelers feed the lah.

strings.string:
▶Be careful in the flower fields.
Even with Bey Lah marked on your map, it's easy to get lost. Lost travelers feed the lah.

string.ID: I will be careful, thank you.

strings.string: ▶I will be careful, thank you.

string.ID: Hold a moment, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Are you looking for work?

strings.string: ▶Hold a moment, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Are you looking for work?

string.ID: I am.

strings.string: ▶I am.

string.ID: I am not.

strings.string: ▶I am not.

string.ID:
I can't help but wonder why you're telling me this in particular. I am not a mayor, nor even a citizen. I am a drifter, a pariah, and my 'people' are those who have no home anywhere else.
... and here I wonder a bit less. You're asking me to whisper into the winds on behalf of the slynth, aren't you?

strings.string:
▶I can't help but wonder why you're telling me this in particular. I am not a mayor, nor even a citizen. I am a drifter, a pariah, and my 'people' are those who have no home anywhere else.
... and here I wonder a bit less. You're asking me to whisper into the winds on behalf of the slynth, aren't you?

string.ID: What a strange fate, to pass from new sentience to outcast with no steps in between. Regardless, if it is their will and you vouch for them, that is enough for me. Tell the slynth that should they choose to wander, the wind will blow at their backs.

strings.string: ▶What a strange fate, to pass from new sentience to outcast with no steps in between. Regardless, if it is their will and you vouch for them, that is enough for me. Tell the slynth that should they choose to wander, the wind will blow at their backs.

string.ID: You have my thanks, Lulihart.

strings.string: ▶You have my thanks, Lulihart.

string.ID: It is hardly so simple, =name=. We drifters hold no hierarchy. I can whisper all I like, but no winds will blow behind the slynth if your name cannot stir more than a breeze. Make yourself known to Pariahs and ask me again.

strings.string: ▶It is hardly so simple, =name=. We drifters hold no hierarchy. I can whisper all I like, but no winds will blow behind the slynth if your name cannot stir more than a breeze. Make yourself known to Pariahs and ask me again.

string.ID: Still gathering landing pads for your drifting vessels, then, =name=?

strings.string: ▶Still gathering landing pads for your drifting vessels, then, =name=?

string.ID: Yes, I am.

strings.string: ▶Yes, I am.

string.ID:
New voices, strange and beautiful, carry on the salt breeze.
Some will no doubt be silenced by sun, blade, thirst, bullet, or glow, but they will not fall still alone.

strings.string:
▶New voices, strange and beautiful, carry on the salt breeze.
Some will no doubt be silenced by sun, blade, thirst, bullet, or glow, but they will not fall still alone.

string.ID: My thanks, Lulihart.

strings.string: ▶My thanks, Lulihart.

string.ID:
Live and drink, =name=.
Have you seen your slynth out there? My sources tell me that they are, for the most part, traveling well enough with others. They stop by my tent from time to time to visit and smoke with me, as you do.
One might assume they were born for this kind of life.

string.ID:
I see. In that case, rest and speak a bit with me, won't you? My worries can wait another day.
That said, if you change your mind, you'll come find me, won't you?

strings.string:
▶I see. In that case, rest and speak a bit with me, won't you? My worries can wait another day.

string.ID:
Lovely. Take a seat. Chew the bark with me, and I will tell you what I know.
I've heard tell that my ancestral hometown, Bey Lah, is in some kind of trouble. They've opened their borders for the first time I know of and are specifically seeking to hire kendren -- that's their word for outsiders like you. Would you be willing to go see what they need?

Dilute, salty blood. Heh.

My water goes to scouts to keep a distant eye on Bey Lah. To make sure that it is still there, still safe.
I have never been within a parasang of my people's land, but I know exactly where the once-hidden village stands. I will share this knowledge with you if you agree to consider whatever their request may be.

string.ID:
I am not welcome in Bey Lah.
My blood is not pure, and I was not born in the meadow. These things make my name as salt in the mouths of true hindren.
They are misguided, but they are my misguided family. They stagnate as Qud changes around them. I worry.

string.ID:
Bless you, =player.formalAddressTerm=. I feel better knowing that at least one kendren will reach back to aid my kin. They are on the cusp of a new fate, and I wish to see it while I yet live.
Let me advise you of Bey Lah's location, and here is a little chew-boon for your trouble.

string.ID:
I hear that Bey Lah's status is once again quo. I hoped for a measure more of change, but thousands of years of tradition do not give so easily.
Thank you for helping my foolish people.

strings.string:
▶I hear that Bey Lah's status is once again quo. I hoped for a measure more of change, but thousands of years of tradition do not give so easily.
Thank you for helping my foolish people.

string.ID:
I've heard that the youngest Hindriarch in history now leads Bey Lah, and their warden aims to join the Quetzal Caucus. You've worked wonders, kendren.
I can't wait to see what happens next.

strings.string:
▶I've heard that the youngest Hindriarch in history now leads Bey Lah, and their warden aims to join the Quetzal Caucus. You've worked wonders, kendren.
I can't wait to see what happens next.

string.ID:
Every flame burns low one day, but the warmth of my people's story still carries me forward.
Bey Lah has not survived joining Qud, but the hindren live on, and our legacy will never be wholly lost.
I wonder what became of Kindrish.

strings.string:
▶Every flame burns low one day, but the warmth of my people's story still carries me forward.

string.ID: Kendren! A moment of your time, please. You are =name=, yes? You seek to solve a mystery here in the village, yes?

strings.string: ▶Kendren! A moment of your time, please. You are =name=, yes? You seek to solve a mystery here in the village, yes?

string.ID:
Poem? Oh! This is a Shakespriggan sonnet, but I didn't write it--the rhymes are a bit facile, and love poems don't interest me.
I've been teaching Eskhind about sonnets, so she must have written this. But that means... oh, poor thing.

strings.string:

string.ID: Thank you. Live and drink.

string.ID:
I hoped you would ask! I closely study the works of the great bard, Willow Shakesprig. In particular, I am most fond of the stories of the Great Plant Detective, Hemlock Cones. Through these stories, I have learned to hone my perceptions and deductive skill to a fine point. It is my dearest hope that one day I shall be known not as Angohind, village bookworm... but Angohind, Master Detective.
My grandhind has forbidden me from looking into the strange doings in the village, but she said nothing about me teaching you the ins and outs of detective work! What say you?

strings.string:

It is my dearest hope that one day I shall be known not as Angohind, village bookworm... but Angohind, Master Detective.
My grandhind has forbidden me from looking into the strange doings in the village, but she said nothing about me teaching you the ins and outs of detective work! What say you?

string.ID: I am listening.

strings.string: ▶I am listening.

string.ID: I should... go. Live and drink.

strings.string: ▶I should... go. Live and drink.

string.ID:
Yes, yes of course.
I am Angohind: grandson of esteemed Elder Eselhind, young scholar of Shakesprig, and best dressed hindren in Bey Lah. I am also, as luck would have it, an aspirant investigator with an ear... for mystery.
My grandhind has forbidden me from looking into the strange doings in the village, but she said nothing about me teaching you the ins and outs of detective work! What say you?

strings.string:
▶Yes, yes of course.
I am Angohind: grandson of esteemed Elder Eselhind, young scholar of Shakesprig, and best dressed hindren in Bey Lah. I am also, as luck would have it, an aspirant investigator with an ear... for mystery.
My grandhind has forbidden me from looking into the strange doings in the village, but she said nothing about me teaching you the ins and outs of detective work! What say you?

string.ID: I am listening.

string.ID: No thank you. Live and drink.

strings.string: ▶No thank you. Live and drink.

string.ID:
Oh, truly? You won't regret this, kendren, I promise! So, let's get to it!
Every mystery hinges on the detection and interpretation of evidence. As Hemlock Cones said:
Ere any prosecution can commence, Accusers must obtain some evidence. The solving lies in seeing and locating Supporting clues as well as implicating.

string.ID: How do I find evidence?

string.ID:
Professor Cones taught me everything about finding evidence!
Though evidence you found upon the ground may yet be sound, If it will be sufficient is a toss-up. Examine all your suspects and their homes and all around, And find a witness who may dish the gossip.
You can find evidence by looking at things on the ground, but you can also look at your suspects to see if there's anything off about them. You can also ask around to see if anyone has seen or heard anything strange, and different witnesses may have different things to report.

string.ID: Thank you for your help, Angohind. Live and drink.

string.ID:
Evidence is any sign of something gone amiss. The Great Plant Detective gave some good examples in Act II of the tragedy of Gimlet:
So! Sweep the full estate for signs of {{W|trade}}, their shady night-time dealings to expose Now look for signs of {{W|craft}}, see what was made For to conceal a treasure hidden close. But darker still, if {{W|illness}} signs we find A desperate contagion may yet lurk And darkest yet, more {{W|violence}} may reply To those who stumble 'pon their grisly work.

string.ID:
Implicating evidence is what it sounds like: evidence that implicates someone's involvement in a crime. For example, if someone observed strange behavior in a person, or if you found something weird in a person's room, or even if you observe them behaving strangely =player.reflexive=! That's implicating evidence.
Most of the time, a piece of implicating evidence isn't proof of a crime in and of itself, but when presented alongside supporting evidence, implicating evidence is the seed of truth from which grows the long frond of justice.

That's implicating evidence.
Most of the time, a piece of implicating evidence isn't proof of a crime in and of itself, but when presented alongside supporting evidence, implicating evidence is the seed of truth from which grows the long frond of justice.

string.ID:
Supporting evidence can be any sign that something is amiss that you can't directly tie to an individual. One common example is a bloodstain, which indicates that violence was committed but doesn't tell you by whom.
At its heart, supporting evidence is most powerful when paired with implicating evidence. Once you have both, you'll be in a good position to accuse a suspect of wrongdoing.

string.ID:
As Professor Cones said:
We know the reach of law, however long, Is not the finest judge of right and wrong. Choose not what evidence thou wilt present Ere its consequence is evident.
In short, you must use your judgment and intuition, kendren.

string.ID: What if I accuse the wrong person?

strings.string: ▶What if I accuse the wrong person?

string.Context: Conversation Angohind.Multiple culprits?.Evidence is not created equalChoice.Text
string.ID: You're saying that what evidence I choose to show will affect the outcome of the case?

strings.string: ▶You're saying that what evidence I choose to show will affect the outcome of the case?

string.ID: Then what's to keep me from simply choosing the outcome I want?

strings.string: ▶Then what's to keep me from simply choosing the outcome I want?

string.ID: I have further questions.

strings.string: ▶I have further questions.

string.ID:
That's always a risk, kendren.
Neelahind knows everyone in the village very well. If you present supporting evidence that contradicts something the Warden knows to be true about the suspect, well, she probably won't believe you. In fact, she might not let you accuse that person again, so be careful.
If you make too many bad accusations, you might lose credibility with her entirely.

string.ID:
Precisely. The evidence you present paints a picture that will forever hang in the halls of Bey Lah's history. Our fate is in your hands.
Hemlock Cones once said:
As like begets like in daily life so too in mystery. Should I paint pictures full of strife thus violence comes to be. If I in craft or trade should deal then deals shall deal by troth But if I pestilence reveal- no honey be enough.

string.ID: Kendren! Kendren! Tell us a story of the world outside when Grand-Doe is not listening!~ Um. Live and drink, kendren.~ Is it true that all kendren kill one another for sport?~ Is it true that you kendren eat your dead?~ Is it true that there are bears covered in quills to the east?~ Is it true that bears live to be a thousand years old?~ Is it true that boars can shoot fire?~ Is it true that kendren can't fall in love?~ Is it true that kendren elders grow eyes upon their hands?~ Is it true that kendren pay for goods with crayons rather than water?~ Is it true that kendren worship rocks?~ Is it true that kendren spend hours looking at slabs of wood?~ Is it true that nine out of ten kendren cannot speak or understand language?~ Is it true that instead of dying, kendren are frozen in tubes?~ Is it true that kendren children are thrown out of the nest right after being born?~ Is it true that all kendren say 'quetzal' when they are happy?~ Is it true that kendren chefs can fry water?~ Is it true that kendren all live far underground?~ Is it true that kendren live in great bubbles?~ Is it true that kendren sleep in a snarcomfagus?~ Is there really a King of the Moon, kendren?~ I heard from my friend who heard it from their yma that the Grand-Doe says that hindren who leave Bey Lah grow an extra pair of arms. And the Grand-Doe says it so you know it's true.~ Is it true that when kendren eat mah lah soup, they explode?!~ Is it true that... um, oh. I forgot.~ Is it true that kendren don't have to ask permission to do the water ritual?~ Is it true that you don't have a Grand-Doe?~ How do kendren stay safe when you don't have a Grand-Doe to protect you?~ Um, kendren, does the yempuris phi really exist? Is it really coming to get us?~ Do you have glotrot? Do you have ironshank? Do you have funglefection? Have you ever had them? Is it gross? Can I see?~ Is it true that kendren sometimes die of cooking too hard?~ Kendren! Kendren! Take me with you! I want to see the Sixty Stilts!

string.ID: Daughter of Exile?

strings.string: ▶Daughter of Exile?

string.ID:
Tinker-nuns. The world sees fit to call us that, my sisters and me.
Do you know the story told of Rebekah the Exile? She was a teacher to Resheph, but he excommunicated her from the sultanate and banished her from the realm.
To know her, I've chosen a life of unbelonging. And among my sisters, I have the honor of permanent residence by her gravesite.
I'll tell you this, traveler: the shape of a society is visible only from the outside, and there is peace beyond a boundary.

strings.string:
▶Tinker-nuns. The world sees fit to call us that, my sisters and me.
Do you know the story told of Rebekah the Exile? She was a teacher to Resheph, but he excommunicated her from the sultanate and banished her from the realm.
To know her, I've chosen a life of unbelonging. And among my sisters, I have the honor of permanent residence by her gravesite.
I'll tell you this, traveler: the shape of a society is visible only from the outside, and there is peace beyond a boundary.

string.ID: Wasn't Rebekah a healer? Why are you an order of tinkers?

strings.string: ▶Wasn't Rebekah a healer? Why are you an order of tinkers?

string.ID:
{{emote|*Yla Haj pauses.*}}
You presume too narrow a meaning of "health".

strings.string:
▶{{emote|*Yla Haj pauses.*}}
You presume too narrow a meaning of "health".

string.ID:
Ezra sits in the shadow of history, where small things grow. It's the moss beneath the statue, quite literally. For centuries monarchs concerned themselves with felling trees, and now of the Covenate only Ezra remains.
It's home to Rebekah's gravesite, so for the Daughters, it is a sacred place. You may notice more of us on pilgrimage.

strings.string:
▶Ezra sits in the shadow of history, where small things grow. It's the moss beneath the statue, quite literally. For centuries monarchs concerned themselves with felling trees, and now of the Covenate only Ezra remains.
It's home to Rebekah's gravesite, so for the Daughters, it is a sacred place. You may notice more of us on pilgrimage.

string.ID:
Zothom. I don't see utility in unkindness, but he's a fool. Were it that proximity to meekness made one meek...
I have no use for a man who seeks salvation in the body of a dead woman.

string.ID:
I was once a vile graverobber, the lowest of the low. Years ago I sought to plunder the Tomb of the Eaters, and set off to do so with a pair of confederates. I watched both of them die, slain by ancient artifice and entombed with the ancient dead.
I would have shared their fate, but for a coterie of mopango nesting in the catacombs. They kept me safe and fed me while I treated my wounds. It is in their honor that I seek a credo now.

strings.string:
▶I was once a vile graverobber, the lowest of the low. Years ago I sought to plunder the Tomb of the Eaters, and set off to do so with a pair of confederates. I watched both of them die, slain by ancient artifice and entombed with the ancient dead.
I would have shared their fate, but for a coterie of mopango nesting in the catacombs. They kept me safe and fed me while I treated my wounds. It is in their honor that I seek a credo now.

▶Credo?

If you make it inside, the mopango will offer you solace and knowledge, and can tell you more about the Tomb's contents.

string.ID:
Yes. It is a rite of passage for the mopango people: a statement that inspires contemplation, discussion, and thought. An ideal credo has no single explanation or interpretation and is meant to inspire contemplation in those who hear it. For this reason, it is considered rude among mopango to ask the meaning of a credo.
Someday I will find mine.

For this reason, it is considered rude among mopango to ask the meaning of a credo.
Someday I will find mine.

string.ID: I need to enter the Tomb of the Eaters.

string.ID:
Mopango are plated, digging creatures whose armor scales glow a pale white. They are contemplative, sociable, and mostly peaceful. They commune with ancient objects, which is why a coterie of their kind lives in the Tomb of the Eaters.
They are patient even with rough-hewn wanderers such as we, but it's still not best to ask one to explain eir credo.

strings.string:

string.ID:
If you do find =player.reflexive= in the Tomb, the mopango settlement is nestled in the wall of the Northwest Catacombs. The entrance is guarded by a chain turret named Vivira, brightly-painted to distinguish em from eir brethren.
Resist your reflexive urge to fight or flee, as Vivira is friendly and open to parley. If you meet, tell em I sent you.

string.ID:
Rebekah was a physician, and an advisor to Resheph until she lost his favor. When, after years of exile, she lost her voice and her life, she was buried here, an outsider unfit to be interred with the honored dead. So she rests here.
I believe her proximity will help me find my credo.

string.ID: Lilypad-folk, you say. The slynth, you say. HA..... HA HA HA! Yes! I never thought to see yet fresher thought-sprouts take seed here in Ezra, but our sun is theirs, and the sky below it, and the thickening air down to the ground. Bring them to hear the songs of our musa-herders, and hope that they survive.

string.ID: I tally so many autumns, but until I am black with rot, I cannot be ring-right. The etching on my undertrunk places my seed-date to the reign of =sultan:4=, so I am told.

strings.string: ▶I tally so many autumns, but until I am black with rot, I cannot be ring-right. The etching on my undertrunk places my seed-date to the reign of =sultan:4=, so I am told.

string.ID: HA. I stood long enough. I joggled my fingers at the salt sky, and I watched thy seedlings sprout and wither, and I watched thou place stones in straight lines like the bees and their nests of wax. I stood until the stones were nigh by me. The people followed the stones.

strings.string: ▶HA. I stood long enough. I joggled my fingers at the salt sky, and I watched thy seedlings sprout and wither, and I watched thou place stones in straight lines like the bees and their nests of wax. I stood until the stones were nigh by me. The people followed the stones.

string.ID:
Ezra is more than tree-old. It's stone-old. Seedlings have lived here since our roots dreamed of joggling their fingers at the salt sky.
They ate earth and belched freight at the stars, and this place was their stomach.
Later, as the Star-Tree died and they buried their dead under its roots, this was their funerary place.
Now, we nurse electric milk from the old and aching temple to turn our wheels and grind our seeds and grains. Now we are they.

strings.string:
▶Ezra is more than tree-old. It's stone-old. Seedlings have lived here since our roots dreamed of joggling their fingers at the salt sky.
They ate earth and belched freight at the stars, and this place was their stomach.
Later, as the Star-Tree died and they buried their dead under its roots, this was their funerary place.
Now, we nurse electric milk from the old and aching temple to turn our wheels and grind our seeds and grains. Now we are they.
▶Star-Tree?

string.ID: Aye, the Blue Mother who breaks the sky. Those who Eat called her Gjaus, and those who Wake call her Spindle.

strings.string: ▶Aye, the Blue Mother who breaks the sky. Those who Eat called her Gjaus, and those who Wake call her Spindle.

string.ID: One called 1-FF, who wandered in errancy out from the Tomb and was reprogrammed by the Daughter who lived and died in the rot-black box, nine Daughters ago.

strings.string: ▶One called 1-FF, who wandered in errancy out from the Tomb and was reprogrammed by the Daughter who lived and died in the rot-black box, nine Daughters ago.

string.ID: To the northwest seek the rot-black box. There a plant and Daughter live. There cats of chrome purr at tiny suns.

strings.string: ▶To the northwest seek the rot-black box. There a plant and Daughter live. There cats of chrome purr at tiny suns.

string.ID:
Ezra is old and has long since cut a groove into the world and resides there in stillness and harmony. But Zothom the Penitent One is a seedling, new to the world, and he quakes at all the tensing the world does. Perhaps you can share in his angst.
Go find him by the headstones for the dead.

string.ID:
Oh, I'm fine, fine.
I simply adore being assigned this stinking backwater musa grove after decades of service, unceremoniously dumped in an office next to a fleshy tinker who works day and night, making all manner of racket through the thinnest, most conductive walls ever crafted.
What is it humans say? "Living the dreen?" Yes, I am living the dreen.

string.ID:
Mopango are witnesses of the past and shepherds of the future. We seek peace and harmony through understanding the Kasaphescence and Her many children. We nonetheless eschew conformity, and each of us seeketh a personal credo by which we livest our lives.
But I am a poor teacher. Speak to Agyra, and =ifplayerplural:ye shall:thou shalt= gain better understanding.

string.ID:
=ifplayerplural:Ye have:Thou hast= changed the world, =factionaddress:Mopango=. These strange beings have been confined for thousands of years, and =ifplayerplural:ye have:thou hast= given one a voice.
If Nacham is as wise as Doyoba believes, we stand to learn much very soon. Perhaps our coterie will spread the knowledge we gain, and we become a step closer to the Kasaphescence.
=ifplayerplural:Ye are:Thou'rt= welcome to visit and stay here whenever =ifplayerplural:ye will:thou wilt=.

string.ID:
=ifplayerplural:Ye have:Thou hast= changed the world, =factionaddress:Mopango=. These strange beings have been confined for thousands of years, and =ifplayerplural:ye have:thou hast= given one a voice.
That said, I am uncertain what changes to expect. Dost the ancient Va'am yet have the capacity to defend, or protect? Can we gift it with a better means for transportation? I'll speak to Dadogom of this, and time shall reveal all.
=ifplayerplural:Ye are:Thou'rt= welcome to visit and stay here whenever =ifplayerplural:ye will:thou wilt=.

=ifplayerplural:Ye have:Thou hast= changed the world, =factionaddress:Mopango=. These strange beings have been confined for thousands of years, and =ifplayerplural:ye have:thou hast= given one a voice.
I find myself amused at Kah's 'rest', for it appeareth as active as ever--far more so than I, ever. But running free and running unwillingly are certainly not the same. Perhaps, in time, it can learn a deeper rest from us.

string.ID:

string.ID:
=ifplayerplural:Seek-ye:Seekest-thou= the repulsive device, then?
k-Goninon, ancient and venerated gelatinous cupola, doth patrol the catacombs. Arrived centuries ere we discovered this place, k-Goninon hath hardened and eateth not through the floor, and yet it eateth prodigiously. Safe from the conservators, as k-Goninon long ago consumed the Mark of Death itself.
Please be careful. k-Goninon hath devoured watchers and wouldst devour =ifplayerplural:ye:thee= as well.

string.ID:
We are mopango: witnesses of the past and shepherds of the future. The Sacred Light of the Kasaphescence shineth within us, and we commune with relics of antiquity to maintain our humility and grow our wisdom.
We believe that one day, with enough knowledge, anyone who seeketh the Light shalt find it within emself. In the meantime, we work to become better and brighter as each one of us findeth a personal credo by which to live.

strings.string:
▶We are mopango: witnesses of the past and shepherds of the future. The Sacred Light of the Kasaphescence shineth within us, and we commune with relics of antiquity to maintain our humility and grow our wisdom.
We believe that one day, with enough knowledge, anyone who seeketh the Light shalt find it within emself. In the meantime, we work to become better and brighter as each one of us findeth a personal credo by which to live.
▶Emself?
▶Credo?

string.ID: Why do you speak so strangely?

strings.string: ▶Why do you speak so strangely?

string.ID: Why do some of you have wheels?

strings.string: ▶Why do some of you have wheels?

string.ID: What do you know about the Tomb?

strings.string: ▶What do you know about the Tomb?

string.ID:
Aye. Ey, em, eir, eirs, emself. Thusly do we call ourselves and one another.
Sex is personal and mattereth not to a bare acquaintence. Gender is a societal relic in which we see no current utility.

strings.string:
▶Aye. Ey, em, eir, eirs, emself. Thusly do we call ourselves and one another.
Sex is personal and mattereth not to a bare acquaintence. Gender is a societal relic in which we see no current utility.

string.ID: I see. I have further questions.

strings.string: ▶I see. I have further questions.

string.ID: Oh. Live and drink.

strings.string: ▶Oh. Live and drink.

string.ID:
The Tomb of the Eaters consisteth of twelve strata, or ten, once =ifplayerplural:ye account:thou accounteth= for transitional levels: the Folk Catacombs (in which =ifplayerplural:ye currently stand:thou currently standeth=), the Crematory and Columbarium, the Two Crypts, and the Six Tombs of Qud's Sultans above.
An =ifplayerplural:ye seek:thou seekest= fortune here, gird =ifplayerplural:thyselves:thyself= for disappointment. The tomb playeth host to objects wondrous and profane alike, but little of what surface-dwellers considereth treasure.

strings.string:
▶The Tomb of the Eaters consisteth of twelve strata, or ten, once =ifplayerplural:ye account:thou accounteth= for transitional levels: the Folk Catacombs (in which =ifplayerplural:ye currently stand:thou currently standeth=), the Crematory and Columbarium, the Two Crypts, and the Six Tombs of Qud's Sultans above.
An =ifplayerplural:ye seek:thou seekest= fortune here, gird =ifplayerplural:thyselves:thyself= for disappointment. The tomb playeth host to objects wondrous and profane alike, but little of what surface-dwellers considereth treasure.

string.ID: 'Wondrous and profane?' Now I'm curious.

strings.string: ▶'Wondrous and profane?' Now I'm curious.

string.ID: I see. I have further questions.

strings.string: ▶I see. I have further questions.

string.ID: I thank you. Live and drink.

strings.string: ▶I thank you. Live and drink.

string.ID:
Aye. One's own credo shouldst inspire reflection and thought, with no clear-cut meaning but meaning nonetheless. Some of our coterie yet seeketh theirs, but an experienced watcher no doubt hath one. Any mopango who hath a credo wilt share it with =ifplayerplural:ye:thee=, an =ifplayerplural:ye request:thou requesteth= it.
My credo is: "Malice alone staineth the sanctity of questioning."

strings.string:
▶Aye. One's own credo shouldst inspire reflection and thought, with no clear-cut meaning but meaning nonetheless. Some of our coterie yet seeketh theirs, but an experienced watcher no doubt hath one. Any mopango who hath a credo wilt share it with =ifplayerplural:ye:thee=, an =ifplayerplural:ye request:thou requesteth= it.
My credo is: "Malice alone staineth the sanctity of questioning."

string.ID:
I cannot simply explain my credo to =ifplayerplural:ye:thee=. A credo informeth and confoundeth at once, and must be reflected upon by the listener.
=ifplayerplural:Ye are:Thou art= inexperienced in our ways, so please bear my words in the kind spirit they are meant: to ask a mopango to explain eir credo is to commit one of our few taboo acts. Be advised.

string.ID:
I admire =ifplayerplural:your:thy= curiosity and hope =ifplayerplural:your:thy= prudence informeth it.
I have an example at hand. Mere days ago, one of our coterie named Lebah happened upon a repulsive device. Ey was so shaken after attempting communion with the object that ey hath spent less time away from eir nook than ever.

I have an example at hand. Mere days ago, one of our coterie named Lebah happened upon a repulsive device. Ey was so shaken after attempting communion with the object that ey hath spent less time away from eir nook than ever.

string.ID:
Our little sanctuary here hath a fissure in its inner walls. Find that gap and =ifplayerplural:ye will:thou wilt= find Lebah.
Please be gentle. Ey hath ever been the most insightful reader among us, but beareth the weight of an anxious mind.

aye.

string.ID:
Not... the device. Repulsive as a key to a prison doth repulse. To know a key is to know of a prison.
Our watched children are bound, and lock swalloweth key. An =ifplayerplural:ye free:thou freest= one, three remaineth forever.
k-Goninon hath it now. An =ifplayerplural:ye seek:thou seekest=.

string.ID: I am Doyoba, proud watcher of the children of the tomb. One child in particular. Of course =ifplayerplural:ye:thou= must comprehend, 'child' is but a fabricated epithet, as they are far older than we. The children are, that is.

string.ID: We mopango watch the past, each of us a different facet. My charge is named Nacham, that which watcheth and understandeth not, that which speaketh and cannot be understood. Information floweth through Nacham as water through a sieve, mixed together beyond ken.

string.ID:
{{emote|*Doyoba's face scrunches in pain as ey communes with the device, before finally pushing it back into your grasp*}}
By her light, that was unpleasant. How it twisted and turned, leading me to visions of Nacham's past, scraps and flashes. I can discern only glimpses of significance. Once a creator, an innovator. Can these parts of itself return intact, under the device's influence? An thou sendest void away, hast thou lost a part of thee?

string.ID:
I have volunteered to monitor an ancient machine-creature called Kah. Perhaps =ifplayerplural:ye have:thou hast= seen it, skipping hither and yon on strange limbs.
Often I wonder if Kah knoweth aught else but fear.

string.ID:
{{emote|*Gyamyo moves little during communion, but shivers and twitches from time to time. After a minute or so, ey returns the device to you.*}}
I am shaken. No doubt my journey wast shallow compared to Lebah's dive. But now, by my troth I say: Kah hath ever been a being of motion. Swift, kinetic, and elegant. No doubt 'twould be so if freed by yon device.

Still, I hope to see more of =ifplayerplural:ye:thee= in my future. =ifplayerplural:Ye are:Thou'rt= welcome back, an =ifplayerplural:ye survive:thou surviveth=.

string.ID: Are you all right?

strings.string: ▶Are you all right?

string.ID:
Yes. =ifplayerplural:Ye have:Thou hast= quelled the mania.
I can focus. I can render sensible the things I have seen and heard now, though I remember little of my time before the mania. Was I artisan? Teacher? I possessed great knowledge that this shell twisted into a prison. I thank =ifplayerplural:ye:thee= for the gift of =ifplayerplural:your:thy= untwisting.

strings.string:
▶Yes. =ifplayerplural:Ye have:Thou hast= quelled the mania.
I can focus. I can render sensible the things I have seen and heard now, though I remember little of my time before the mania. Was I artisan? Teacher? I possessed great knowledge that this shell twisted into a prison. I thank =ifplayerplural:ye:thee= for the gift of =ifplayerplural:your:thy= untwisting.

string.ID: What will you do now?

strings.string: ▶What will you do now?

string.ID:
The mopango have cared for me whilst I could not care for myself, giving me the only name I now know. I will stay to help them. This chassis is a prison no longer, and perhaps deeper truths may yet be found within it.
To =ifplayerplural:ye:thee=, new friend, I offer a piece of this former prison that =ifplayerplural:ye may:thou mayest= find useful, along with my thanks.

strings.string:

string.ID: Are you all right?

strings.string: ▶Are you all right?

string.ID:
Though I be a pale shadow of the self I once was, yes. My condition and outlook are both substantially improved.
I recall few details of my life before. I was influential, one whose words stirred hearts to action. For so long I had no means to speak, trapped in my own moods. =ifplayerplural:Ye have:Thou hast= freed me from a dire fate.

strings.string:
▶Though I be a pale shadow of the self I once was, yes. My condition and outlook are both substantially improved.
I recall few details of my life before. I was influential, one whose words stirred hearts to action. For so long I had no means to speak, trapped in my own moods. =ifplayerplural:Ye have:Thou hast= freed me from a dire fate.

string.ID: What will you do now?

strings.string: ▶What will you do now?

string.ID:
I know not. Perhaps I can lead again. These creatures that looked after me, named me, kept me safe. The mopango.
They are kind, but weak. Perhaps I can teach them. Spur them to be greater.
But for =ifplayerplural:ye:thee=, I must even our score. Take this piece of my chassis. Wear it with confidence. Command in my name.

strings.string:

string.ID:
I am weary to my core, but at last this once-hateful body obeyeth me. I thank =ifplayerplural:ye:thee= for restoring my autonomy.
Memory of my once-self doth elude me, but I recognize the irony of my punishment. Once a strider, then sentenced to stride without restraint, forever. I knew only fear and flight. No more.

strings.string:
▶I am weary to my core, but at last this once-hateful body obeyeth me. I thank =ifplayerplural:ye:thee= for restoring my autonomy.

string.ID:
I shall enjoy my free mobility freely, for a time. After that, I know not. I may speak to these mopango creatures that named me, and find a purpose with them. I cannot ever repay their care, but perhaps I may repay =ifplayerplural:yours:thine=.
I wouldst fain offer =ifplayerplural:ye:thee= a fragment of this form come loose. =ifplayerplural:May ye:Mayst thou= ever run free.

string.ID:
{{emote|*The clothes shrouding Rainwater Shomer's form are still for many moments.*}}
The shomrim connen. Why oghte we?

▶{{emote|*The clothes shrouding Rainwater Shomer's form are still for many moments.*}}
The shomrim connen. Why oghte we?

string.ID: Because... I am a Saad, after all.

strings.string: ▶Because... I am a Saad, after all.

string.ID: Shomer, you impudent whelp! Saad Resheph stands before you. Do as I say.

strings.string: ▶Shomer, you impudent whelp! Saad Resheph stands before you. Do as I say.

string.ID: Something changed atop the Spindle. If Brightsheol is indeed connected to the city there, then this change may suggest it's in peril...

strings.string: ▶Something changed atop the Spindle. If Brightsheol is indeed connected to the city there, then this change may suggest it's in peril...

string.ID: Wait. I have more questions to ask.

strings.string: ▶Wait. I have more questions to ask.

string.ID:
{{emote|*The clothes shrouding Rainwater Shomer's form are still for many moments.*}}
The shomrim remainen unbilefful.

▶{{emote|*The clothes shrouding Rainwater Shomer's form are still for many moments.*}}

string.ID: One year ago, someone began broadcasting a signal from atop the Spindle. I have a recording of it here...

strings.string: ▶One year ago, someone began broadcasting a signal from atop the Spindle. I have a recording of it here...

string.ID: {{emote|*The clothes shrouding Rainwater Shomer's form remain still.*}}

strings.string: ▶{{emote|*The clothes shrouding Rainwater Shomer's form remain still.*}}

string.ID: I ask you: disable the magnetic field so that the Spindle can be ascended and the signal investigated.

strings.string: ▶I ask you: disable the magnetic field so that the Spindle can be ascended and the signal investigated.

string.ID:
{{emote|*The clothes shrouding Rainwater Shomer's form are still for many moments.*}}
Saad, the Seraph sprecen. Saad, thu asken, and the shomrim assenten. Saad, wiltou return to Salum or crossen in-to Brightsheol?

strings.string:
▶{{emote|*The clothes shrouding Rainwater Shomer's form are still for many moments.*}}
Saad, the Seraph sprecen. Saad, thu asken, and the shomrim assenten. Saad, wiltou return to Salum or crossen in-to Brightsheol?

string.ID: If it can be done, return me to Qud. I wish to ascend the Spindle myself.

strings.string: ▶If it can be done, return me to Qud. I wish to ascend the Spindle myself.

string.ID: ... I've shaken the wet life from my hair. Now I shall cross into Brightsheol.

strings.string: ▶... I've shaken the wet life from my hair. Now I shall cross into Brightsheol.

string.ID: I need time to consider.

strings.string: ▶I need time to consider.

string.ID: Saad, nou-then return.

strings.string: ▶Saad, nou-then return.

string.ID: I am ready.

strings.string: ▶I am ready.

string.ID: I need time to reconsider.

strings.string: ▶I need time to reconsider.

string.ID: Saad, nou-then crossen in-to Brightsheol.

string.ID: I am ready.

strings.string: ▶I am ready.

string.ID: I need time to reconsider.

string.ID:
The engraving is done, Moloch! I do hope it's to your liking. Your deeds are incised here for all time.
You may now enter the sarcophagus, Moloch. Be at peace.

strings.string:
▶The engraving is done, Moloch! I do hope it's to your liking. Your deeds are incised here for all time.
You may now enter the sarcophagus, Moloch. Be at peace.
▶Farewell.

string.ID:
Now, uh... hop... hop into the sarcophagus.
Safe travels.

strings.string:
▶Now, uh... hop... hop into the sarcophagus.
Safe travels.
▶Farewell.

string.ID: .....oh... oh? Peace to all who canter in the House of the Coiled Lamb.

strings.string: ▶.....oh... oh? Peace to all who canter in the House of the Coiled Lamb.

string.ID: Who are you?

strings.string: ▶Who are you?

string.ID: Do you know the Mark of Death?

strings.string: ▶Do you know the Mark of Death?

string.ID: How do I get to Brightsheol?

strings.string: ▶How do I get to Brightsheol?

string.ID: Why is this tomb unfinished?

strings.string: ▶Why is this tomb unfinished?

string.ID:
...oh..... I am Herododicus, lapidary, lithographer, sculptor, calciminer, and biographer to the Coiled Lamb. I will tarry here until the Godhead passes on, and then I will canonize his deeds in high relief.
I've tarried for quite some time, now.... What a prodigious reign! Bless that Coiled Lamb!

strings.string:
▶...oh..... I am Herododicus, lapidary, lithographer, sculptor, calciminer, and biographer to the Coiled Lamb. I will tarry here until the Godhead passes on, and then I will canonize his deeds in high relief.
I've tarried for quite some time, now.... What a prodigious reign! Bless that Coiled Lamb!

string.ID: The sultanate is dissolved. Resheph rules no longer.

strings.string: ▶The sultanate is dissolved. Resheph rules no longer.

string.ID:
.....oh.... oh.... Poor friend. The ironshank must be upsetting your digestion. The darkness must be blooming in your brain, making you slow and doltish.
The sultanate dissolved? Tidings would have reached me.... someone would have said so....
Oh... poor, doltish friend. You cantered too long outside the House of the Coiled Lamb, and now you are a dolt.

strings.string:
▶.....oh.... oh.... Poor friend. The ironshank must be upsetting your digestion. The darkness must be blooming in your brain, making you slow and doltish.
The sultanate dissolved? Tidings would have reached me.... someone would have said so....
Oh... poor, doltish friend. You cantered too long outside the House of the Coiled Lamb, and now you are a dolt.

string.ID: It is a test. Tell me the answer now.

strings.string: ▶It is a test. Tell me the answer now.

string.ID: I want to ask you something else.

strings.string: ▶I want to ask you something else.

string.ID:
{{emote|Herododicus whirrs fearfully.}}
The Mark is =MarkOfDeath=.

strings.string:
▶{{emote|Herododicus whirrs fearfully.}}
The Mark is =MarkOfDeath=.

string.ID:
Oh! Brightsheol? The forever braid of life? The Garden Behind the High Gate? Why, you must rank among the crown echelon of machine and folk, and you must... well, you must...
Start to decompose. You must... You must be dead. Dead and entombed. The body remains, but the mind wanders...

strings.string:
▶Oh! Brightsheol? The forever braid of life? The Garden Behind the High Gate? Why, you must rank among the crown echelon of machine and folk, and you must... well, you must...
Start to decompose. You must... You must be dead. Dead and entombed. The body remains, but the mind wanders...

string.ID: You must be dead? Is that truly the only way?

strings.string: ▶You must be dead? Is that truly the only way?

string.ID: I bear the Mark. Entomb me.

strings.string: ▶I bear the Mark. Entomb me.

string.ID:
{{emote|Herododicus pauses.}}
Ye... yes? Is this a test? I suppose you... could we... could we have been in Brightsheol all along? Is that the answer?

strings.string:
▶{{emote|Herododicus pauses.}}
Ye... yes? Is this a test? I suppose you... could we... could we have been in Brightsheol all along? Is that the answer?

string.ID: Wrong on both counts. Resheph stands before you. Entomb me.

strings.string: ▶Wrong on both counts. Resheph stands before you. Entomb me.

string.ID: Resheph is gone, biographer. I am here, and I have need to travel to Brightsheol. Entomb me.

strings.string: ▶Resheph is gone, biographer. I am here, and I have need to travel to Brightsheol. Entomb me.

string.ID: Of course not. Let's back up.

strings.string: ▶Of course not. Let's back up.

string.ID:
That's not even how it works!
First, I image your head, read your self's narrative from the folds of your brain, cross-check it against the Thin World's ambient log of your life's deeds...
Then I... stylize... the story, and I engrave it on the walls. Once I'm done... then you can entomb =player.reflexive=.

strings.string:
▶That's not even how it works!
First, I image your head, read your self's narrative from the folds of your brain, cross-check it against the Thin World's ambient log of your life's deeds...
Then I... stylize... the story, and I engrave it on the walls. Once I'm done... then you can entomb =player.reflexive=.

string.ID: Do that then.

strings.string: ▶Do that then.

string.ID: Hold on. I have more to ask.

strings.string: ▶Hold on. I have more to ask.

string.ID: You are forgiven. Now entomb me.

strings.string: ▶You are forgiven. Now entomb me.

string.ID: I've misled you, biographer. I have another question.

strings.string: ▶I've misled you, biographer. I have another question.

string.ID:
Moloch! Allow me to explain the deification procedure, as it is clearly beneath your station to know!
First, I must image the great Moloch's head, read your self's narrative from the folds of =ifplayerplural:your:thy= Holiest Brain, cross-check it against the Thin World's ambient log of His Eminence's life's deeds...
{{emote|*Herododicus whispers*}} I'm sure your version is the better one, Moloch...

strings.string:
▶Moloch! Allow me to explain the deification procedure, as it is clearly beneath your station to know!
First, I must image the great Moloch's head, read your self's narrative from the folds of =ifplayerplural:your:thy= Holiest Brain, cross-check it against the Thin World's ambient log of His Eminence's life's deeds...
{{emote|*Herododicus whispers*}} I'm sure your version is the better one, Moloch...

string.ID: Then I... stylize... the story, and I engrave it on the walls. Once I'm finished, the sarcophagus will open, and you can lay =player.reflexive= to rest!

strings.string: ▶Then I... stylize... the story, and I engrave it on the walls. Once I'm finished, the sarcophagus will open, and you can lay =player.reflexive= to rest!

string.ID: Do it then.

strings.string: ▶Do it then.

string.ID: Commencing cross-check with the Thin World annals............

strings.string: ▶Commencing cross-check with the Thin World annals............

string.ID:
Cross-check complete. Your narrative is compiled. Now to engrave it.
Peace.... peace to all who canter in the House of the Coiled Lamb.

strings.string:
▶Cross-check complete. Your narrative is compiled. Now to engrave it.
Peace.... peace to all who canter in the House of the Coiled Lamb.

string.ID: Peace, biographer.

strings.string: ▶Peace, biographer.

string.ID: Commencing cross-check with the Thin World annals............

strings.string: ▶Commencing cross-check with the Thin World annals............

string.ID:
Cross-check complete. Your narrative is compiled, Moloch. Now to go engrave it.
Peace.... peace to all who canter in the House of the Coiled... in Your House, Moloch.

strings.string:
▶Cross-check complete. Your narrative is compiled, Moloch. Now to go engrave it.
Peace.... peace to all who canter in the House of the Coiled... in Your House, Moloch.

string.ID: Peace, biographer.

strings.string: ▶Peace, biographer.

string.ID:
'Tis a saying among the stonemasons, "Never finish a job too early." By the decretum of Sagittar, old as it is, they have until the Coiled Lamb is... is decom-.. passed... decompassed.... dead, deadlike... to complete their work on the Tomb.
Bless the Coiled Lamb, peace to those who canter in his house, and let us pray the day never comes!

strings.string:
▶'Tis a saying among the stonemasons, "Never finish a job too early." By the decretum of Sagittar, old as it is, they have until the Coiled Lamb is... is decom-.. passed... decompassed.... dead, deadlike... to complete their work on the Tomb.
Bless the Coiled Lamb, peace to those who canter in his house, and let us pray the day never comes!

string.ID: But Resheph is dead. The sultanate is dissolved.

strings.string: ▶But Resheph is dead. The sultanate is dissolved.

string.ID: Live and drink, friend. rrk come to the Yd, shared together. Feel safe and free as woodsmoke.

strings.string: ▶Live and drink, friend. rrk come to the Yd, shared together. Feel safe and free as woodsmoke.

string.ID: Greetings, Goek!

strings.string: ▶Greetings, Goek!

string.ID: Who are you?

strings.string: ▶Who are you?

string.ID: You tower over every other frog I've seen. Are you svardym?

strings.string: ▶You tower over every other frog I've seen. Are you svardym?

string.ID: These shining pipes! What are they?

strings.string: ▶These shining pipes! What are they?

string.ID: What can you tell me about Yd?

strings.string: ▶What can you tell me about Yd?

string.ID: rrk knows of the glow-hats! Yd-friends see glimpses at night, about the reef.

strings.string: ▶rrk knows of the glow-hats! Yd-friends see glimpses at night, about the reef.

string.ID: If you would have them, I ask that you grant them sanctuary.

strings.string: ▶If you would have them, I ask that you grant them sanctuary.

string.ID: If you would have them, I ask that you grant them sanctuary.

strings.string: ▶If you would have them, I ask that you grant them sanctuary.

string.ID: Boon-friend asks a friend-boon, and what boon is friend! rrk welcome slynth to an Yd, be safe and free as woodsmoke.

strings.string: ▶Boon-friend asks a friend-boon, and what boon is friend! rrk welcome slynth to an Yd, be safe and free as woodsmoke.

string.ID: You have my thanks, Goek.

strings.string: ▶You have my thanks, Goek.

string.ID: Ah! rrk would grant you this boon, rrk would. Were not for the unspoken cries of future-kin, free as woodsmoke but no more safe so longer. rrk would and cannot.

strings.string: ▶Ah! rrk would grant you this boon, rrk would. Were not for the unspoken cries of future-kin, free as woodsmoke but no more safe so longer. rrk would and cannot.

string.ID: rrk wonder of the glow-hats. Which wind will blow.

strings.string: ▶rrk wonder of the glow-hats. Which wind will blow.

string.ID: Greetings, =player.formalAddressTerm=! How arresting of the glow-hats arrival, much to do. rrk soothe Mak, Bep, Krka, look stores, still much slime and sweat to pool below rrk. Enjoy helpful toil!

strings.string: ▶Greetings, =player.formalAddressTerm=! How arresting of the glow-hats arrival, much to do. rrk soothe Mak, Bep, Krka, look stores, still much slime and sweat to pool below rrk. Enjoy helpful toil!

string.ID: My thanks, Goek.

strings.string: ▶My thanks, Goek.

string.ID:
All is well, =name=! Trials make for overcoming, and done together.
rrk can tell the sky dark and not know. Visit and witness! Glow-hats enliven the night, safe and free. Slynth-home is Yd.

strings.string:
▶All is well, =name=! Trials make for overcoming, and done together.
rrk can tell the sky dark and not know. Visit and witness! Glow-hats enliven the night, safe and free. Slynth-home is Yd.

string.ID: My thanks again, Goek.

strings.string: ▶My thanks again, Goek.

string.ID:
{{emote|*reeeeeps joyfully*}}
Greetings, =name=! Live and drink, friend.

strings.string:
▶{{emote|*reeeeeps joyfully*}}
Greetings, =name=! Live and drink, friend.

string.ID: rrk is called by dwellers Goek. rrk is a dweller here, too, and before then, a builder of place. Goek, Geeub, Mak and Many Eyes build a new Yd in the reef, hundreds of years.

strings.string: ▶rrk is called by dwellers Goek. rrk is a dweller here, too, and before then, a builder of place. Goek, Geeub, Mak and Many Eyes build a new Yd in the reef, hundreds of years.

string.ID: rrk did before then, but rrk all build it now.

strings.string: ▶rrk did before then, but rrk all build it now.

string.ID: rrk is svardym like the hatchling from the egg, but wound down the chute of years in hundreds, and grown so long and warty! rrk was a hatchling once, cries to think on it!

strings.string: ▶rrk is svardym like the hatchling from the egg, but wound down the chute of years in hundreds, and grown so long and warty! rrk was a hatchling once, cries to think on it!

string.ID: Aren't the svardym one of the Gyre plagues?

strings.string: ▶Aren't the svardym one of the Gyre plagues?

string.ID: Yes rrk was once, "plague" in the sky hundreds of years. Not so now. Longtime rrk, Geeub, Mak hide in the sponge and eat lice. When find Many Eyes, rrk and friends built the Yd. Joyful helping!

strings.string: ▶Yes rrk was once, "plague" in the sky hundreds of years. Not so now. Longtime rrk, Geeub, Mak hide in the sponge and eat lice. When find Many Eyes, rrk and friends built the Yd. Joyful helping!

string.ID: Do you know anything of the other plagues?

strings.string: ▶Do you know anything of the other plagues?

string.ID: Plagues bloom a thousand year then die back, shrink under the earth-sponge or move here and east. Vanta, girshling, rot die. rrk the hatchling once saw the Nephilim loom! rrk frightened and hid inside a sponge for thirty moons.

strings.string: ▶Plagues bloom a thousand year then die back, shrink under the earth-sponge or move here and east. Vanta, girshling, rot die. rrk the hatchling once saw the Nephilim loom! rrk frightened and hid inside a sponge for thirty moons.

string.ID: Do you know anything of the other plagues?

strings.string: ▶Do you know anything of the other plagues?

string.ID: Water and gas piped through the Yd to feed the plants, dwellers, and machines! Dwellers blew the glass in hues like the prism perch, to look pretty. Shared together. Joyful helping!

strings.string: ▶Water and gas piped through the Yd to feed the plants, dwellers, and machines! Dwellers blew the glass in hues like the prism perch, to look pretty. Shared together. Joyful helping!

string.ID:
rrk read the signs and descend the stairs. rrk breathe the water smoke and sit on starfish.
Visit hovels, meet friends Mak, Geeub, Bep, Krka, Une, Tilli, farmer Rokhas, and every rest!
rrk rrkself.

strings.string:
▶rrk read the signs and descend the stairs. rrk breathe the water smoke and sit on starfish.
Visit hovels, meet friends Mak, Geeub, Bep, Krka, Une, Tilli, farmer Rokhas, and every rest!
rrk rrkself.

string.ID: What indignity have you come to heap upon the mound, whelp? Out with it.

strings.string: ▶What indignity have you come to heap upon the mound, whelp? Out with it.

string.ID: You're one of the founders of this freehold, aren't you?

strings.string: ▶You're one of the founders of this freehold, aren't you?

string.ID: Who are you?

strings.string: ▶Who are you?

string.ID: I've never seen a frog of your stature.

strings.string: ▶I've never seen a frog of your stature.

string.ID: What can you tell me about the Freehold?

strings.string: ▶What can you tell me about the Freehold?

string.ID: This pond is peaceful.

strings.string: ▶This pond is peaceful.
▶{{emote|*crrrk*}}

string.ID: What of it? Scurry on and leave me to brood.

strings.string: ▶What of it? Scurry on and leave me to brood.

string.ID: This seems a joyful place. Why are you angry?

strings.string: ▶This seems a joyful place. Why are you angry?

string.ID: I've something else to ask

strings.string: ▶I've something else to ask

string.ID:
Why? A lifetime of vexation. Born to a cacophony of static ringing the ears raw. Thousands of my kinfolk cut down by that porphyric wasp fools called Lamb. A millenium of hot stinking sun and disgusting brine lice for supper.
Misery obtains on this pond, whelp. By Chavvah if you start beaming like a sunray and yodeling at the Beetle Moon, I'll eat you where you stand.

strings.string:
▶Why? A lifetime of vexation. Born to a cacophony of static ringing the ears raw. Thousands of my kinfolk cut down by that porphyric wasp fools called Lamb. A millenium of hot stinking sun and disgusting brine lice for supper.
Misery obtains on this pond, whelp. By Chavvah if you start beaming like a sunray and yodeling at the Beetle Moon, I'll eat you where you stand.

string.ID: ...I've more to ask.

strings.string: ▶...I've more to ask.

string.ID: Who am I? Mak. That's all you get. I'll not waste the honey of my mouth on idle inquiries.

strings.string: ▶Who am I? Mak. That's all you get. I'll not waste the honey of my mouth on idle inquiries.

string.ID:
...
And? Is that the whole of your fool statement?

strings.string:
▶...
And? Is that the whole of your fool statement?
▶Yes.

string.ID: I'll ask something else.

strings.string: ▶I'll ask something else.

string.ID: Trust what you hear of the svardym, whelp. The sky blackens at our accession and we are like to eat you.

strings.string: ▶Trust what you hear of the svardym, whelp. The sky blackens at our accession and we are like to eat you.

string.ID: Have the adiyy chewed the hue from your eyes? See for yourself. Free folk make a gathering here and their racket rings through the reef. One can hardly steep in his greens without being mewled to by a salt-stung baby.

strings.string: ▶Have the adiyy chewed the hue from your eyes? See for yourself. Free folk make a gathering here and their racket rings through the reef. One can hardly steep in his greens without being mewled to by a salt-stung baby.

string.ID: It was once.

strings.string: ▶It was once.

string.ID: What happened?

strings.string: ▶What happened?

string.ID: Whelp, affix your eyes to that clam right yonder. Go step inside and find your answers.

strings.string: ▶Whelp, affix your eyes to that clam right yonder. Go step inside and find your answers.

string.ID:
{{emote|*long, smoky croak*}}
Ah, =player.formalAddressTerm=, here at last. Sit. Smoke. Rest.

strings.string:
▶{{emote|*long, smoky croak*}}
Ah, =player.formalAddressTerm=, here at last. Sit. Smoke. Rest.

string.ID: Sorry, have we already spoken?

strings.string: ▶Sorry, have we already spoken?

string.ID: You're one of the founders of this freehold, aren't you?

strings.string: ▶You're one of the founders of this freehold, aren't you?

string.ID: Who are you?

strings.string: ▶Who are you?

string.ID: I can't help but notice your impressive stature, even in repose.

strings.string: ▶I can't help but notice your impressive stature, even in repose.

string.ID: What can you tell me about Yd?

strings.string: ▶What can you tell me about Yd?

string.ID:
Ayup. But seconds ago. As only yesterday, no? Hoh hoh hoh.
{{emote|*continued croaking laughter*}}

strings.string:
▶Ayup. But seconds ago. As only yesterday, no? Hoh hoh hoh.
{{emote|*continued croaking laughter*}}
▶*laugh*

string.ID: Ah. Well. Let's talk about something else, then.

strings.string: ▶Ah. Well. Let's talk about something else, then.

string.ID: Oh, very funny. Live and drink.

strings.string: ▶Oh, very funny. Live and drink.

string.ID: Greetings, Geeub. I am =name=.

strings.string: ▶Greetings, Geeub. I am =name=.

string.ID:
{{emote|*croaking sigh*}}
Congratulation, condolence, which ever. Mind and name slip by another.

strings.string:
▶{{emote|*croaking sigh*}}
Congratulation, condolence, which ever. Mind and name slip by another.

string.ID:
So large? Hoh hoh. Well. Hatchlings, so rage-dense. Size diffuses, no?
However. Mak diverges, hoh hoh. Egg-rage simmers on a greater pot. Our voice eld-feeble, close your ears to it. Hoh hoh hoh.

strings.string:
▶So large? Hoh hoh. Well. Hatchlings, so rage-dense. Size diffuses, no?
However. Mak diverges, hoh hoh. Egg-rage simmers on a greater pot. Our voice eld-feeble, close your ears to it. Hoh hoh hoh.

string.ID:
Sun we once blotted out nestles our horizon. We tend thought-seeds with algae, wrap in crysteel, bathe in arc-light. Build, live, fight.
Here as elsewhere, grow is struggle. Fun to watch, no? Hoh. Hoh.

strings.string:
▶Sun we once blotted out nestles our horizon. We tend thought-seeds with algae, wrap in crysteel, bathe in arc-light. Build, live, fight.
Here as elsewhere, grow is struggle. Fun to watch, no? Hoh. Hoh.

string.ID: Yes, we were present, if less active than other-bodies. But we saw, and rattle with memory-artifacts as a Consortium lockbox rattles with jewels; shards of an eon-old data disk, bits of stories and places. Kin-fleeing, louse-meals, ghastly boredom. But Fate's caprice brought us through history's footsteps. There was a machine-speaker, and her ursine apprentice with his little plant, and the Sower with a tetrad of chubby whelps, and then, at last, Many-Eyes. Our dear galgal. So many.

strings.string: ▶Yes, we were present, if less active than other-bodies. But we saw, and rattle with memory-artifacts as a Consortium lockbox rattles with jewels; shards of an eon-old data disk, bits of stories and places. Kin-fleeing, louse-meals, ghastly boredom. But Fate's caprice brought us through history's footsteps. There was a machine-speaker, and her ursine apprentice with his little plant, and the Sower with a tetrad of chubby whelps, and then, at last, Many-Eyes. Our dear galgal. So many.

string.ID: But alas. Like our sea-grape friend's lockbox, these memories are not mine to retrieve at will. They come and go, and may be warped by eld.

strings.string: ▶But alas. Like our sea-grape friend's lockbox, these memories are not mine to retrieve at will. They come and go, and may be warped by eld.

string.ID:
Oh, I am hardly an unbiased observer, I'm afraid -- the Freehold is the only welcoming home I could ever have imagined for myself, and my home before was worse than most. I feel a freedom and responsibility here that I would know nowhere else. That no one else could ever know at all.
But bias aside, you can see for yourself that we are a collective thriving without hierarchy. I'm rightly proud to defend that.

strings.string:

But bias aside, you can see for yourself that we are a collective thriving without hierarchy. I'm rightly proud to defend that.

string.ID:
An old, old, old, old music machine.
Well, I suppose this one is not so old. This one I commissioned from a wandering artisan whose life I saved. A story for another time. Surely you've business.

string.ID: I'm not a dying animal.

string.ID:
You are a dying animal. So am I. We are all dying animals, scrabbling for what extra scraps of time we can grasp. Even the eons-old. We are each and every one of us a dying animal. Or plant. We all decay, is the point.
And the hurdy-gurdy doesn't like how you sound either, for what it is worth.

strings.string:
▶You are a dying animal. So am I. We are all dying animals, scrabbling for what extra scraps of time we can grasp. Even the eons-old. We are each and every one of us a dying animal. Or plant. We all decay, is the point.

string.ID:
Ugh, ever telepathy. No requirement exists that Consortium merchants be mind-speakers, as swollen with their numbers as we are. I cannot blame you for your surprise, mind, I am simply frustrated.
Over years, I shaped something akin to a voice-box, which you hear now. I "made do", as Rokhas might say. Now what may I "make do" for you?

string.ID:
Oh, I am joyous to reside here.
Yd could do, mind, with some measure of hierarchy, and more infrastructure, to attract wayfarers less adventuresome than yourself. Also, Mak absolutely must cease advising that anyone enter the clam; it is not funny and someone could die.
But... the structure of friendships here is true, and sturdy! Kindly keep this exchange between us. I was mostly kidding. Somewhat kidding.
